datosGenerales.descripcion: The Agorregi restaurant, located in the Igara district of San Sebastian, offers quality service and excellent seasonal product-based cuisine. Chef Gorka Arzelus, trained by the most important chefs in Basque cuisine, prepares his dishes with the best market ingredients.

José Miguel Olazabalaga, who was awarded with the Young Spanish Cook of the Year in 1998, is currently the Chef at the restaurant designed by architect Ricardo Legorreta.

The menu fuses together Basque traditional dishes and culinary avant-garde.

Located next to Euskalduna Palace, the restaurant has a terrace that overlooks Doña Casilda Park. Large selection of wines. Traditional based modern cuisine.

Since 1970, Pedro Subijana develops a personal cuisine, and the Akelarre restaurant has turned into a classic of Basque cuisine.

Located in the Igeldo district in San Sebastian, it offers spectacular views of the Cantabrian coast from its large windows.

We can enjoy excellent desserts and impeccable service in its three simply and elegantly decorated dining rooms.

This family business, now run by the third generation, is located in the hundred-year-old hotel Alameda, of great tradition in the town.

In this renovated 19th-century building, Gorka Txapartegi prepares original recipes with the best seasonal products. The menu in this avant-garde Basque cuisine restaurant is based on products from the land and sea.

This is a typical Basque farmhouse, managed by the Hormaetxea-Albonigamenor family.

For over 30 years, it has been offering traditional-style Basque dishes. It has three dining rooms with rustic decoration, a bar and outdoor terrace with garden.

It has a wood-burning oven and an orchard where they grow vegetables and pulses used to create simple, high-quality dishes. It specialises in fish and meats, and all the desserts are home-made.

A winery with a great tradition, situated since 1994 in Getaria. Their txakoli is based on the hondarribi zuri grape variety.

 

The winery uses innovating facilities to obtain an excellent txakoli with Getariako Txakolina Guarantee of Origin. There is a car park in the surroundings.

This restaurant opened its doors in 1976 and is now a classic reference in Vitoria-Gasteiz.

Chef José María del Val and his team are in charge of offering a high-quality service with quality products. 

The facilities are suitable for all types of celebrations (weddings, banquets, conventions, group lunches...). 

It also has a closed, air-conditioned garden.

servicio.nombre: Member of National Consumer Arbitration Board

datosGenerales.descripcion: Located in a beautiful 13th-century farmhouse next the church of Andra Mari, this is a true classic of Basque cuisine. Its menu is based on seasonal products, particularly fish and game, combining tradition and innovation. It has several simple, well-decorated dining rooms with original table linen, ceramics and cutlery. You can visit its wine museum with a wide selection of Rioja wines.

This winery is part of the Designation of Origin Arabako Txakolina and makes 95% of the total production of this designation. Its wines are marketed under the Xarmant and Maskuribai brands, both made with Hondarribi Zuri, Gross Manseng and Petit Corbu grape varieties.

 

The facilities have all the equipment necessary to properly apply ecological technologies and produce quality wines. Visits are available by appointment.

Ricardo Asúa manages this family business and collaborates with Guillermo Revilla as head chef. This is a beautiful Basque farmhouse that offers a combination of the classic and the modern, based on local products; but it specialises in seasonal products. The highlight is its bright, rustic dining room with high ceilings and wooden beams.

The Arkupe restaurant is located in a 17th-century building, right in the heart of the old town of Vitoria-Gasteiz.

Its tasty dishes are based on traditional Basque cuisine and can be accompanied by the excellent wines on offer on its immense wine list. 

Of the different dishes served at Arkupe, the particular highlight is the sizzling cod (bacalao al pil-pil). It also has a dining room for banquets and other celebrations.

The restaurant was established in 1982. It offers traditional cuisine together with the creativity derived from signature cooking. 

It is located in a typical stone farmhouse beside Gorbeia Natural Park. Salads, vegetables and game are its specialities.

A high-class grill restaurant in Tolosa, specialising in grilled ribs. It opened its doors in 1960 and has gone on to become one of the top establishments of its kind. It boasts an extensive wine list. Instagram:@casa_nicolas

Grillroom with views of the beach, located in the San Martín district. It offers a varied menu, including shellfish that are bred in the restaurant's own nurseries, wild turbot and Galician chops. In addition, the restaurant offers a tasting menu and a special San Martín menu.

servicio.nombre: Member of National Consumer Arbitration Board

datosGenerales.descripcion: Urkiola is a grillroom located in Beasain where gourmets will enjoy different types of high quality meat and fish. The menu provides a wide offer mainly of grilled meat. A broad range of homemade puddings and an excellent wine cellar with an exclusive selection.

Located in the old town of San Sebastian, it offers modern Basque cuisine. Ander González manages a team that takes maximum care of the produce, preparation and presentation. It has two dining rooms: one for 40 people and the other for 80.

This establishment has three dining rooms and offers the type of cuisine required for every occasion: from a family event to a reunion of friends or a special banquet. It will always meet your expectations. It has a wine cellar to accompany each dish with its corresponding wine. The menu is made up of traditional Basque dishes with a modern touch.

At Restaurante Azkue, now in its fourth generation, chefs strive in their work to offer the aromas and flavours of traditional Basque cuisine, based on top quality raw materials, as well as putting great care and attention into making the dishes. Locally grown produce, local meats and fish bought right down in the port are all essential ingredients. The restaurant is located on the outskirts of Zarautz and car parking is available

Azurmendi is located in a beautiful landscape that is surrounded by green areas.

The cook Eneko Atxa manipulates interesting designs based on Basque cuisine that have made him worthy of three Michelin stars. Apart from the restaurant, the complex consists of a 2,500 sq metre winery where they produce and store first quality txakoli wine.

The building is open for visits. 650 sq metres for celebrations, as well as private dining rooms and meeting rooms make up the place.

Situated within a beautiful 18th century farmhouse overlooking Urdaibai Biosphere Reserve, the restaurant offers a traditional based modern cuisine. Country products of high quality, as well as charcoal-grilled meat and fish. The decoration accurately reproduces the rustic atmosphere of a country house, making use of museum-like pieces. Friendly and conscientious service. Remarkable wine cellar. Garden and terrace in summertime.

An essential place for those who love charcoal-grilled fish and meat, always dressed with salads from kitchen gardens.

 

A rustic dining room equipped with classical and refined furniture that provides peace and quiet in order to taste traditional cuisine with some home-made products.

Located high up in the town of Llodio and with views of the whole municipal area, the Beldui Txakolina txakoli bodega provides guided tours, as well as dramatized tours of its bodega. The bodega produces golden yellow, white, rosé and sparkling Txakolis.

Doma is located at the top (seventh floor) of the Gran Hotel Domine Bilbao. The restaurant is under the culinary direction of internationally-renowned chef Martín Berasategui, who has seven Michelin stars to his name. Doma's cuisine stands out for its constantly changing dishes, combining home-style cooking with the most exquisite recipes. The restaurant offers an à la carte menu (the menu changes according to the season) as well as a taster menu.

Bodega Berroja winery offers a multi-sensory experience; from tasting their txakoli to fully enjoying their facilities and the activities they organise, like enotourism, tastings and other culinary activities. Berroja also produces three txakoli wines: Berroia, Aguirrebeko and Berroja. The winery also rents out its spacious facilities, with spectacular views over Muxika, for all kinds of events. You can choose one of the Bodega Berroja menus or arrange a special menu.

datosContacto.direccion: Ajurias, Carretera de Zugastieta a Balcón de Bizkaia

datosGenerales.descripcion: The classic restaurant located in the old town of Donostia-San Sebastián has built good reputation following thirty years of service. Fish and seafood are their specialties. Wide range of Rioja and Ribera del Duero wines. Family restaurant. Bar with its own seafood bed and a broad variety of "pintxos" (miniature culinary masterpieces). Paying car park in the surroundings.
New restaurant with big and wide terraces where guests will enjoy a natural environment. High quality service and products.

Bideko restaurant is located in an old seventeenth century farmhouse, in the valley of Ayala. Restored seventeen years ago, the uniqueness of the whole wooden and stone structure has been preserved. 

It perfectly combines traditional Basque cuisine with more innovative dishes. 

Bideko is great value for money.

Located in the Jewish neighbourhood of Labastida, Agrícola Labastida was founded in 1992 and consists of four houses of which two are the oldest ones in town. Under the houses, a criss-crossing of caves dating back to 1200 forms the best shelter for the wines the winery produces.

 

The grapes to produce the wine that has won many national and international contests come from different areas of Labastida. Nowadays the winery produces and markets the following brands: "Tierra Blanco", "Fernández Gómez", "Tierra Crianza", "Tierra Fidel", "El Belisario" and "El Primavera".

 

Tours by previous appointment. Groups of 5 people minimum, 15 maximum. 9 Euro per person and includes a tasting session of six wines and a snack. Tours last nearly 2 hours and 30 min.

Bodegas Amador García was founded in 1985 with a modern architecture containing stainless steel tanks and a bottling floor. It was enlarged in the year 2000 so that its bottles settle in the barrels. The winery bets on the quality provided by the French oaks. It markets red wines (new and crianza), white and rosé under the "Peñagudo", "Amador García" and "Viña Balcorre" brands.

 

Tours and tastings are allowed but by previous appointment. However, tours address known people -clients, etc. Free of charge.

An impressive winery founded in 1997 with the collaboration of the architect Iñaki Azpiazu. From a unique setting surrounded by vineyards, they produce the great variety of wines they market. All the wines, of an excellent quality and great personality, come from their own vineyards, where the visitor can observe the winemaking gem of the region.

 

The exhaustive selection of the grapes from the vineyards, their subsequent use on the selection and vibration tables, and the absence of hoppers and pumps let them obtain excellent wines. Gravity is their main ally. The social headquarters is a vaulted space making possible the tour of the barrel storeroom and the vineyards at the same time. Tour hours: Tue ¿ Sat: 11am -1:30pm. Book in advance.

A winery open to a large vineyard. Wine, art and architecture find their best balance in Bodegas Campillo.

Bodegas Campillo is located in Laguardia and was inaugurated in 1990. It was the first winery designed by an architect as a unique project to combine the beauty of its forms with the best techniques for the production and ageing of wine. The winery is built in the style of a Bordeaux château, in the centre of an estate surrounded by 50 hectares of vineyards.

It is undoubtedly a winery where you can delve into the world of wine and enjoy an unforgettable artistic experience. 

Bodegas Campillo is a referent in wine tourism, thereby offering its visitors a wide range of activities by booking in advance: guided tour of the winery, guided tour of the vineyard, 5-sense tasting, business meetings and professional events.

datosContacto.direccion: Ctra. de Logroño, s/n. Finca Villa Lucia

datosGenerales.descripcion:
A group of 60 winegrowers from Lapuebla de Labarca created Bodegas Covila in 1989. It consists of premises equipped with the latest technology to guarantee the maximum quality of wines when producing and ageing. Its 250 hectares of vineyards, with an average of 25 years, some of them even 80, are located between Lapuebla de Labarca, Laguardia and Elciego.

 

They focus mainly on Tempranillo variety, although some hectares centre on Viura, grapes used to produce white wines. Awarded many prizes, the wines are marketed both in the domestic and international markets. They export to countries such as Germany, Holland, Denmark, UK and the USA. Currently it markets wines under three brands: "Covila" (Crianza, Reserva/Mature, Red, White and Rosé), "Viña Guría" (Crianza, Reserva/Mature, Red, White and Rosé) and "Pagos de Labarca" (AEX Red, AEX White, Gran Reserva and Crianza).

 

It is possible to visit the facilities and taste its wines. Fixed schedule (Mon ¿ Fri: 10am ¿ 2pm; Sat: 10am - 12pm). Reservations in advance. Timetables can adapt to the needs of the visitors. Groups of a maximum of 50 people so that the tour is more profitable.

 

Rates: Guided tour + one wine tasting: 3 Euro.

José Luis, Juan Mari and Iñigo Berzal own a family winery located in the very heart of Rioja Alavesa with 50 hectares of vineyards. Founded in 1980, Dominio de Berzal marketed its young wines following the traditional method of wine growing known as carbonic maceration.

 

In 1999, they started constructing a new winery with modern facilities where currently they produce young and crianza wines, private selection and white wine. All of them enjoy prestige on the market by means of several national and international contests.

 

Visiting the winery is allowed as well as small tastings but by previous appointment. A "txoko" (room) is available to meet and for tastings. For more detailed information contact the person in charge.

galeria.titulo: Exterior of the winery Dominio de Berzal

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Located under Samaniego Palace, the current tourist office, Bodega El Fabulista is adapted to receive guided and cultural tours. The ground floor consists of two presses that produce 2,000 wine churns every year using traditional methods.

 

A stemmer and a press dating back to 1903 are also on display. Seven metres underground we will find three parallel lattices joined to each other. One is used for production, the second for aging and the third one for the tasting.

 

Guided tours include 2 wine-tastings, information about the natural process to produce wine. What is more, wine is on sale in the winery. Dinning room for 40 diners (by previous appointment).

galeria.titulo: The interior of Bodega El Fabulista

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Located in a central and strategic spot, Bodegas Espada Ojeda is a modern winery although it is marked by its ancestors' tradition when it comes to winemaking.

 

The winery produces wine following the most traditional method in Rioja Alavesa: the carbonic maceration system fermenting the whole cluster in stainless steel deposits. The grapes come from the winery's vineyards, situated nearby Lapuebla de Labarca and mainly consisting of Tempranillo grape variety and in a less measure the Viura variety, taken care of them with all the attention necessary for an excellent wine growing.

 

Currently the bodega produces three types of wine: year wine, select wine and white wine marketed under the "Da Lausan" brand. It is possible to visit the winery and taste its wines but reservations in advance.

Bodegas Estraunza is a family winery of mid-size where tradition prevails over machinery work. With a capacity of one million litres, the winery owns premises with 30 stainless steel tanks for a controlled fermentation, and a plant with 1.500 oak barrels for the ageing.

 

The main brand is the "Solar de Estraunza" (young red, white, rosé, crianza, reserva/mature) although it also markets two more: "Blas de Lezo" (red young, crianza and reserva/mature) and "Solar de Muskiz" (young red).

 

Throughout its existence, the winery has won several prizes, which has encouraged its owner to experiment with high quality wines. For more information on tours conditions, rates- contact the person in charge.

Discover an iconic Rioja winery.

To walk through the doors of Bodegas Faustino is to enter the history of wine, to live an experience in one of the most renowned and prestigious wineries in the world, present in more than 140 countries. To visit Bodegas Faustino is to share the passion for the land and the know-how of a family with a centuries-old tradition in winemaking. 

Bodegas Faustino is located in Oyón, in the heart of Rioja Alavesa. They have 650 hectares of the best vineyards in the districts of Laguardia, Logroño, Mendavía and Oyón.

They grow different grape varieties, Tempranillo, Graciano, Mazuelo and Viura for the production of red, white, rosé and cava wines. They offer the possibility of visiting the winery both on weekdays and weekends. During these visits, in addition to seeing the winery and tasting its wines, the winemaking and ageing process will be explained in detail.

Bodegas García de Olano is a family winery with a great tradition of different generations in wine growing. The winery is located in Páganos (Laguardia), in the very heart of Rioja Alavesa.

 

The winery owns 2,500 square metres of surface area with the most modern premises and still keeps a cave with some wine cellars of the Muslim period where they produced and stored the wine before. Bodegas García de Olano owns 25 hectares of their own vineyards and 15% on lease agreement with the following local varieties: Tempranillo (90%), Viura (5%) and others (5%).

The story begins back in 1870, when Don Modesto Ugarte Bengoa started producing his own wines in a traditional way in San Vicente de la Sonsierra.

 

His good skills have been transmited from generation to generation and in 1989, his grandson Victorio Eguren Ugarte built his new winery at the foot of the vineyards: Eguren Ugarte. Now it is the sixth generation together with the staff members of Eguren Ugarte who is in charge of the winery. It is located in Páganos, by the Road to Santiago and between Toloño Mountain range and Laguardia.

 

A guide will show you around (maximum 15 per group, otherwise split into two) the vineyards, the facilities, and the winery, where wine-making process will be explained. Next, a wine tasting session and the tour can be rounded off with a lunch in the private dinning room of Don Martín Cendoya.

From the old wine cellars of the 18th century to the new modern wine cellars, for many generations the Bello family have dedicated themselves to the wine growing.

 

Nowadays, the family vineyards cover approximately 32 hectares and produce the totality of the grapes used by the winery, approximately of 185.000 litres a year.

 

They market wines: "M.Bello" (new white wine and select red wine) and "Heredad de Berganzo" (new red wine and crianza red wine). Visiting the winery is possible if booked in advance. Small groups of up to 12 people aproximately. A small "txoko" also available.

Founded in 1969, the family company changed the name to Hermanos Frías del Val in 1999, having been able to combine the traditional wine growing with a personal production style.

 

Good production and the care of the vineyards have resulted in different awards for the quality of their wine production, as well as gaining recognition at varied local and international contests, and top marks in many specialised magazines. The winery has a capacity of 300.000 litres, 25 hectares of vineyards (their own vineyards and controlled ones), with vines of more than 100 years and grape varieties where the tempranillo (90%) predominates. The production is marketed under three brands: "Hermanos Frías del Val" (young red, crianza and reserve wine), "Don Peduz" (white and red wine) and Premium (Viña El Flako, white fermented in barrel, Selección Personal and Experiencia).

 

Visiting its facilities and tasting the wines is possible by previous arrangement. For more information contact the person in charge.

With a long wine-producing tradition, they bottle and market their own wine production that in early days shared with an association. Their elegant, characteristic and intense young fruity wine is obtained following the traditional method of carbonic maceration. It is marketed under the "García Huizi" brand. In addition, they also produce a select red wine under the "García Berrueco" brand. Visiting the facilities and tasting the wines in the wine tasting room is allowed by previous arrangement. Groups of up to 12 people max.

Located in Laguardia and founded in 2004 by Norberto Miguel, direct descendant of a family with great tradition in the wine world, Bodegas Laukote is the result of their wish to produce top quality wines. Produced in the most traditional way, quality is more important than quantity, which, at the same time, is very limited. Grapes from old vineyards are used for this purpose. Bodegas Laukote is the smallest winery in Rioja Alavesa with 7 hectares of vineyards of which 5 are old containing 90% of Tempranillo variety and 10% of Viura. The small winery selects all of the grapes from its land and sells four different labels of wine: Laukote Joven de Alta Gama, Laukote Vendimia Seleccionada, Laukote Blanco Fermentado en Barrica and Tostados de Laukote, a sweet wine of top-of-the-range produced by means of the most traditional way in Sauternes area (France).

datosContacto.direccion:
Ctra. de Elvillar, s/n. Polígono 7 - Pabellón 32 (Bodega)
C/ Sancho Abarca, 30, 1-G (Oficinas)

datosGenerales.descripcion: First, the grandfather, next, the father and now, his granddaughter Loli. She is heiress to a tradition that as time passes has turned into a passion. This is, above all, a way of life and a way to feel the land where wine means culture and culture is fuelled by tradition, a custom that renovates day by day. Bodegas Loli Casado own 25 hectares of private vineyards of which 9 hectares are over 60 years-old, 12 hectares between 30 and 45 years and 4 hectares between 7 and 10 years. Times change, but Bodegas Loli Casado witnesses customs and traditions combined with the latest technologies. Stone presses, wood barrels and masonry caves alternate with stainless steel tanks, controlled fermentations and crianzas in noble wood. The result is ideal: experience and renewal. The winery sells its own wines since 1982. Currently it markets four brands: "Juan de Alzate" (select, crianza, reserva/mature and gran reserva), "Polus" (reserva/mature, young white, white fermented in barrel, Tempranillo, Graciano and semi-sweet rosé), "Covara" (young, select and crianza) and "Loli Casado" (oil). Visiting the facilities and tasting its wines is posible. Groups of up to 25 people. Fixed timetable, but reservation is compulsory.

Luberri-Monje Amestoy is exactly the reflection of Florentino Martínez Monje's personality: a winery combining tradition and avant-garde. About twenty stainless steel vats, a refrigeration system to control the fermentation temperature and new American and French oak casks are the tecnological means used by Luberri-Monje Amestoy to give the best processing to the grapes. With 32 hectares of vineyards, 90% correspond to Tempranillo variety grape, 5% to Viura and 5% to Cabernet Sauvignon. Carbonic maceration is the traditional system applied in Rioja Alavesa to produce wine. They produce young wines, crianza and reserva under the "Luberri" brand, "Seis de Luberri", "Biga", "Monje Amestoy" and "Luberri Cepas Viejas". Guided tours and tastings, but by previous appointment. Groups of no more than 18 people. For more information contact the person in charge.

The winery sits on the outskirts of Lapuebla de Labarca, in the direction of Elciego, in a location which offers magnificent views. The buildings are imbued with a classical French style; the room where the crianza barrels are stored sits inside a beautiful chapel and the tasting room is designed in the Belle Epoque style, surrounded by beautiful flower gardens and charming vineyards. The wines are cultivated on their 25 hectares of vineyards, many of which were planted in 1901. They produce exclusive, limited-edition young wines, crianzas, reservas and grandes reservas.

Founded in the 1960s by a family with a large tradition in the wine world, Bodegas Luis Alegre embarked on a new stage in the 1990s. Nowadays the winery owns 50 hectares of magnificent vineyards and a building with the most avant-garde facilities.

 

Designed by the celebrated Spanish architect Joaquín Aracil Bellod, the structure has four circular floors completely covered with granite and also consists of a panoramic lift with an amazing view of the winery.

 

The upper floor is a completely-glazed social hall with a capacity of 60 diners. This is an unparalleled spot to taste tge typical local gastronomy. An outdoor and gardened terrace enables the visitor to enjoy unbeatable views.

 

Visit hours: Mon - Fri: consult. Guided tour: 10:45am and 12:45.

 

Visit price: Guided tour and 2 wine tasting sessions: 4 Euro per person. Reserve in advance.

 

Call 945 600 089 from 9am - 5:30pm.

With more than 22 hectares of vineyards, this small winery, property of Miguel Angel Muro, was one of the first ones in using steel tanks in the whole Rioja Alavesa region. That was in year 1984. Generation after generation the Muro family has kept its traditional method to produce good wine. They began marketing their wines in 1997, as a result of Miguel Angel Muro's son joining him in the tasks of making and marketing wine. Nowadays, Bodegas M.A. Muro offers guided tours through its installations, but these should be previously arranged. The tours timetable is: Mon - Sat: 11am - 1pm

A traditional family winery, which not only produces its wines according to the carbonic maceration method, but also uses the old manual screw press. From their 14 hectares of vineyards they produce between 60,000 and 90,000 kg. of grape, selling 100% of their production. Among the prizes they have been awarded, standing out are the First Prize obtained for the young red at the Rioja de Cenicero II Regional Wine Fair in 1993, the "Silver Zarcillo" Award in 1994 and the Silver Harvester Medal 94 in the Vinexpo in Bordeaux. The winery markets its wines under the "Pascual Larrieta" brand (new red wine, Crianza red wine and reserve red wine) and "Pascual Gómez de Segura" (select Crianza red wine). There is a special room for tasting sessions where to try different wines and local products. Rate (per person. 4 Euro the minimum): Tour (1 hour): 3 Euro Tour + 2 wine tastings (1 hour and a half): 7 Euro Snack "A" (chorizo + salchichón + cheese): 2 Euro Snack "B" (morcilla with peppers + chichas sautéed with egg): 2 Euro Snacks "A" + "B": 3 Euro Open on Saturday from 11am to 2pm. Reservation in advance. Different days and timetables available for groups.

The winery of Vinos de los Herederos del Marqués de Riscal, S.A. was constructed round the original winery of 1860.

Nowadays, the premises centred on wine growing own La Catedral, a bottle rack where Marqués de Riscal keeps its best gem; a unique collection consisting of all the bottles produced since 1862.

Following the increase in wine production the premises were extended in 1883 as well as in 1968 and 2000. Nowadays together with the original winery, Foso, Vacala and San Vicente wineries make up the complex.

The City of Wine consists of the ancient Marqués de Riscal winery -the oldest of Rioja- and a new building designed by Canadian architect Frank O. Gehry. The complex holds a hotel, a wine therapy spa, an exclusive restaurant and a meeting hall.

Tours: From Tuesday to Sunday, bank holidays included. 10 Euro per person. It is necessary to reserve in advance for any date and timetable.

galeria.titulo: The exterior of Marqués de Riscal winery

datosGenerales.descripcion: Bodegas Mitarte is a family winery that despite being founded in 1992 it has inherited a great tradition from their ancestors. The winery produces wine with grapes coming exclusively from its vineyards (40 hectares). The priority in production is quality rather than quantity and the harvest takes place with no rush and waiting for the last ray of light of October. The facilities vary outstandingly. From an open pool and a fretwork carved in rock with a depth of 500 metres where the new wine is produced following the traditional method of carbonic maceration, to a new winery, with modern facilities, where either white wines or new wines are produced. Guided tours and a tasting session with explanations, but reservations in advance. A small "txoko" is also available. Tours: Mon ¿ Fri: 9am ¿ 1pm and 4pm ¿ 8pm. Tour time: Tour: 1 hour. Tour and tasting session with explanations: 2 hours. Contact phone for tours: 945 331 069 - 649 940 039 - 607 343 289

This is a beautiful winery with the look of a stately home and surrounded by vineyards. The old winery dates back to the 17th century and became in 1988 the current winery, which is an ascentral house dating from the 18th century and equipped with new production warehouses. The vineyards are spread over different spots of Rioja Alavesa region, with an expanse of approximately 33 hectares. These vineyards produce almost all the grapes to produce the wine. The winery combines the traditions and experience of the older generations of wine growers with the aenological science and knowledge of the younger generations, obtaining as a result a very high quality product, manufactured by using artisan methods, with loving care and attention. Proof of it is "Gloria de Ostatu 2003". This wine varity is included on the 76th position on the 2008 list of the world's best wines released by the North American magazine Wine Enthusiast. The rest of the wines making up the wide offer are marketed under the following brands: "Ostatu" (new white wine, new red wine, new and reserve), "Mazarredo de Ostatu" (new) and "Ostatu Laderas del Portillo" (signature wine). Visiting the winery is possible if booked in advance. Call from Monday to Friday 8am ¿ 1:30pm and 3:30pm ¿ 6:30pm. Groups of up to 30 people. Rate: Tour + 2 wine tastings: 6 Euro.

Bodegas Palacio is located in the very heart of Rioja Alavesa.

 

Since Don Cosme Palacio and Bermejillo founded it in 1894 the winery has contributed to the wine revolution of Rioja Appellation of Origin. The building dating back to the 19th century is home to the cosy Hotel Restaurante Cosme Palacio.

 

For over 100 years it was a winery, whereas the place today is a facilities of new construction. In the wine atmosphere gastronomy plays an important role. Its dining room will introduce you to the traditional Rioja cuisine along with the best Bodegas Palacio wines. Several tasting courses also available.

 

Guided tours: Mondays to Saturdays: 11:00 and 13:00 Tuesdays to Fridays: 16:30 Visit to the century-old winery (only for patrons of the restaurant) Admission price: 5 euro per person (this amount is discounted for every 20 euro spent in the wine store at the winery).

 

Patrons of the Cosme Palacio hotel and restaurant are invited to a courtesy tour of the winery.

 

In July guided tours are arranged in the mornings and the winery is closed in August. For reservations call 945 600 057 (Mondays to Fridays) and 945 621 195 (weekends and bank holidays).

Located within the oldest building in town it is the place where the Church took the tithes. The structure maintains the ashlar presses and the construction details of the 14th century. This winery produces and bottles crianza and reserva wines, with all its flavour and personality. Besides, it has won several prizes at national and international level, being the only Basque winery that has won over the past years the Grand Prix d'Honneur with Viña Diezmo Reserva. The wine from 1987 got the award in the celebrated Bordeaux Fair back in 1993. Visits are normally charged. Contact the person in charge. The winery has won the Best of 2012 award, in the "Architecture, Parks and Gardens" category."

The winery was founded in 1910 by the grandfather of the current owner. At that time the headquarters was located in Elvillar and it was in 1978 when another winery was built at the town entrance. It 2005 a new project was undertaken in Laguardia, under the shelter of the Cantabrian mountain range. Grapes are picked from 30 hectares of vineyards belonging to the winery owners and family members. Located in Laguardia and Elvillar, some are even 100-years-old and the age average of the rest exceeds 40 years. The winery uses the most modern technology, although the production process is the traditional method of the Rioja Alavesa. It includes a private laboratory to carry out a responsible wine making practise committed to quality. "Ruiz de Viñaspe" (white, young, mature and grand mature) and "RV" (select red, white fermented in barrel and rosé fermented in barrel) brands are the winery's best introduction. Bodegas Ruiz de Viñaspe is part of the Rioja Alavesa Wine Route. That is the reason why it is possible to visit the headquarters and taste its wines but by previous arrangement.

The best wine, with all its taste and personality. The result of a careful and professional wine growing. The wine cellar is a clear reflection of this love for the wine, whose quality will be appreciated by the consumer. The winery is surrounded by its own vineyards: 57 hectares of the best Tempranillo and Mazuelo, which produce a wine of marked character: Finca San Martin Crianza and Torre de Oña Reserva. The winery can be visited from Monday to Friday at 11:00am and 16.00pm on Saturday at 11:30am (english and spanish). Following the tour and having tasted its wines during a nice lunch, the clients will be invited to stay in one of its 5 beautiful suites.

The Valdelana family has been cultivating vineyards since the end of the 16th century. Nowadays the owner is Juan Jesús Valdelana. His grapes come from 150 hectares of a select vineyard where the Tempranillo variety predominates, although a small percentage of Viura, Graciano and Mazuelo are also cultivated. The pitched-roof winery houses six floors underground dating back to the 15th and 16th centuries. In addition, the attic is home to an Ethnographic Museum, being the reflection of vine-growing in Rioja Alavesa in the beginning of the past century. Bodegas Valdelana belongs to the Rioja Alavesa Wine Route, as well as to the Spanish Wine Route. Meeting rooms, etc. available for rental. The upper floor may be adapted to hold more rooms for the clients. Products: Valdelana (White Viura, Young Red, Rosé, Crianza and Reserva) Agnvs-Signature Wine (Malvasia White, Oak or Media Crianza, Crianza and Reserva) Agnvs Oil Ladrón de Guevara (Young Red, White and Rosé, Crianza and Reserva) Centvm Vitis (Signature wine combining golden petals and native stocks of prefiloxera era, over 140 years). Tours by previous appointment: Saturday: 11am - 1pm and 4pm - 6pm. Sunday: 11am - 1pm. Guided tours and tasting session: 6 Euro per person. The winery has won the Best of 2012 award, in the "Art and Culture" category.

Founded in 1990, they own 15 hectares of vineyards to produce an excellent txakoli. The winery has great and modern facilities, according to a design that guarantees the most appropriate production process for the txakoli growing.

Bodegas Ysios have a total extension of 34 hectares in Rioja Alavesa distributed over Laguardia and Elvillar, and at the foot of Cantabria Mountain Range.

Opened in 2001, Ysios Vineyards are divided into 8 lands with particular localisation, direction and geo-climatic conditions, which makes clear the large diversity and complexity of its wines.

Architect Santiago Calatrava has designed the winery through the line exaltation of the barrels' row. The construction means an architectural landmark and nowadays the building is a landscape symbol of the environment. The winery owns several social rooms inside, ideal for business meetings, presentations, and so on.

Bodegas De Luis R. originated in 1983 from Luis María Rodríguez Roitegui, his family and Charo Urarte's wish to produce and market the wines made of grapes coming from their 40-hectare vineyard that they so much take care of with love and care.

 

The wines are produced following the traditional Rioja Alavesa method, always prevailing above all the quality and resulting in excellent wines marketed under the "De Luis R." brand. It is possible to visit the vinery and taste its wines. In addition, there is a large dinning room where to taste the typical Rioja Alavesa menu.

Located in the very heart of Labuebla de Labarca, Bodegas y Viñedos Casado Morales are the result of one family's tradition and work hand in hand. Since 1925 three generations' work has made it possible for us to enjoy the excellence of the wines that come from their own vineyards.

 

The wise combination of tradition and modernity with the incorporation of new techniques have contributed to high quality. The winery is pioneer in Europe in installing a system to protect the basic noses by means of temperature control within a computer network. Among its facilities we will find large premises with the most prestigious wines (each bottle belonging to an individual) and a social hall for the exclusive use of the clients.

 

Currently, the winery produces and markets the following wines: "Casado Morales Graciano" by means of carbonic maceration, Ladera Sur "Carácter", "Nobleza", "Nobleza Dimidium", "Casado Morales Crianza", "Casado Morales Reserva", "Casado Morales Gran Reserva", "Casado Morales Viura" (white crianza) and "Eme" (graciano).

 

Visiting the facilities and tasting the wines is possible if booking in advance. Groups of up to 50 people. The tour lasts one hour and a half. For more information contact the person in charge.

 

Rates: Guided tour + two wine tastings: 7 Euro. Guided tour + three wine tastings: 10 Euro.

In this old eatery, traditional Basque cuisine, that inspires the present spirit of Bodegón Alejandro, was cooked. From the basement of Fermín Calbetón street, the Bodegón has borne witness to the gastronomic evolution that has taken place in Donostia over the past fifty years. 

The old photographs covering the walls distinctly hark back to a time when food was served to warm the stomach more than to surprise the palate. 

Nowadays, the Bodegón has adapted its image to modern times, yet without losing any of its old charm. It pays homage to that charm through some dishes that are inspired by traditional Basque cuisine, looking to the future without losing sight of tradition and based on knowledge and the use of seasonal produce, sourced daily at the market.

Cosy restaurant of traditional cuisine that pays special attention to seafood courses. The menu gathers other local products and the counter of the bar in the entrance offers a large selection of "pintxos" (miniature culinary masterpieces). Boliña is also a hotel.

Beautiful 15th century farmhouse where you can enjoy delicious dishes based on recipes of the traditional Basque cuisine, as well as charcoal-grilled fish, the best Galician seafood or modern courses. Wonderful views of Bizkaia's most significant mountains. Careful rustic decoration. Large terrace surrounded by oak trees. María Asun Ibarrondo runs the business and Chef Javier García, before at Boliña restaurant, is in charge of the kitchen.

This prestigious, long running restaurant has a dining room with large windows overlooking the fishing port. It has a natural lobster bank in a seawater-well affected by the tides. 

In its typical decoration and friendly atmosphere we can try traditional Basque dishes prepared with quality products.

galeria.titulo: Dining room in restaurant Casa Cámara

datosGenerales.descripcion:
A landmark restaurant located in the old town of Donostia-San Sebastián, founded in 1956 and run by chef Pablo Loureiro Rodil. 

Casa Urola also features a bar where you can enjoy delicious pintxos (bar snacks) washed down with the best txakolí wine and a select range of different wines.

The restaurant at the Hotel Castillo El Collado is located in an enchanting castle dating from the early twentieth century, from where diners can enjoy the landscape of Rioja Alavesa and views of the extensive backdrop of vineyards and wineries in the region. 

Diners can enjoy dinner and lunch in pleasant, intimate surroundings, fused with the magic of the service provided by their chef Javier and backed up by the excellent cuisine on offer. 

The restaurant has three dining rooms of exceptional beauty, decorated with Arabic style ancient pottery and coffered ceilings of great value in terms of its craftsmanship. Amongst its rooms, there is a spacious and comfortable tavern-cellar, where diners can sample the traditional cuisine and have after-dinner drinks in the spacious bar with views and a terrace overlooking the promenade in the town.

This restaurant, founded in 1945, serves up Basque cuisine based on traditional recipes, all accompanied by the finest wines. The owner of the restaurant is at the helm of the kitchen. 

It has private dining rooms for lunches or for special celebrations. Great table service and a friendly atmosphere. The restaurant has its own fish tanks.

servicio.nombre: Member of National Consumer Arbitration Board

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Open for more than twenty years, Conde de Alava restaurant has become an ideal setting for business meals and work meetings since it is located strategically near Avenida de Gasteiz, which is one of the main thoroughfares of Alava's capital, and very close to the Europa Congress and Exhibition Centre. The restaurant is situated a few minutes from the city centre and consists of wide facilities where to hold all sorts of banquets, as well as private rooms. 

Moreover, the guests will have the chance to choose a varied menu with the most exquisite traditional Basque cuisine prepared with the best products. Besides, Conde de Alava restaurant offers special menus for groups.

galeria.titulo: Dining room at the Conde de Alava Restaurant

datosGenerales.descripcion: Family business that offers traditional Basque cuisine, specialising in seasonal fish. Direct access to the dining room and meticulous decoration. Capacity: 134. OPENING HOURS Tue - Sun: 1pm - 4pm and 9pm - 11pm.

Located in a building that host the last cider brewery-coalyard in San Sebastián, it offers traditional recipes of Basque cuisine. In its excellent fish offer we'll mention the dish called Merluza a la Koskera (typical hake dish). Decorated as an old country house, the restaurant keeps the stone wall dating back to the period of the city's reconstruction after the 1813 fire. At the entrance the bar offers a wide variety of bite-size eats and the famous brochettes, made of fish, seafood and meat.

This winery in Gamiz-Fika, part of the Bizkaiko Txakolina designation of origin, makes its txakoli according to family tradition but using the most modern techniques. It produces white, rosé and red txakoli.

The land at Eizaguirre is located on a succession of smooth hills and green valleys at the edge of the sea.

 

The txakoli is produced using the newest technology on the market and with the luxury of being able to call on generations of experience.

Restaurant at the Hotel Villa de Laguardia that offers modern Basque cuisine accompanied by the best soups. Acclaimed Jokin de Agirre, from Grupo Eurotoques, along with Juan Antonio Gómez, is under the direction of the kitchen. The restaurant is equipped with a dining room for banquets and special menus for firms, as well as tasting and special celebrations. 

Private car park with chauffeur service to park cars, also available.

galeria.titulo: The interior of the restaurant El Medoc Alavés

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Located in a building dating back to the 15th-16th Century, El Portalón is one of the most prestigious restaurants of Vitoria-Gasteiz with Renaissance, Gothic and Mudejar outstanding features. In past times, the restaurant operated as an inn for traders. The restaurant consists of six dining rooms of which four are private and where the best traditional cuisine is available to taste, as well as the delicious dishes cooked with the best quality products. Beans, wrinkles, snails, and the typical mushrooms from Alava are worth tasting.

 

Moreover, El Portalón is equipped with a winery that has excellent wines with Rioja protected designation of origin. The guests are allowed to choose the bottles in sittu.

 

El Portalón consists of several dining rooms with odd and interesting exhibitions of heraldic coats of arms from Alava, contemporary art and sculptures by artist Xabier Santxotena Alsua.

servicio.nombre: Member of National Consumer Arbitration Board

galeria.titulo: The exterior of the Restaurant El Portalón

datosGenerales.descripcion: Grill located in Amurrio. It provides a varied offer of dishes but specialises mainly in roast meat. Capacity: 150. OPENING HOURS Sun - Thu: 1pm - 5pm Fri., and Sun: 1pm - 5pm and from 9pm on.

galeria.titulo: Dining room of the grillroom El Refor

datosGenerales.descripcion: The oldest and smallest winery in Alava is found at the El Txakoli rural hotel. Its txakoli, called "mahatxuri", is made using Hondarribi Zuri and Folie Blanc grapes and has Designation of Origin Arabako Txakolina. El Txakoli has a capacity of 4000 litres.

Excellent fish and seafood rotisserie that created new concepts in terms of grills. Pedro Arregi and his family run the facilities with great professionalism. Top-quality raw materials, excellent seafood cooking and brilliant service. Moreover, its cellar is excellent as well.

Located in a hotel bearing the same name, this restaurant overlooking the Abra harbour has a modern and minimalist decoration that contrasts with its traditional Basque cuisine. The restaurant has a terrace-cafeteria with sights to the sea.

18th century farmhouse with a bar in the entrance that offers excellent "pintxos" (miniature culinary masterpieces). Two-level lounge with fireplace and a more modern sitting room. The garden provides beautiful views of the Bizkaia's coast and of the tiny peninsula of San Juan de Gaztelugatxe. In the menu, we encounter Traditional Basque dishes with a modernity touch. The quality of the seasonal products is the top priority. There is a beer hall attached to the restaurant and there is a museum where farming implements are exhibited. Chance of holding a wedding ceremony in the garden.

Pleasant restaurant with beautiful views of the mountains and the sea. Two elegant dining rooms and a bar at the entrance, where it is possible to have a meal. Modest Basque gastronomy based on top-quality products, above all, on fish from the nearby ports, but also meat with the Basque food quality certificate Eusko Label, excellent starters and home-made desserts and ice creams. Good wine list.

Humble family restaurant with an excellent service. It consists of two dining rooms, one of them used as a terrace. Restaurant of traditional cuisine and specialised in fish. OPENING HOURS 12:45pm - 3:30pm. Friday, Saturday and days prior to public holidays: 9pm ¿ 11pm.

galeria.titulo: Dining room of the restaurant Eskarne

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Located in the heart of the Bilbao ensanche, Atelier Etxanobe is the new restaurant of Fernando Canales and Mikel Población.

 

A restaurant that whose that offers original culinary creations that transmit the passion, happiness and the pleasure that two feel chefs on having imagined and to create them.

 

In Atelier Etxanobe you will enjoy the experience of the best of the Basque gastronomy with making and products at the highest level.

Traditional cuisine with modern touches in a cosy and classic family atmosphere. Top quality seasonal products. Very professional family service. Excellent wine cellar. Several dining-rooms. Car park available.

Established in 1903 as a bistro and grocer's shop, it became a restaurant in 1945. The grandmother of present-day chef Isaac Salaberria made dishes such as the Guisantitos de Primavera (Spring Little Peas), which is still nowadays served. The chef takes the traditional technique as a starting point to develop creative haute cuisine with extraordinary accompaniment for well built dishes different to each other. His brother Xabier Salaberria is the wine steward. Good facilities with minimalist decoration and excellent service. The restaurant consists of a terrace with a dance floor and a private room.

This family-owned winery, which has been making txakoli for four generations, combines modern machinery with traditional production processes. The winery is founded on three key principles: excellence in wine-making, constant innovation and respect for the txakoli identity. In addition, the winery boasts a small hotel which looks out onto the sea; guests will be sure to enjoy a relaxing stay here.

Located in the Zamudio Technological Park. In a modern building imitating a Basque farmhouse, Aitor Elicegi showcases his talent with daring and cutting edge creations. The menu, based on seasonal products, is innovative, but also combines elements of classic cuisine. Excellent cod. It boasts two dining areas, designed in a minimalist style, and a bar at the entrance. Original desserts. Updated wine list.

datosContacto.direccion: Ibaizabal, 212. Parque Científico y Tecnológico de Bizkaia

datosGenerales.descripcion: A hundred-year-old family restaurant. The menu attracts business customers. Juan Mari Gaztañaga offers a traditional gastronomy that includes grilled fish, cod and ox T-bone steaks. Small classic dining room perfectly equipped. Remarkable wine cellar. Next to the airport. Pets allowed. OPENING HOURS: Mon - Thu: 12:30-16:30 Friday: 12:30-16:30 and 21:00-23:00

This is a family winery dating back to the 14th century, protected by the Toloño Mountain all the way to the River Ebro. Wine growers since 1952, they put their first wine on the market in 2003, which was very well received.

 

The winery specialises in special red wines of top quality. Nowadays they produce 5 types of wines: young wines, barrel fermented wine, young red wine, home-made red wine of signature (Olmo 34) and top quality wine (Gotés Expresión).

 

Guided tours and tastings by previous appointment. Not free of charge. Groups of 15 maximum. For more information consult the person in charge.

The location of Doniene Gorrondona in Bakio, on the shores of the Cantabrian Sea, gives the grapes in this vineyard a very peculiar personality.

 

They produce spirits, sparkling wine and several txakoli wines, pioneers of the Designation of Origin Bizkaiko Txakolina: Doniene (white and barrel fermented) and Gorrondona (white and red). Tours of the winery include wine and culinary tastings.

Located in front of Bakio Beach, the restaurant has an elegant indoor dining room, another glazed one and a bar where you can taste "cazuelitas" and "pintxos" (miniature culinary masterpieces). Traditional menu with top-quality products. Specialised in fish. Careful service. Important wine cellar that includes Bakio's "txakoli" (slightly sparkling white wine).

A small restaurant serving modern Basque cuisine, all accompanied by the finest wines. At the helm of the kitchen, we have Vicente Muñoz, a disciple of Martín Berasategui. Splendid pintxos, freshly made and for which they that have won awards more than once, stand out.

datosRestauracion.capacidad: 35 guests. 35 more in the summer terrace.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
In the Middle Ages La Granja Nuestra Señora de Remelluri was part of the Monastery of Toloño. In 1967 Jaime Rodríguez Solís embarked on a thrilling wine adventure by means of restoring what in the past was a land belonging to the Hieronymites and renewing the vineyard with several autochtonous species.

 

Nowadays it has 150 hectares of which 105 are part of a restored vineyard from where the vines to produce Remelluri wines are obtained (Reserva, Gran Reserva and "high expression"). The building preserves inside a necropolis of the Middle Ages and a wine press, probably the oldest one in the region.

 

Tours, previous arrangement: Tue ¿ Sat: 10am ¿11am and 12pm (only tours) Mon ¿ Sat, except bank holiday; 1pm and 1:45pm (tour with lunch) Apart from the history of the estate, the history of Rioja Alavesa and its wine is exhibited at La Granja Nuestra Señora de Remelluri Museum. Visits from Tuesday to Saturday by previous arrangement.

 

In addition, there a dining room service for groups, business meetings, etc. as well as a tasting room where the wine experts of La Granja Nuestra Señora de Remelluri give explanations on the matter. All these services must be booked in advance.

Friendly grill specialised in traditional cuisine in the city centre of Bilbao. It is equipped with two dining rooms, of which one has marine decoration and the other has noble decoration. There are also private rooms. The menu consists in top quality fish and meat that are roasted at sight.

This winery was founded in 1990. It sells white and red txakoli under the Bizkaiko Txakolina Designation of Origin.

 

Located on the Ruta de las Bodegas (The Wineries Route), Orduña's special climate means that its txakoli is complex and different from the others.

 

The winery is equipped with new facilities finished in stainless steel and boasts two hectares of vineyards which are protected with a special antifreeze system.

Family restaurant located in a natural landscape, near a mountain pass. It consists of a bar and two dining rooms, one of them with a fireplace and the other fitted out for banquets. The menu offers the best Basque cuisine recipes with modern and creative touches. Elegant décor. Garden and car park available.

servicio.nombre: Member of National Consumer Arbitration Board

datosGenerales.descripcion: Family restaurant with excellent grilled fish and meat. The menu offers also more sophisticated Basque dishes. There is a bar at the entrance and a dining room decorated in country style that reminds of an inn.

Horma Ondo restaurant reopened its doors in 2007 in the Artxanda Golf Club. In the rustic building we can find a dining room with contrasting decor. They prepare both traditional and grilled cuisine, but always with high quality products.

Restaurante Asteasu is situated in the old quarter of Irún and serves traditional Basque dishes with signature notes and always made from fresh market produce. The dining room is simply decorated and has stained-glass windows depicting Basque themes.

Restaurante Iribar is situated near the port of Getaria. The chef, Pili Manterola, has taken over from her grandfather, the founder of the business, and continues to serve traditional Basque dishes in the family atmosphere of the nautically-decorated dining room. The restaurant¿s specialities are seafood and grilled fish.

Founded in 1994, they own vineyards of more than 30 years. The facilities have the most advanced technologies so that the txakoli production can be more controlled and they obtain an excellent wine. They market a txakoli wine under the Gorka Izagirre brand.
Family restaurant run for more than thirty years by the Olano-Otaegi family. Wide offer of fish and seafood dishes. Several dining rooms. Car park available.

A Mc Donald's multinational chain restaurant. Apart from offering fast food -mainly hamburgers- inside, they have also a McAuto service, straight in the car. OPENING HOURS 12pm - 11pm. Fridays and Saturdays till 12am - 1pm. Sundays till 11:30pm.

datosContacto.direccion: C/ Pol. Ibarzaharra, s/n. C.C. Carrefour

datosGenerales.descripcion: Restaurant Jauregia is situated in the Euskalduna Convention Centre. The building covers a great many events such as conferences, presentations, galas, lunches and working dinners. Every year it provides coverage to Over 100,000 services such as wine receptions, cocktails, coffee-breaks, brunches and working dinners not counting the bar service and dinners at the restaurant during opera and concert performances.
Housed in the 16th-century Palacio Floreaga, an example of Basque Gothic architecture. Specialises in fresh meat and fish dishes, as well as seasonal produce.

datosRestauracion.capacidad: Function rooms for celebrations, seating between 20 and 250 diners.

galeria.titulo: Outside view of the restaurant Joseba

datosGenerales.descripcion: Juan Iturralde "Kojua", well-known figure in gastronomic societies, began serving foods in this facility back in the 50s. Located by the harbour, offers delicious fish and seafood dishes subject to the dictates of the restaurant. The guest will enjoy traditional dishes in four different dining rooms decorated with sea motifs. Special menus for groups.

Renowned chef Juanma Hurtado offers artisanal cuisine made from thoughtfully chosen ingredients. The head waiter is his wife, Jaione Garmendia. Seasonal dishes are the restaurant¿s speciality and there is also an extensive wine list with over 70 labels from different regions. The renovated dining room is decorated in a cosy, classic style with modern touches and an intimate atmosphere.

Hotel-restaurant Kaian by the coastal resort Plentzia presents a new way to enjoy leisure time. The establishment offers the chance of tasting an innovative and creative cuisine, based on the staff's large experience. Comfortable rooms.

The Karlos Arguiñano restaurant is housed in Villa Aiala, an early 20th-century "palacete" or grand town house on the promenade by Zarautz beach. Five of the chef Karlos Arguiñano's sons run both the restaurant and the hotel from which the famous cook made the leap to the television screen.

 

The restaurant has several dining rooms and different settings, but all of them share the same essence, the legacy of the cooking of Karlos Arguiñano, which combines tradition with the innovation of prestigious Basque cuisine.

Restaurant located within a farmhouse with wonderful views of Bilbao city. They offer top quality traditional cuisine and good service. The restaurant consists of two dining rooms and a wine cellar. Their specialities are grilled fresh fish and meat. They have wood-fired oven.

Miren Guridi and Paula Tanko are the third-generation running the family business. They make traditional Basque dishes. Simple recipes, but solid and based on top quality products. Banquet oriented service, but does not leave occasional customers aside. Nice terrace overlooking the Sanctuary of Loyola. Four dining rooms, big and little ones, all of them very cosy. Seafood bed. Car park available. OPENING HOURS 12:30pm - 3:30pm and 8pm - 10:30pm.

In the Old Town of San Sebastián, Kokotxa provides clients with Daniel López's signature cuisine. He was awarded one Michelin star dut to its excellent mixtures. The restaurant consists of a wide dining room with simple and cosy decoration. Delicious desserts. The excellent Basque signature cuisine completes with good service.

Sukalki restaurant is located in the centre of Vitoria and offers diners a fusion of traditional Basque cuisine with a more innovative, modern food presentation. Luis Angel Plágaro, who runs the kitchen, prepares his dishes using fresh produce and Leticia Plágaro, who runs the dining room, offers a friendly service in this small restaurant.

servicio.nombre: Member of National Consumer Arbitration Board

datosGenerales.descripcion: Restaurant within the Hotel Management School overlooking Bilbao from Mount Artxanda and surrounded by green meadows. It offers a large variety of menus adapted to different clients. Good views of the city of Bilbao. Special menus for vegetarians, Jews, Arabs, children and guests suffering from coeliac disease.

galeria.titulo: Dining room in La Escuela restaurant

datosGenerales.descripcion: Pleasant, carefully tended surroundings dedicated to gastronomy in which to enjoy renowned cuisine with marvellous views of La Concha Bay. La Perla has two terraces of 700 and 400 m2 respectively, a coffee bar and restaurant with views over the Bay. From a business lunch to a wedding, our expansive restaurant, its reserved area and terrace make this the ideal place for any kind of event.

With the expert advise of well-known chef Ferrán Adriá, the restaurant of Hotel Villa de Bilbao offers a creative cuisine based on traditional Basque gastronomy. Cosy decoration and warm atmosphere. Rooms for hire.

datosContacto.direccion: Gran Vía, 87 ( H. Villa de Bilbao)

datosGenerales.descripcion: Restaurant located in the picturesque port of San Sebastián, next to the Aquarium and with outstanding views. They offer traditional food based on fish and seafood and their most famous dishes include "txangurro" and lobster. Professional service.

galeria.titulo: Dining room in La Rampa restaurant

datosGenerales.descripcion:
A recently restored palace dating back to the 17th century. It is located in a privileged spot that enables admiring the natural landscape of the Valley of Ayala. 

Its traditional Basque cuisine is remarkable.
Maider restaurant opened its doors in 1982 and its specialities include fish and seafood selected from its own hatchery. It also has a large bar to try a wide variety of pintxos and omelettes.

datosRestauracion.capacidad: Two dining rooms for 35 and 20 people

datosGenerales.descripcion: From the big windows of its minimalist dining-rooms the guest can enjoy magnificent views over the port. Ideal setting for weddings, banquets, company meetings and private celebrations. Adjoining the dining-rooms there are two terraces ideal for cocktail parties, 350m2 for exhibitions, demonstrations, presentations, etc. And the possibility of setting outer marquee with capacity for 600 people. Quality service and good dishes prepared by Mikel Bermejo who, thanks to his long experience working with the best cooks, combines perfectly Basque traditions with an imaginative creative touch.

Basque traditional dishes prevail in the restaurant but there is also room for modern cuisine. The restaurant has its own wine cellar, locally grown products and offers an magnificent view of Laguardia's medieval walls. Moreover, this is an ideal place to admire the vineyards that surround the town and Cantabrian Range.

servicio.nombre: Member of National Consumer Arbitration Board

datosGenerales.descripcion:
In a modern farmhouse overlooking the countryside, Martín Berasategui proves himself to be a genius of cuisine, making avant-garde signature cuisine, full of surprises.

The restaurant has its own vegetable and fruit garden. Glazed dining room with widely spaced tables and Provençal decoration. Excellent desserts. Impeccable service. Its cellar includes almost all the Denominations of Origin.

Cigar choice and spirits à la Carte.

Classical restaurant in the area that offers traditional Basque dishes with slightly modern touches. Xabier Martínez follows his mother Conchita¿s tradition and prepares succulent cookery based on locally-grown products. Idiazabal Cheese Guild. There is a bar at the entrance with a wide variety of "pintxos" (miniature culinary masterpieces) and half-price dishes. OPENING HOURS: 1pm - 1:30pm and 8:30pm - 10:30pm

The rustic Matxete grillroom sits in the heart of medieval Vitoria-Gasteiz, in the plaza from which it takes its name. It offers an extensive à la carte menu. Its grilled meats and fish are particularly delicious, as are its seasonal foods and homemade desserts. It also serves lunches and dinners on an outside terrace and the restaurant staff speak Basque, Spanish, English, French and Russian.

Restaurant located in a beautiful 19th century farmhouse on the slope of Mount Anboto, close to Urkiola Natural Park. Its motto "where the silence can be heard" refers to the spectacular setting. The rustic decoration of the three dining rooms has been carried out in depth. The menu gathers seasonal dishes based on traditional Basque cuisine with a creative touch. Grilled fish and meats. Home-made desserts. Outstanding wine cellar. On the upper floor a traditional Basque house museum can be visited.

Mesa restaurant specialises in fish and seafood. 

In a classic, relaxed and friendly environment we can taste dishes based on traditional Basque cuisine with a large variety of home-made baking.

servicio.nombre: Member of National Consumer Arbitration Board

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Andoni Luis Aduriz runs the kitchen of this revered eatery renowned by the international gourmet press.

Set in a farmhouse in the very heart of the countryside, in Errenteria, the decor blends modernity with the classic by creating signature Basque dishes. There is one dining room with cloth room divider screens and an adjoining lounge for a pre-meal drink.

It offers cutting-edge cuisine that is personal and brimful of wonderful surprises. It is worth trying one of their excellent tasting menus. The restaurant holds two Michelin stars and three Repsol suns. It boasts a great wine cellar with wines grouped by their characteristics. The menu can be purchased as a souvenir. Mugaritz´s kitchen garden has more than one hundred varieties of herbs, fruits and flowers.

There is a car park.
Basque cookery prevails in the menu of the restaurant, even though there is room for signature cuisine.

The restaurant specialises in weddings and banquets. However, it also focuses on à la Carte customers. Apart from its excellent fish and meat, the facility offers different menus with interesting and innovative dishes. Elegant dining rooms. Very goog cellar. The Guesala family runs the restaurant. Moreover, there is a garden that is ideal for wedding photographs.

servicio.nombre: Member of National Consumer Arbitration Board

datosGenerales.descripcion:
The "Anuncibai Palace" is an ancestral home, just by the Bilbao-Vitoria highway. It has 6 dining rooms, 2 of them ready for big celebrations. 

The menu is based in the Basque traditional gastronomy, although it does not forget the new tendencies . It offers valet parking service and it has a capacity for 200 people.

Eduardo and José Ignacio Pascual Berganzo, after the experience his family acquired as winegrowers, decided to build this winery in 1982 in order to produce and sell high quality wines. With 60 hectares of his own vineyards and another 10 leased, they produce wines according to the carbonic maceration method, traditional in the Rioja Alavesa region. They produce red, white, organic and rosé wine.

The restaurant is located in a farmhouse overlooking the Mundaka Estuary within Urdaibai Biosphere Reserve. Fish, T-bone steaks and other traditional dishes, as well as home-made cakes are at the clients' disposal. Fish and charcoal-grilled T-bone steak are its speciality. Rustic dining room, bar that provides "pintxos" (miniature culinary masterpieces) and a terrace. The restaurant is situated within Mundaka's Portuondo campsite.

The restaurant is located in Viana palace, which dates back to the 17th century. The hotel and restaurant are decorated in Gentile Baroque style of the period (1619). 

The building's basement, 8 metres underground, has a cellar that is possible touring. It produces ageing and different-age wines (crianza, reserva and gran reserva). 

It prepares mainly Basque-Rioja traditional dishes but with a slightly modern touch.

servicio.nombre: Member of National Consumer Arbitration Board

datosGenerales.descripcion: The restaurant has a famous wine cellar widely awarded and consists of 100,000 bottles. It provides simple and traditional dishes of top quality. It is located in a farmhouse at the foothills of Igeldo Mountain, with a nice terrace surrounded by trees. Appealing desserts. The restaurant has a dining room and several private rooms. Car park available.

Traditional 19th century farmhouse with two dining rooms decorated in rustic style, a banquet dining room and private rooms.

Stone and wooden beams in full view. The restaurant offers creative haute cuisine based on top quality ingredients and traditional recipes. Apart from the daily fresh fish from the neighbouring port of Bermeo, it has also its own shellfish hatchery.

Large wine list that includes 600 different wines. Garden and terrace.

The slopes of the Rezabal vineyards are located in the municipality of Zarautz, and are caressed by the breeze coming from the Cantabrian Sea.

 

The winery has the latest technology at its disposal, but continues to employ the most traditional methods.

 

Some of its products include Rezabal txakoli, Arri txakoli, orujo and herb liqueur. In addition, as part of the guided tour, visitors can sample txakoli accompanied by pintxos.

Rubiorena restaurant is located in a leisure area of Beasain (Gipuzkoa). With Urki Balerdi in the kitchen, the restaurant has reopened its doors again in late 2015. It offers a traditional modern basque kitchen, and always with successful personal creations; Urki is specializes in vegetarian menus. The menu is also gluten-oriented.

Sagartoki is a benchmark in Vitoria-Gasteiz. It is located in the city centre and provides delicious grilled meat and fish. It also offers interesting dishes of the Basque cuisine and its "pintxos" (small culinary masterpieces) and Spanish omelettes have been awarded several times. It consists of a bar and a dining room divided into two zones. In the first one, rustically decorated, you will enjoy a typical cider house menu and there are also three "kupelas" (barrels) for self-service. In the second area guests will taste a wide offer of grilled meat and fish à la Carte. A large wine list and with a cry of "txotx", barrels are opened to start drinking. OPENING HOURS Monday - Friday: 10am - 24pm Weekends: 9am - 01am

galeria.titulo: The interior of the cider house

datosGenerales.descripcion: Located next to Virgen de Iciar Sanctuary, Salegi restaurant is specialized in weddings and banquets. Apart of organising big events, it offers a menu of Basque traditional cookery with a touch of modernity. The restaurant has five dining rooms, wide gardens and a private parking.

Former cider house reconverted into a prestigious restaurant and grill. It offers excellent txangurro crabs and T-bone steak. Basque decoration, professional family service. They offer special menus for weddings, Holy Communions, celebrations, business meetings, etc. Parking.

Based on traditional cookery, Mikel Zuaznabar distances himself from the typical grills and provides new and sophisticated touches. Avant-garde desserts. A bar at the entrance and a contemporary-style room with rustic details. Seasonal menu. It is located in the town's exit way.

Cosy facility in the city centre of Bilbao with a bar at the entrance. The restaurant provides traditional dishes elaborated with excellent fish and seafood. Home-made desserts. Conscientious and pleasant service. Good wine cellar. Fish and seafood are its specialities.

As the associate Serantes I, the restaurant specialises in fish and seafood dishes elaborated with top quality products, although it also offers meat courses. They contain a seafood aquarium in full view. Moreover, there are two pleasant dining rooms and a bar at the entrance.

The winery of deeply rooted tradition is located in the very centre of Laserna, Laguardia.

The red wine is produced following the traditional carbonic maceration system, giving the young wines an unmistakable nose and taste. 70% is produced followed by the pressing and destemming. Next, the wine undergoes an ageing process in one of the 500 barrels that the premises own.

To carry out the task, the winery consists of modern facilities of top quality. Its wineyards, located in Laserna and Laguardia, are 60-years-old approximately.
Original cider house and txakoli winery where the guests will bring their own food. The place provides customers with grills to cook meat, as well as cider barrels, txakoli bottles and soft drinks.

galeria.titulo: The exterior of Axpe Cider House

datosGenerales.descripcion: This cider house only opens its doors on Friday nights, Saturdays, Sundays until lunch time, and public holidays and long weekends (during the week only upon special request), and, here, in addition to the cider house menu, you can sample various traditional Basque dishes as well as roast chicken (upon request). There are two air-conditioned dining areas and visitors have the opportunity to go on a pony ride.
Founded in 1979, the Aburuza family, a lineage with a long tradition in the production of cider, began offering tasting sessions of its product, cider.

The Aguinaga cider house offers you the chance to try in-house barrel-fresh cider all year round. As well as cider, you can drink red and rosé wine and cava. Specialises in the cider house menu but also has an extensive menu of traditional Basque cuisine.

Cider house located in the Akarregi farmhouse in Hernani, with over 300 years of history. They continue to make cider according to tradition and in the dining room you can try a typical cider house menu, cod in sauce (on request) and barrel-fresh txotx cider.

Akelenea cider house sits in rural surroundings, and its origins date back to the 19th century. It boasts two dining areas where events of all kinds can be held, and, on top of the cider house menu and cider straight from barrels all year round, it also offers an à la carte menu and a variety of other menus.

galeria.titulo: Dining room in cider house Akelenea

datosGenerales.descripcion: Alorrenea cider house serves a typical cider house menu from January until May, and then broadens this menu to include a wider variety of starters, fish dishes and desserts. In addition, the cider house produces its own cider, starting from the month of October, and visitors can witness the production process first-hand.

galeria.titulo: Dining room in Alorrenea cider house

datosGenerales.descripcion: Altuna cider house is situated in a farmhouse, surrounded by apple trees which they own and from which they have been producing their own cider since 1904. Open exclusively during the txotx season, guests can choose to indulge in the typical cider house menu at one of the tables or, if they prefer, standing up.

Located in a quintessential Basque farmhouse, Altzueta cider house serves a cider house menu during the txotx season, but remains open all year round, exclusively to sell bottled cider. At Altzueta, they produce their own cider, drawing from their 2,500 apple trees.

galeria.titulo: Outside of the cider house Altzueta

datosGenerales.descripcion:
In addition to the cider house menu, Amaike offers special set menus and an extensive menu of traditional Basque cuisine.

You can also try barrel-fresh txotxcider all year round.

In addition to the typical cider house menu, the Amebi cider house offers set daily menus, main dishes, special menus or à la carte dining.

They make their own cider and you can try barrel-freshtxotxcider all year round.

The Ander cider house offers a typical cider house menu, as well as a menu based on traditional Basque cuisine and a daily menu, and we can try cider directly from the barrels all year round. In addition, Ander is surrounded by children¿s parks and basketball courts for kids to enjoy.

The AnkapaluBerria cider house is located in the foothills of Gaztelumendi, in Larrabetzu. In addition to the cider house menu, it has an extensive menu based on traditional Basque cuisine. You can also try barrel-fresh txotx cider all year round.

Located in a natural setting, at Araeta restaurant you will discover three different atmospheres- a large dining area, a cider house, and a sheltered outside area. It serves an à la carte menu as well as different types of menus, and in cider season, it also serves a cider house menu.

Juan Salvado, who has extensive experience in the field of restoration (he has been head chef at the prestigious Boroa, Mugaritz or Andra Mari), is the owner and cook of the Aritxi restaurant-grill.

 

This beautiful farmhouse is located in Mungia, in the vicinity of the Jata and Sollube mountains, and its cuisine is inspired by Basque gastronomy. Likewise, its wide and varied seasonal menu is based on grilled meat and fish and the best products of our land. It has several types of menus and two rooms for 100 and 45 people, respectively.

galeria.titulo: The exterior of Aritxi Cider House

datosGenerales.descripcion: This cider house and grill from Vitoria-Gasteiz offers a wide menu consisting in red beans, codfish and chop sautéed with eggs, accompanied by the best cider. The specialities include charcoal-grilled meat and fish together with the typical food of the country. They also serve other kind of food and drinks. Rooms for hire. Car park. OPENING HOURS 1:30pm - 4pm

Arraiz grillroom is located in a farmhouse which was designed in a rustic style, in a setting surrounded by nature. As well as the à la carte menu, it serves a house menu, children's menu, shellfish and grilled platters, and special group menus for at least four people.

Cider house in Usurbil open during the whole year. During the cider season, it's possible to drink in the "txotx" way and to eat standing up, according to tradition. The cider house menu costs 24 Euros. Out of the season, it works as grillroom. Capacity: 150 guests. Parking. OPENING HOURS: Noons and evenings.

Former cider house that today operates as a restaurant and grill. Traditional cuisine and delicious grilled meat.

They also provide cider house menu accompanied by bottled cider. Average price of the menu à la carte: 40 Euro. Capacity: 120 guests. No car park.

OPENING HOURS Every day: 1pm - 3:30pm and 8:30pm - 11pm

Located at the shore of the Bilbao estuary, La Gabarra cider house/grillroom boasts two spacious dining areas and several private dining areas. It serves an à la carte menu as well as group menus, and some of its specialities are anchovies, cod omelette, steak, and grilled bream.

Located in the upper reaches of Astigarraga, Astarbe cider house has a spacious dining area. As well as the cider house menu, it serves a children¿s menu, and rib is also featured on the menu. In summer, it serves up dishes which are prepared using seasonal products.

Located in the Aulia Enea farmhouse in Legorreta, this is a traditional cider house in which you can taste cider during the cider season and enjoy dishes from a typical cider house menu.

You can enjoy the atmosphere in this traditional cider house seated at one of the tables, or, if you prefer, standing up.

Cosy cider house situated in a farmhouse and surrounded by nature. It serves a cider house menu, daily menu (Monday to Friday), Saturday night menu, children's menu and à la carte menu. Some of its specialties include the Ayoberri-style cod, charcoal-grilled chop, roast lamb and suckling pig (upon request).
