Located at the foothills of Mount Urraki and with views of Mounts Ernio and Izarraitz, Añota opens its doors as a cider house during the cider season and functions solely as a restaurant for the rest of the year. It produces cider using some of the most modern methods, while still preserving traditional practices. Añota is one of the cider houses taking part in the "Cider Experiences!" initiative.
They produce cider, which is later bottled and sold. A tasting is done at the beginning of the year. It doesn't work as restaurant.

Located in Martutene, the cider house boasts a spacious, heated dining area, and as well as a typical cider house menu, it offers cod in a green sauce (upon request). At Barkaiztegi, they produce their own cider using different varieties of apple and employing the traditional process.

This traditional cider house, located in Astigarraga, boasts a spacious dining area where you can indulge in a typical cider house menu. They produce their own cider and txotx is only possible in season. Bereziartua is one of the cider houses taking part in the "Cider Experiences!" initiative.

The grillroom¿s dining area has a rustic décor, designed using stone and wood, with steel touches. It serves a daily menu, the Donibane menu and four different menus for groups, as well as an extensive à la carte menu. Some of its specialities include cod and grilled meat and fish.

A cider house located in natural surroundings, with two spacious dining rooms to try the typical cider house menu and in-house barrel-fresh txotx cider. 

It also has a restaurant that is open all year round.

The Eguzkitza cider house in Tolosa has a spacious, air-conditioned dining room where you can try the typical cider house menu and barrel-fresh txotx cider.

Dinner from Tuesday to Saturday and lunch on Friday, Saturday and Sunday.

The typical cider house menu apart, this restaurant also offers menu à la carte during the week. Different meals and drinks also available. "Kupelas" (barrels) to practise Txotx. Capacity: 250 guests. The cider house is located in the neighbourhood of Elexalde with beauriful views. No car park. OPENING HOURS 1:30pm - 4pm and 8:30pm - 11pm.

The cider house was founded more than a hundred years ago within a 500 year-old farmhouse. This cider house makes use of apples from the region and European countries such as France and the Czech Republic. 110,000-litres production per year, subsequently distributed among bars, restaurants, supermarkets and societies. Cider season starts in January and finishes in April. Cider House Menu: 27 Euro. Customers can bring their own meat and bread. Capacity: 200 guests. Car park available. OPENING HOURS Every day: 1pm - 4pm and 8pm - 11:30pm.

Cider house in Elutxeta with 2,000 apple trees accompanied by apples brought from Galicia, the Czech Republic and UK that produce around 40,000 litres per year. For the production they follow the traditional methods and get magnificent cider, ideal to drink while tasting a typical cider house menu that costs 25 Euro. Possibility of practising "txotx" and eating standing. Capacity: 200 guests. Car park available. OPENING HOURS Every day: 1:30pm - 3:30pm and 7:30pm - 11pm.

Etxe Zuri cider house boasts two dining areas, in which you can indulge in food from a cider house menu, as well as from daily and weekend menus, and an à la carte menu.

Txotx cider is only served in season. Some of the stand-out dishes include grilled meat and fish.

Etxeberria cider house boasts a spacious, air-conditioned dining area, where guests can indulge in a typical cider house menu. With views of San Sebastian¿s bay, it is located in a beautiful setting, surrounded by apple trees from which they produce their own cider.

This is a traditional cider house in Urnieta which has a spacious, air-conditioned dining area complete with under-floor heating. Here, guests can enjoy the best natural cider straight from the barrels, accompanied by the typical cider house menu.

Gartziategi is one of the oldest known cider houses, and some of the barrels which lie in its bodega are more than 100 years old. They produce the cider from the apple trees in their own gardens and guests here can indulge in a typical cider house menu, as well as participate in the Basque txotx cider tradition, where they will pour themselves a glass of fresh cider, straight from one of the cider house's barrels.

The Gaztañaga cider house has cutting-edge facilities and technology to prepare its cider.

As well as the typical cider house menu, it also offers grilled monkfish and cod in sauce (both on request) and extends your chance to try barrel-fresh txotx cider until August.

Sitting on the banks of the river Urumea, Goiko Lastola cider house has a dining area with a rustic and traditional design. Here, you can taste the typical cider house menu and enjoy cider straight from the barrels.

Magnificent cider house located in Muxika. Apart from the typical cider house menu for 27 Euro, it offers a wide range of grilled fish, such as red bream, monkfish and turbot. Possible practising Txotx system. Capacity: 100 guests. Car park available. The facility remains closed 15 days in August. OPENING HOURS From Tuesday to Sunday, no fixed timetable.

The Gurutzeta winery, located in the Ergoien de Astigarraga neighbourhood, produces delicious natural cider. This family-run business has been dedicated to its craft since the end of the 19th century. Gurutzeta produces its cider using a combination of modern and traditional techniques.

Typical Basque cider house with more than 200 years of history. It's located in a beautiful nature environment and visitors can enjoy the traditional cider house menu with cider taken from the barrels. The main speciality is cider house menu (costs 24 Euro). They also offer previously ordered food and other drinks. Visitors can take cider from the "kupelas". The restaurant has a car park and does not close on holidays.

OPENING HOURS:

Fri - Sun: 13:00-16:00 and 20:30-24:00

Sitting in a traditional farmhouse, there are two dining areas, with a rustic design. You can taste cider straight from the barrels all year round and enjoy the cider house menu. Both meats and fish are served. In addition, a special menu is available for celebratory events.

This cider house has more than 100 years of history, and combines modern style with a traditional flavour. It boasts four air-conditioned dining areas in which guests can indulge in dishes prepared using high-quality ingredients, as well as cider which they produce themselves from their own apple trees. Iparragirre is one of the cider houses taking part in the "Cider Experiences!" initiative.

Irigoien cider house, also known as Herrero, opened its doors 200 years ago, and continues to produce cider to this day using the same techniques as always. You can sample the typical cider house menu in its dining areas and enjoy the cider- which they make themselves- straight from the barrel.

A family-owned cider house which, since 1983, has marketed and sold cider- which they make themselves- using carefully selected apples.

Guests can enjoy a typical cider house menu, and can choose to have chops or lamb (the latter upon request). They can also indulge in cider poured directly from the kupelas, or barrels. Isastegi cider belongs to the first collective brand of Basque cider Gorenak.

The cider house is located 10 minutes from Hernani, in the neighbourhood of Osinaga. It is possible practising "txotx" system during cider season. Bottled cider is served out of season. Open throughout the year. Cider house menu between 25 and 30 Euro. Capacity: 120 guests. Car park available. OPENING HOURS Open in cider season from Monday to Friday from 8pm onwards (open at noon in case of making orders). Open at noon at the weekend.

The cider house was founded in 1998. From that moment onwards, the cider that can be drunk following "txotx" system has been produced in the farmhouse itself, using apples from Aramaio and its surroundings. Apart from the typical cider house menu (27 Euro), they also provide the chance to eat à la carte for 35 Euro approximately and ordering a special menu costs 21 Euro. A wide range of drinks available. Capacity: 90 guests. It is possible having meals out in the terrace in summertime. The terrace can hold up to 50 people. Car park available. OPENING HOURS Thu - Sun: 12pm - 3:30pm and 8:30pm - 11pm.

This restaurant offers a Typical cider house menu consisting of salads, cod omelettes, T-bone steak and cheese with quince. The speciality of the house, daily menu and varied shellfish also available. OPENING HOURS Wed-Sun: 10:30am - 11pm Mon: 10:30am - 5:30pm

Restaurant-cider house located in Aia where to taste either cider house menu or a wide range of fish and meat. Izagirre offers the possibility to practise "txotx" in a traditional way. Open throughout the year. Car park available.

Calonge is one of the cider houses taking part in the "Cider Experiences!" initiative. This is located in the Gurutzeta house in Igeldo, a short distance away from San Sebastian. In cider season, between January and April, it offers the typical cider house menu, which you can enjoy together with its extremely traditional ambience. For the remainder of the year, guests can enjoy a varied à la carte menu and mixed platters, while drinking in beautiful views of the Cantabrian coast.

galeria.titulo: Dining room in cider house Calonge

datosGenerales.descripcion: The restaurant is situated in a beautiful environment. Daily menu (9 Euro) and cider house menu accompanied by cider straight from the barrels (32 Euro). OPENING HOURS Every day: 7am - 6pm. Friday and Saturday open all night long.

In a pretty country setting, the Korta Restaurant offers updated traditional cooking and grilled dishes. It has a daily set meal, cider house set meal and shellfish platter. The restaurant has room for 250 people plus parking space. HOURS: Every day from 12.00 onwards.

Cider house in Astigarraga where it is possible to drink natural cider poured directly from the barrel. Guests can bring their own meat and grill it in the facility. Open as a cider house during "txotx" season, out of season the facility is open at the weekend. Capacity: 80 guests. Car park available. OPENING HOURS From Tuesday to Sunday during season: 1pm - 5:30pm and 8pm - 12am. Out of season at the weekend.

Traditional cider house with typical menu and cider produced in the very farmhouse. Despite the fact that the family running the cider house has been working producing cider for decades, it was in 1991 when they decided to open it up. Apples are usually from the farmhouse, but some of them are imported from Galicia and Asturias.

OPENING HOURS During season, lunch on working days, lunch and dinner on Saturday, lunch on Sunday.

Lezama cider house boasts two dining areas with a rustic décor. Here, as well as the typical cider house menu, you can indulge in the à la carte menu or the daily menu, and txotx cider is served all year round.

Traditional cider house in the farmhouse Gartziategi in Astigarraga. The guests can drink the best natural cider just poured off from the barrel and accompanied by the typical menu. Capacity: 100 guests. Car park available. OPENING HOURS Mon-Sat: 8pm - 12am. Closed on Sunday.

Grill restaurant situated near Loiu airport, in the former fairground. They offer different menus, such as the typical cider house menu and a tasting, among others. A comprehensive cold and warm buffet. Possibility of practising "txotx" system. A large list of drinks. Car park available.

The Mizpiradi cider house is located in a countryside farmhouse.

As well as the typical cider house menu, they also have a summer menu and its speciality dishes include the warm cod salad, scrambled eggs with mushrooms, dish and lamb, suckling pig and burduntzi-style kid.

Cider house in Errenteria that functions as a restaurant throughout the year. In cider season (January-May) they offer a typical cider house menu. Apart from this, they also serve dishes à la carte and daily menu with a wide range of options. Capacity: 60 guests. Car park available. OPENING HOURS Mon-Thu: 1pm - 3pm. Friday: 1pm - 3pm and 8pm - 11pm. Saturday: 8pm - 11pm. Closed on Sunday.

Cider house founded in 1992 in an old farmhouse. Half of the apples used for cider production come from the very farmhouse, the rest are imported from Galicia and Asturias. Its production is around 60,000 litres a year. They offer traditional menu and "sidra al txotx". OPENING HOURS 1pm - 4pm.

One of the oldest cider houses in Astigarraga, Oiarbide was founded more than 100 years ago. Most of its apples are from the region, although they also import from Galicia, Asturias or France. They serve traditional menu consisting of cod omelet and T-bone steak. OPENING HOURS: 12:30-23:30

The Ola cider house is located in an old 13th century blacksmith's. Its large dining room offers the typical cider house menu and barrel-freshtxotxcider. In addition to the cider house there is also a bar, terrace and grill house open all year round. Ola is one of the cider houses taking part in the "Cider Experiences!" initiative.

The Olagi cider house has two dining rooms where you can sample the typical cider house menu as well as traditional cuisine based on seasonal products and homemade desserts.

 You can also try barrel-fresh txotx cider all year round.With advanced reservation you can also sample their own reared chickens with Eusko Label.

A cider house established in 1993. It operated initially as a cider producer and subsequently opened its doors to the public in 1996. It is surrounded by nature, and here you can sample a traditional cider house menu as well as txotx cider, which they make from their own apple trees.

Cider house in Lasarte-Oria where we can bring your own meat to cook. It's only open during the cider season. We can taste the traditional cider house menu and cider taken out directly of the kupelas (barrels). Contact person: Julian Otegi Egia OPENING HOURS: 13:30-22:00

Cider house located in the farmhouse Otsua in Osinaga neighbourhood, in Hernani. They produce their own cider. The facility is open in cider season (January-April). Typical cider house menu (27 Euro) and cider from the barrels. Capacity: 100 guests. Car park available. OPENING HOURS Fri-Sun: From 2pm onwards.

The Petritegi cider house dates back to 1526.

 

The winery is currently run by the 5th generation of the Otaño-Goikoetxea family and offers the chance to enjoy a unique cultural and gastronomic experience in a unique atmosphere, based on natural cider, txotx and some typical Basque dishes.

The Rezola cider house has two dining rooms that offer the traditional cider house menu as well as a varied menu, summer menu, group set menus and its famous scrambled eggs with mushrooms. On the other hand, it offers barrel-fresh txotx cider all year round and alcohol-free cider.

Cider house located in Pasaia that offers during the whole year the typical cider house menu and cider taken out directly from the barrels. Moreover you can also taste menu à la carte and pintxos awarded several times. OPENING HOURS: 12:00-15:30 and 20:30-22:30

The Rosario restaurant-cider house has three dining rooms. In addition to the menu, it offers the typical cider house menu and barrel-fresh txotx cider. Its specialities include cod omelette, meat, fish and vegetables grown in their own garden.

Traditional cider house in Hernani. They produce their own cider, which will be later drunk in their restaurant. This cider house only opens during the cider season (January-May) and offers traditional cider house menu. OPENING HOURS: 12:00-14:30 and 20:30-23:00

The Saizar cider house is located in an old, renovated farmhouse surrounded by apple trees used to make its own cider. As well as the typical cider house menu, it offers a menu of dishes made with quality products and specialises in the grill. Traditional country-style premises where cider is served from the keg. Large capacity for guests.

Restaurant that works as grillroom and cider house. It's located in the centre of San Sebastian. We can enjoy the typical cider house menu with cider taken directly from the barrel.

Open all year long.

Restaurant and grill in Vitoria-Gasteiz with a wide range of dishes. It also offers cider house menu. Its specialities are monkfish, turbot and grilled T-bone steak. Diferent kinds of meals and drinks available. The restaurant can hold up to 65 people. Private dining rooms for hire. Although the cider house has no car park, there is a public car park nearby.

OPENING HOURS

Mon-Sat: 1:30pm - 4pm and 20:45pm - 23:00pm.
Small bar with some tables in it where the guests can taste a delicious cider house menu and "cazuelitas" (small casseroles with bites or tapas). Capacity: 24. No car park.

Traditional cider house located in the farmhouse Oiarbide, where we can drink the best cider of the season, accompanied by meat they provide or meat you can bring by your own. OPENING HOURS: Mon - Sat: 20:30-23:30

Cider house located in Aia, where we can drink the best natural house cider with a nice cider house menu. Itýs only open during the cider season, from January to May. OPENING HOURS: 12:00-16:00 and 20:00-23:00

At Restaurante Aurora Etxea superior quality dishes, based on traditional cuisine, are prepared using the finest raw materials. 

Over the years the restaurant has become the premier benchmark for dining in Vitoria-Gasteiz and is an ideal venue to host a whole array of events such as weddings, communions and business lunches and dinners. At Aurora Etxea we offer diners a friendly, family environment.

Cider house located next to the bullring in Bilbao. The typical cider house menu apart, they provide charcoal-grilled meat and hake in Biscayan style. Arranged menus also available. Possibility of practising Txotx system. Capacity: 300 guests. No car park.

This cider house is located in the Txindurri-iturri farmstead, which is still dedicated to family farming, and especially cider making. Natural ingredients are used in all the recipes and the cider is made from organically-grown apples. In addition to the typical cider house menu, it serves vegetarian and children’s menus.

Restaurant located in Urbil shopping centre where to taste cider house menu accompanied by bottled cider or cider poured off from the barrels. Also ordinary menu, special weekend menu and dishes à la carte. Capacity: 55 guests. Private car park. OPENING HOURS Working days: 10:30am ¿ 11pm. Weekends: 10:30am ¿ 12pm.

Family bar, grillroom and cider house specialised in grilled meat and fish and season products.

They also offer cider house menu with sidra al txotx. They have wine list and two pleasant rustic dining-rooms.

OPENING HOURS: Mon - Sun: 10:30-17:00 and 20:30-23:00

This family-run cider house opened its doors more than three decades ago. It specialises in grilled meats and fish. The 'txotx' ritual, a popular Basque tradition, is practised all year round (everyone in the bar is invited to drink some cider directly from the barrel, to the cry of ¿txotx!'). Guests can also choose from a typical cider house menu and an à la carte menu.

Traditional restaurant and cider house located in the neighbourhood of Ergoien, in Ataun.

Typical cider house menu accompanied by the best cider. Possibility of practising "txotx" system. Dishes à la carte consisting of season products (from June onwards). What is more, customers can bring their own meat and bread. Capacity: 100 guests. Private car park.

OPENING HOURS Mon-Fri: 7:30pm - 11pm. Weekends: 1:30pm - 3pm and 8pm - 11pm. Closed on Wednesday.

Located in a former farmhouse surrounded by apple trees, this cider house opens only for four months, from the 18th January to May, during the cider season.

They offer, in a traditional atmosphere, a nice cider house and menu à la carte. Customers can bring their own meat and bread.

OPENING HOURS: Mon - Fri: 20:00-23:30 Saturday and Sunday: 13:00-16:00

The cider house is located in a beautiful farmhouse in a rural setting.

Uxarte cider house provides the typical cider house menu with cider produced by themselves. It can be tasted directly from the kupelas, in the traditional way, practising Txotx system. Private car park available. Closed in August.

OPENING HOURS Open only on Friday, Saturday and Sunday.

R. Zabala cider house avails of machinery at the cutting edge of technology to produce its cider, but is careful to preserve a pure and traditional style. It boasts two dining areas where all kinds of celebrations can be held, and in which guests can indulge in a typical cider house menu. Zabala is one of the cider houses taking part in "Cider Experiences!".

Famous natural cider trademark that distributes its product in bottles.

The typical cider house menu available in cider season. It is possible to practise "txotx" system and eat standing. What is more, customers can bring their own meat and bread. Car park available. Open the whole year.

OPENING HOURS Mon-Fri: 8pm - 11:30pm.

Zelaia cider house sells bottled cider during the whole year.

But during the cider season it is possible to taste the best sidra al txotx in its restaurant, where they also serve a typical cider house menu.

galeria.titulo: Barrels of the Zelaia cider house

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Visit to the Talai Berri txakoli winery where one of the two sisters, 5th generation of the family's winemakers, will reveal all the secrets of txakoli.

 

After the visit, on the terrace and surrounded by 12 hectares of vineyards, we will taste Talai Berri txakoli and Eusko Label quality products, such as Ibarra chillies, Idiazabal DO cheese, white tuna and Basatxerri sausage.

 

Finally, we will have the opportunity to taste the exclusive Hondarrabi Zuri TTANTTA vinegars and the vermouths MARI ZURI and MARI GORRI.

 

Own parking and free WIFI.

 

Price: 15 euros per person

datosGenerales.nombre:
Trujal Almazara de la Rioja Alavesa.
Aceite de Oliva Virgen Extra
datosGenerales.descripcion: Trujales Almazara produce the best extra virgin olive of the Rioja Alavesa. With an excellent raw material, they produce a necessary product for our meals.

Founded in 1995, the Txabarri winery sells part of its production abroad. Their vineyards cultivate the hondarribi zuri, hondarribi beltza, pinot noir, cabernet sauvignon, and riesling foile blanc grape varieties, producing an excellent white, red and rosé wine. The txakolis, marketed under the Txabarri brand, correspond to the Bizkaiko Txakolina Designation of of Origin.

The Txomin Etxaniz winery has headed up the modernisation, recognition and creation of the Designation of Origin Getariako Txakolina.They prepare three types of wine:Txomin Etxaniz (pale yellow with fruity aromas and slightly acid); Eugenia (sparkling, pale yellow and fresh) and Uydi (late harvest, yellow and with residual sugar in balance with its characteristic acidity).

Fish and seafood dishes just by the sea shore.

Simple but neat and tidy facilities. Traditional family restaurant that offers market products, in particular fish.

Reasonable prices. The restaurant is located by Pasaia Bay.

Settled in an old Basque country house that combines traditional and modernist style; it has a wide glassware. This grillroom is specialised in grilled fish and seafood. OPENING HOURS: Everyday: 13:00-15:30 Dinner is also served on Fridays and Saturdays

Viña Real is a winery designed for the production and ageing of the Viña Real range of wines, using the most innovative methods of production. Cvne created this brand in 1920. The French architect Philippe Mazières conceived the winery Viña Real in 2004. 

Their planned tours let us discover the most innovating wine growing methods and walk through the caves. Also blind people can visit the winery thanks to an innovative system.

Familiar restaurant with over 50 years of history in the middle of Bilbao's Old Town. The bar at the entrance contains a wide range of "pintxos" (small culinary masterpieces) and a dining room decorated in traditional style on the ground floor. Simple dishes prepared with top quality products and an excellent presentation make up the menu. "Capuchina" cake as top dessert. Large wine cellar with a variety of Rioja wines. "Pintxos" and fish are its specialities. Contact: Demetrio. OPENING HOURS Mon - Sat: 1pm - 4pm and 9pm - 11pm. Cafeteria: 10am - 12am. Closed on Sunday (except May).

servicio.nombre: Member of National Consumer Arbitration Board

datosGenerales.descripcion: Young chef Ricardo Pérez runs this restaurant with minimalist decoration located in the Azkuna Zentroa building. It offers creative signature cuisine with seasonal products. It has two halls on different floors, decorated in black and white, with dyed oak floors. Attention to detail and friendly, professional service. Good wine cellar. Designed by Philippe Starck, it has a marvellous terrace.
Famous Asian restaurant. Wide menu of Asian dishes, especially Japanese: sushi, sashimi, green tea ice-cream and, in the customer's presence, teppanyaki or grilled dishes.

One of the most prestigious restaurants in Vitoria-Gasteiz located beside the courthouse in Alava's capital. It was established in 1984 and for 14 years has been organising the Certamen de Alta Cocina, where the best international and domestic chefs have taken part. Restaurant Zaldiaran has been granted several awards at both Spanish and Basque Country level. It has one Michelin star and the Q of Tourist Quality. It consists of an 800-m2 dining room, where the visitors will taste any type of cuisine. What's more, Zaldiaran has private dining rooms for smaller groups.

galeria.titulo: Dining room at the Zaldiaran Restaurant

datosGenerales.descripcion: Modern restaurant decorated in minimalist style with several bright dining rooms. Meticulous preparation and a wide range of menus. Chef Iñigo Ordorica offers charcoal-grilled meat and fish and traditional recipes, as well as creative and innovative dishes.

A hundred year old house with cosy atmosphere and old furniture, fireplace included. Its cuisine is a reference in the area, traditional with modern touches. Alberto Elorza presents elaborated and tasty dishes, always fusing tradition and modernity. Top quality desserts. A bar at the entrance. Large banquets are arranged. Car park available.
In a typical fishermen house dating back to the 16th century, guests will enjoy seasonal products, especially good fish and seafood. It is a rustic-style family restaurant with cosy atmosphere.
Rustic decoration restaurant that offers traditional dishes and grilled fish or meat, together with more modern and elaborate recipes. There is a bar with tables where special price menus are served.

Elegantly decorated traditional and emblematic facilities.

 

Two different atmospheres of impeccable staging. Famous Chef Daniel García offers a creative menu of Basque roots, but providing his own personal touch. Exquisite attentions. Excellent wine cellar open to the public, where it is possible purchasing the best Rioja wines. Private room.

 

Additional information

Daniel García's Cooking Classroom offers tastings, exhibitions and cooking courses and food and wine pairing for groups of over 8. Reservation required. These activities can be held from Tuesday to Thursday lunchtime or evening and Friday lunchtime.
The only McDonald's restaurant in Bilbao. Open since 2005. They offer fast food, mainly hamburgers. OPENING HOURS 12pm ¿ 11pm. Fri-Sat: open till 12am or 1am. Sun: open till 11:30pm.
Appellation that adopts the txakoli produced by Marítimo Zarautz, S.L., with Bizkaiko Txakolina Guarantee of Origin.

The winery was founded in the sixties by a group of wine producers of Rioja Alavesa. On the vineyards, protected by the Sierra de Toloño Mountain Range, they cultivate the tempranillo and viura grape varieties, with an average of 25 years.

 

Thus, they are able to market an excellent wine. Guided tours are available on Saturdays. Prior booking is required.

Viña Salceda opened in 1969 aiming to produce red top quality wines. Surrounded by vineyards, guided tours are possible to both the vineyard and its facilities, where the people will be shown how wine is produced, and given tastings with explanations. What is more, if you want to enjoy a complete day, you have the chance to taste wines along with a delicious meal in the fantastic dining room with magnificent views of the River Ebro. Viña Salceda produces four different wines, which it markets under three brands: "Viña Salceda" (Crianza and Reserva), "Conde de la Salceda" (Reserva) and "Puente de Salceda" (Crianza).

Bodegas Solar de Samaniego, located in Laguardia, a historic medieval town in the heart of the Rioja Alavesa, have recovered and reinterpreted their industrial architecture from the early 1970s and turned it into a space to enjoy the culture of wine and literature. The “Beber Entre Líneas” project (Drink Between the Lines) has transformed every corner of the Winery to create unique eno-literary atmospheres: the Bookshop-Store designed by interior designer Lázaro Rosa-Violán, the Sala de Fincas Room, the Fábulas&Barricas Room (Fables&Barrels) or the Medio Millón Space, with a monumental artistic intervention by muralist Guido van Helten on the former wine tanks, have turned it into a tourist attraction for the area.
CATAVINUM Wine School runs beginner wine-tasting courses for individuals, companies and professionals from the wine-making sector.

Continuing a tradition of more than two centuries, in 1928 was founded the winery Luis Cañas. Only from 1970 they started with the marketing. Actually is one of the most important winery in Rioja Alavesa. They have won a lot of prizes. The last one was when "Reserva Especial de la Familia 2006" won the prize for best wine in the world, during the important contest "Decanter prizes".

This winery, which today boasts 55 hectares of vineyards, was founded by Julio Martínez Bujanda in 1976, in keeping with a long and solid family tradition in the grape-growing industry. In 1988 the winery was extensively remodelled but it was in 1999, after the facilities were extended again and upgraded, that the crianza (aged for 2 years) and reserva (aged for 3 years) ranges were added to its famous joven (¿young¿) red wine. In 2004 the winery was extended again to create a new processing facility. Today Ondalan produces and sells five types of wine: a young wine (¿Laudo¿), a select red wine (¿100 Abades¿), another select wine (made entirely from tempranillo grapes), a crianza wine (¿Ondalan) and a reserva (¿Ondalan").

Founded in 1994, they produce an excellent white wine with the Bizkaiko Txakolina Guarantee of Origin. With modern facilities, they work hard in order to produce a txakoli with an excellent flavour and quality.

The house hosting this internationally-acclaimed restaurant was built in 1897 in order to function as cellar and inn.

Later on it became a food house specialising in banquets. In 1966 Juan Mari Arzak took control of the restaurant and elevated it to the culinary top. Nowadays his daughter Elena helps him. The menu reflects the permanent creation of new dishes with constant and traditional roots. The restaurant consists of a "laboratory" that analyses flavours, textures and production-processes. Efficient and personalised service.

Spectacular wine list with the best denomination of origin wines.

Ancient mill turned into a cider house with long shared tables and benches. Specialities such as grilled or sauced fishes, steaks and game stand out in the menu. It is the ideal place for congresses as, apart from their excellent dishes and service, the restaurant organises receptions and functions including exhibitions of Basque dancing, rural sports, etc.

Julián Rivas opened the inn in the 50s and soon became a steakhouse that has maintained its ancient look up to the present days.

Matías Gorrotxategi, one of the best grill cooks in the country, prepares brilliantly big steaks in a fireproof brick chimney. Fixed menu with lettuce hearts, Iberian pork products or Navarre asparagus and grilled big steak.

Magnificent cellar and nice atmosphere. Car park available.

Olarizu restaurant is equipped to cater for large banquets. It has a capacity for 365 guests and specializes in weddings and corporate events. Furthermore, it also has private dining rooms for smaller groups. 

It combines traditional Basque cuisine with new trends in the field. 

It has a nightclub, wi-fi access and an audiovisual video service for congresses.

servicio.nombre: Member of National Consumer Arbitration Board

datosGenerales.descripcion: Urritza restaurant in Aduna serves a daily menu and food to go, as well as offering an à la carte menu based on traditional Basque cuisine. All of its dishes are prepared using fresh ingredients, which are selected with great care.
The best Basque cuisine dishes with the best service, and in the core of Donostia-San Sebastián¿s old part. Paying parkings nearby. OPENING HOURS: 13:30-15:30 and 20:30-23:00

A family business providing excellent grill for high quality fish and seafood. Restaurant Kaia offers the most innovative cuisine and Kaipe functions as a grill in summertime and on the weekends. Beautiful views over the sea and good quality on both premises. Well-stocked and select cellar. Car park in the surroundings.

Friendly cider house in Santutxu, whose menus consist of exquisite delicacies accompanied by the best cider, directly from the barrels ("kupelas"). They also offer other sorts of meals and drinks. Possibility of practising "txotx" system. No car park. OPENING HOURS 12:30pm - 3:30pm and 8:30pm - 11pm.

The Tximista cider house, with more than 30 years of experience behind it, is located in the centre of Ordizia, in the heart of the Goierri area. It makes natural cider out of apples from its estate.

 

It has two rooms with space for a total of 140 people, and here the kupelas or vats are kept, 5 wood and 8 stainless steel. A glass wall separates the txotx, where the cider is consumed, from the work area, so visitors can see all the equipment used to make the cider they are drinking.

 

As well as the typical cider house meals, children’s and special meals are available by arrangement. Guided tours are also run, in cooperation with the tourist office. The railway station is just 200 metres away and there is a car park.

Excellent cuisine by Martin Aristondo. Good product, delicate creativity and avant-garde touches on traditional cookery. Wine menu deliberately concise but of high quality. Wide and nice dining room with neatly done service. Basque cuisine is present in this restaurant that is located at the San Sebastián's Aranzazu Hotel. Halls for rental.

One of the best bars in the city, it is very famous due to the multiple awards obtained in miniature cuisine competitions. Its cosy interior dining-room offers the so called ¿miniature-cookery¿ with wide and varied tasting menus: from six to eight dishes and two desserts.

datosRestauracion.capacidad: Two dining rooms: one for 45 people (a la carte) and another one for 35 people (pintxos)

datosGenerales.descripcion: Restaurant, situated in Hotel Indautxu, with top quality and red and blue decoration that combines traditional Basque cuisine recipes with more avant-garde ones. Predominance of seasonal products. Buffet available.

Updated traditional Basque cuisine in a restaurant with beautiful views. Izaskun Iparragirre and Kepa Alza run the facility that also consists of a bar and a large terrace. Chef Josu Aranguren offers very elaborate dishes. Nice decoration and good service. Specialities: meet and fish. OPENING HOURS Mon-Fri: 1pm ¿4pm. Fri-Sat: 9pm ¿ 11pm.

Traditional Basque cuisine in a classic restaurant in the area. It is located in front of Ereaga Beach, with remarkable views of the sea and a pleasant semi-covered terrace. Several classic-style dining rooms and a coffee bar decorated with sea motifs. Good wine cellar with Rioja wines, visits allowed - museum with 25,000 bottles of Rioja wine. Rooms for hire.

galeria.titulo: Dining room in Los Tamarises restaurant

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Simple but top quality seafood served in an old building facing the Gulf of Biscay.

The perfect place to recommend having lunch regularly, for there is a great price-quality relationship. Original menu.

Artola restaurant, located in the city centre, offers traditional Basque cuisine based on good quality ingredients. Its dishes are made with seasonal, high quality products. One highlight is its elaborated set daily menu, it also has special and weekend set menus.

The restaurant provides cider house menu and dishes à la carte in a cosy dining room. Open the whole year. Cider poured off from barrels in "txotx" season. Capacity: 80 guests. Car park available. OPENING HOURS From Tuesday to Thursday in summer: 1pm - 3:30pm and 8pm - 10:30pm. Closed on Monday. Open over the week and bank holiday the rest of the year.

In 1886, Manuel Goya opened his first confectionery and cake shop in Vitoria-Gasteiz, starting an artisan tradition which has lasted up to present.

After five generations, this tradition makes Goya stand as one of the most representative confectionery and cake shops in the Basque country. Goyaýs best known confectionery products are their bonbon varieties, "Vasquitos" y "Nesquitas" and "trufas". During the Christmas season, they also elaborate "turrón", offering 20 different varieties of this typical nougat confection. Other specialities sold all year round include a range of cakes and sweets. At Goya, they still make confectionery delicacies in a traditional way, although aided by modern technologies, to preserve the taste and quality of their products.

Apart from the shops in Dato street, other Confiterías Goya shops in Vitoria are: Av. Gasteiz, 45 y 78 (945 240 657) / Ortiz de Zárate, 6 (former bakery) (945 258 285) / Duque De Wellington 10 (945 178 932) / Avenida de Zabalgana 35 (945 357 089) / Avenida 8 de Marzo (945 335 994) / Calle Postas, 45 (945 777 754)  y Office and bakery: Barratxi, 35 (945 128 059).

Opening hours: Every day: 09:30 - 14:00 and 17:00 - 20:00.

Remarks: It is possible to order directly this confectionaryýs products from the shopýs website.

Parking: There is an underground paid car park on the street calle Arca and another one in Dendaraba shopping center, near calle Dato street, where the shop is.

The prestigious Arrese confectionary and cake shop, that opened in 1.852, is known by its handmede confectionery, not only cakes but also chocolates. Besides, the Arrese shop which is in the Gran Vía bilbaína, shows us many of the delights of its golden age,offering a great range of the traditional confectionery: pasteles de todo tipo, exquisitas pastas de té, clásicos bollos de mantequilla, tartas, bombones, etc. Pero, sobre, lo que distingue a esta afamada pastelería son sus codiciadas trufas, de elaboración artesanal. Other shops: Rodríguez Arias 35 -Bilbao- (944 051 572) Calle Mayor, 9. 48930 -Las Arenas- (Getxo) (944 800 172) Opening hours: Mon - Sat: 9:00 - 21:00. Sunday: 9:00 - 15:00 and 17:00 - 20:30. Parking: As it is located in the town centre of Bilbao, Arrese confectioner´s shop is surrounded by TAO regulated pay parking area. Besides, the underground pay parkings or the nearest parkings are the one of the Ensanche y Pío Baroja.

servicio.nombre: Member of National Consumer Arbitration Board

galeria.titulo: Arrese is well know because of its delicious chocolate truffles.

datosGenerales.descripcion: Otaegui confectioner's has different establishments in Donostia-San Sebastián and it is one of the most traditional confectionerýs shops of the city. From 1886 (year when it was founded by Pedro Otaegui and Emiliana Malcorra) they offer excellent sweet products and it has became a wonderful meeting point for citizens of Donostia-San Sebastián and visitors. Among the specialities that they offer, stands out the delicious Pantxineta, puff pastry with cream and handmade nougat candy. In addition, they have kept their initial spirit, the secret of the handmade sweets that made famous the confectioner's. Other shops: Matía, 3 (Tel. 943 218 089) Secundino Esnaola, 2 (Tel. 943 276 933) -Café- Sancho el Sabio, 24 -Café- San Martín, 30 Garibay, 23 (Tel. 943 421 045) -Café- Opening hours: 9:30 - 14:00 and 17:00 - 20:30 Contact person: María Otaegui. Parking: The nearest underground pay car parks are Boulevard and Okendo.

galeria.titulo: Otaegui confectionerýs is one of the most traditional confectionerýs shops of Donostia-San Sebastián

datosGenerales.descripcion: Patisseries Zuricalday are a traditional family company created over 100 hundred years ago in Getxo. They focus on producing top quality artisan products and all sorts of cakes to be sold in its two shops located in Las Arenas and Algorta respectively. Besides, in their very shops the customers will find tea rooms, which are very visited in the evenings to taste their Swiss or butter buns, among other specialities. Zuricalday owns a bakery workroom where the staff produce their own daily products. Home delivery service also available and, in very special cases, they offer their services off-place. Zuricalday cake shops produce seasonal products, such as homemade nougats, "rosco de Reyes" ( big cake with a gift inside), "yemas" (sweets made from egg yolks and sugar), "glorias", marrón glacé, candied fruits, Carnivals toasting, original Easter eggs and "monas" produced in the very bakery, All Saint's fritters and "huesitos". Other shops: Amesti, 19 48991 Algorta (Getxo) Tel: 944 910 573 Fax: 944 910 567 Opening hours Winter: 9am ¿ 2pm and 5pm - 8:30pm Summer: 9am ¿ 2pm and 4:30pm - 8:30pm Contact: Ana Olabarria.

galeria.titulo: Zuricalday cake shops produce high quality pastry products and cakes

datosGenerales.descripcion: The landhouse of the Beaskoetxea and Aurre family is both a restaurant and a txakoli winery. The winery was created in 1950. The vineyards cultivate the folle blanca and hondarribi zuri grape varieties. The txakoli is of an excellent quality and enjoy a great renown nearby. The restaurant offers basque traditional cuisine and can hold up to 200 people.

Meaztegi Golf Restaurant is located in the Meaztegi Golf Club of La Arboleda, in Trapagaran. In this marvellous landscape of the golf course and the natural environment, a high quality and modern cuisine is offered to enjoy a moment of relaxation and delight the taste with the delicious dishes. They are professionals in catering and carry out a new project in order to please and to attend to you. Classical beens. Professional service.

The restaurant is located within a 13th century neo-Gothic castle made of limestone and marble in the heart of the Urdaibai Biosphere Reserve. The building was restored in 1856 by French architects Couverchef and Ancelet in appreciation of the appointment of María Eugenia de Montijo and Napoleon III's son as native of Bizkaia. Its barbecued meat and creative Basque cuisine stand out. Good winery. Professional service. Customers can create their own menus. It features 14 rooms with different decorations.

The restaurant in situated in a wonderful setting. Four wide dining rooms, of which one is private and only serves à la carte dishes. The latter has been internationally awarded and its traditional decoration, air conditioning and its state of being separate from the rest of the rooms make of it a nice and cosy space. Perfect place for certain celebrations such as family meetings where the guests will worship the most delicious cuisine. Recipes including game and tasty puddings are worth mentioning. During the first months celebrated chef Xabier Zapirain was responsible for the cuisine. Nowadays his children are in charge of following the tradition, but always with their father's expert advice.

Located in the very heart of Rioja Alavesa, in Elvillar to be precise, Viña Laguardia was founded in 1910. It was originally built in the town centre, where the wine was produced until the present owners erected the current winery in 1969 at the town entrance. It was in 2006 when a large re-structuring was carried out. The winery is equipped with the latest technology to produce wine, although it should be noted that procedures are those traditional of Rioja Alavesa's. Currently Viña Laguardia markets white, new and select wines.

Located in Aia (Gipuzkoa) and with over 10 years of experience, Altxerri is an ideal place for family and business meals or even to enjoy the delicious "tapas" (snacks). Tradition and modernity are combined. Tradition, products, creativity and flavour melt in Altxerri in a unique concept: the clients' satisfaction.

A restored farmhouse located in Axpe (Atxondo) is home to Asador Etxebarri, a grill that over the past years has been recognised by specialised critics and has appeared in the world's most prestigious gastronomic guides.

 

Chef Víctor Arginzoniz considered by many a "grill genius", cooks delicious dishes on his firewood grill by means of the best raw material. One of his dishes that should be ordered is old beef chop, although diners will also have the chance to taste grilled oysters, scallops, elvers, lobster, anchovies or sirloin steak, among others.

 

Puddings are also remarkable.

Located in front of the popular Jardines de Albia, Café Iruña opened its doors on July 7th of 1903 by Severo Unzue Donamaría, from Navarre.

The premises measure 300 square metres divided into several spaces decorated in Mudejar style. It is open every day of the year and serves breakfast, day menu, snacks in the afternoon-evening and dinner (à la carte).

In addition, there is a wide range of pinchos (small culinary masterpieces) such as the celebrated "pinchos morunos", made following the traditional method.

Located in Pasai Donibane, a few minutes from San Sebastián, Casa Mirones serves traditional Basque dishes that include the latest tendencies where local fish and sea food prevail. The restaurant also offers delicious meat and excellent puddings, all of them homemade. 

The interior is decorated with meticulous care along with the cosy and special atmosphere.

Rojo y Negro is a restaurant-bar located in the city centre of San Sebastián, a few metres from La Concha Beach, symbol of the city. It's wide and varied pintxo offer is remarkable (either cold or warm). The menu specialises mainly in traditional Basque cuisine and they provide day menu. A large dinning room available with a capacity of about 40 diners. Terrace at the clients' disposal in the summertime. A magical spot for enthusiasts of delicacies in miniature.

Beautiful restaurant located 10 minutes from the Guggenheim Museum that serves different menus for numerous celebrations. The large space is ideal to hold communion celebrations, lunches and business meetings. In addition, the restaurant is also available for registry office weddings with a magnificent landscape in a cosy atmosphere and an unparalleled setting.

Beautiful restaurant with the ria at the back and where to taste a good T-bone steak and other exquisite dishes without forgetting its delicious puddings and coffees.

 

Their best products are served every day in a warm and cared atmosphere.

Located in the city centre of Gipuzkoa's capital and very close to the City Hall, Mesón Martín serves every day top quality dishes based on the traditional Basque cuisine. The establishment also offers a wide range of pintxos available on the counter where it is recommended to taste the mixture of delicious flavours made with the best raw material. Thanks to its experience throughout years, Mesón Martín has turn into one of the main landmarks in regional cuisine. Example of it would be the endless number of clients who remain loyal to Mesón Martín. Top pintxo: "Trainera".

Surrounded by dream gardens, Aspaldiko is located in a beautiful farmhouse dating back to the 16th century with private dinning rooms that can hold up to 300 diners. Its wide and varied range of menus and carte are remarkable and specialise mainly on the traditional Basque cuisine. A magical place, ideal for enthusiasts of good food.

Bergara Gros is a bar located in the very heart of San Sebastián and a few metres from La Zurriola Beach. Its wide and varied pintxo offer (both cold and warm) is remarkable. The bar also serves sandwiches and there is a very cosy dinning room at the clients' disposal. A magical corner, ideal for lovers of delicacies in miniature.

Txuleta is a restaurant-bar located in the centre of the capital city of Gipuzkoa. Its wide and varied pincho offer (both cold and warm) and menu mainly specialising in traditional Basque cuisine draw the clients' attention. In charge of the cuisine, Ander cooks remarkable grilled dishes. The raw materials are also outstanding. This is a magical corner, ideal for lovers of delicacies in miniature.

Sarriena is located in Sarriena neighbourhood, in the upper area of Leioa. Two totally separate zones make up the restaurant: the restaurant and the steakhouse, all this surrounded by a playground and a wide car park for the clients' comfort. Day menus, menus for the groups, communions, weddings and delicious dishes à la carte available at the restaurant. The grill provides its clients with exquisite chicken, salads and many other locally grown produce.

Located opposite La Ribera Market, Mina serves a tasting menu that can be subject to a few changes. Creative and full-of-contrast cuisine along with a varied and high-quality wine list.

 

The facilities are cosy and have an intimate atmosphere overlooking Bilbao's ria.

 

A very advisable restaurant for lovers of new tastes and the respectful gastronomic debate.

Mini Bar restaurant boasts two dining areas, and its food is based on traditional Basque cuisine. Its speciality is banquets, and also charcoal-grilled dishes. In addition, it offers a menu of the day, as well as a catering service, and has a bar with a wide variety of pintxos.

Located in the Gros neighbourhood, Bergara restaurant offers more than 60 varieties of pintxos, served hot or cold. In addition, it offers a taster menu and homemade desserts. A magic place, perfect for lovers of miniature delicacies.

galeria.titulo: Piquillo sweet with cheese cream and custard

datosGenerales.descripcion: Cafeteria located in the emblematic Euskalduna Convention Centre, in Bilbao. As its name points out, it is situated in Abandoibarra ¿by the ria-, in an area whose appearance has been completely transformed over the past years, thereby becoming one of the most tourist spots in Bilbao. Cafetería Abandoibarra serves a wide range of modern pintxos and also the day menu.

Restaurant belonging to McDonald's chain of hamburger fast food restaurants. Located in Getxo Marina, it offers fast food, mainly hamburgers, although there are also sandwitches, salads, puddings, icecreams and all sorts of side dishes ¿fries, chicken wings- and drinks at the clients' disposal. The first McDonald's was opened by Dic and Mac McDonald in 1940 in California. Nowadays it is one of the chain restaurants with more restaurants spread worldwide. Its slogan ("I'm lovin' it") and its mascot (the clown Roland McDonald) are well-known to everybody.

datosContacto.direccion: Puerto Deportivo, Marqués de Arriluze s/n

datosGenerales.descripcion: Restaurant belonging to McDonald's chain of hamburger fast food restaurants. Located in Artea Shopping Centre (Leioa), it offers fast food, mainly hamburgers, although there are also sandwitches, salads, puddings, icecreams and all sorts of side dishes fries, chicken wings- and drinks at the clients' disposal. The first McDonald's was opened by Dic and Mac McDonald in 1940 in California. Nowadays it is one of the chain restaurants with more restaurants spread worldwide. Its slogan ("I'm lovin' it") and its mascot (the clown Roland McDonald) are well-known to everybody.

Olentzo restaurant is located in a large rambling house, and is cosy and attractive, boasting two large dining rooms designed in a rustic style. Guests can choose between the à la carte menu, a daily menu, a weekend menu, or special menus for groups and all types of celebrations.

Kaskazuri offers the possibility to sample all types of starter dishes, and the best meat and fish, without forgetting about the exquisite deserts. They offer a daily menu and a taster menu, as well as an extensive à la carte menu. The décor is simple yet elegant, and from its large window, we will be able to enjoy some spectacular views.

Bodegas Izadi originated in 1987 and since its beginning it has specialised in producing top quality wines. The winery owns 187 hectares of old vineyards facing south.

 

This winery has received several awards for its wines. Most notably, it was recognised by Wine & Spirits in 2012, which included Izadi in its list of the top 100 wineries in the world.

 

The prestigious North American magazine defines it as one of the most-highly regarded Spanish wines in the US market. The winery is divided into 5 floors and offers a restaurant service as well as 11 elegant hotel rooms.

The San Pedro Family has been producing wines in a traditional way in Laguardia for more than 500. The winery is over 200 years old and as every ancient Laguardia wineries, it is located in the town centre. Situated 8 metres underground in the basement, traffic is forbidden over the winery on the surface. It should also be noted that this is one of the few ancient wineries in Laguardia that still produces wine.

Founded in 1937, the winery was named after the typical ancestral houses of Laguardia. Generation after generation, it has had a tight relationship with vine growers, thereby making the quality of grapes to produce its wine exceptional. The raw material of quality, the traditional system and the latest technologies go hand in hand at the celebrated winery of Laguardia. They market crianza (new), reserve and harvester wine.

Javier San Pedro Rández, a descendent of winegrowers, created the Vallobera winery in 1990 together with his wife Ana Ortega, and in the process became the first member of the San Pedro family to bottle the family product. It is a family-owned winery whose main objective is to produce wines of the highest quality. Three wine ranges are currently produced at the winery, under the names of "Vallobera", "Javier San Pedro" and "Siete Castillos". It boasts facilities which extend over 5,000 square metres, located just 400 metres from Laguardia town centre.

Direct descendant of Bodegas Heredad de Baroja, which was the first masterpiece by Fernando Meruelo and Félix Revuelta, they later created Bodegas Lar de Paula in the heart of Rioja Alavesa. Simple and adapted to the setting, the building was erected attaching importance to the main functionality: to make it easier the grapes' transformation to wine.

 

The working processes in Bodegas Lar de Paula base on the combination of the most traditional production methods with the latest technologies and a new way to understand the wine world. With grapes from vines of over 20 years they produce modern wines.

 

Their wide range of wines is marketed under the following brands: "Lar de Paula" (white, mature, new, reserve and old stocks) and "Merus.4" (high expression).

Ganbara restaurant serves an extensive and varied selection of pintxos, which no lover of miniature delicacies will be able to resist. The menu is based on traditional Basque cuisine but has a modern touch, and its grilled fish and dishes prepared with seasonal mushrooms and fungi certainly merit a special mention.

This restaurant is located in Laguardia. The experience inherited from their father, who has been producing carbonic maceration wine since the 1950s, enables the winery's current managers to produce great wines.

 

They also incorporate new production methods and monitor changing trends in oenology and tourism. It markets its wines (a young red wine and a barrel-aged red wine) under the brand "Viña Lamioga".

 

Tours are available for maximum group sizes of 15-20 people. Prior reservation is required. Admission is 2 euros per person and the price includes wine-tasting. In addition, snacks and lunches are available for a maximum of 15 people (please check prices). The winery also takes charge of Larretxori agritourism.

Iturri Ondo restaurant, located in a peaceful setting and with a spacious dining area, prepares dishes based on traditional Basque cuisine, while adding its own special touch. It serves daily, special, and set menus, as well as an extensive à la carte menu. Its specialties are meat, fish, and desserts.

The Araba restaurant boasts two spacious parlours, ideal for all types of celebrations, and as well as the à la carte menu, they offer a daily menu, special menus, and menus for Friday and Saturday night meals. 

Among their specialities you will find roast lamb and suckling pig.

Virgen Blanca is located in the heart of the old town in Álava¿s capital, in the square of the same name. They serve elaborate dishes that are both innovative and fascinating. At the bar we can also find sandwiches and high-end pintxos. 

The restaurant also often plays host to a rich variety of musical performances and cultural activities.

galeria.titulo: The Virgen Blanca restaurant outside dining area

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Estadio restaurant fuses traditional and modern cuisine and is ideal for all types of celebrations. It serves a taster menu and offers "customised" menus, adapting to the individual preferences of its guests. 

In its café, we can enjoy a variety of pintxos, sandwiches and all types of snacks.

Located in the heart of the old town, the Ubarrechena restaurant boasts two dining areas. They offer a daily menu as well as a comprehensive à la carte menu, which includes salads, pasta, paellas, meats and fish. In addition, they offer a children's menu, and its homemade cakes are particularly delicious.

Located on the street named Cuchillería, one of the most emblematic areas of bars in the Alavese capital, El 7 Restaurant serves a wide variety of rolls, which are very well known amongst the residents, and serves pintxos and typical small dishes of food. 

It also offers a daily menu, based on great homemade food. Besides, the customer has the option to choose the filling for their roll. 

At night, the restaurant turns into a bar. Worth noting is that it is magnificent value for money.

The Soraluze Restaurant is located in the hotel of the same name, in the town of Oñati, only one kilometre away from the Sanctuary of Arantzazu. Traditional Basque cuisine is combined with modern cuisine, and dishes are prepared with seasonal produce. The restaurant has two dining rooms and offers a varied menu, a daily menu and a special weekend menu. It is perfect for hosting banquets and celebrations of various kinds.

datosRestauracion.capacidad: Two dining rooms for 50 and 140 guests

datosGenerales.descripcion: Zurekin is a sophisticated and charming restaurant which combines traditional cuisine with cuisine d'auteur. Located in the heart of Vizcaya's capital, it serves superb and original breakfasts with natural juices, delicious little casseroles, and pintxos, served warm or cold. In addition, they offer a sampling menu and special menus for groups. This makes Zurekin the ideal place to organise events of all kinds, such as work meetings, birthday parties and press conferences.

Located in the heart of San Sebastian's Old Town and opened in 1929, Casa Tiburcio restaurant offers a menu based on traditional Basque cuisine. 

It boasts a dining area with a décor which is rustic and elegant at the same time, and a bar filled with pintxos.

galeria.titulo: Dining room in Casa Tiburcio restaurant

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Jauregibarria restaurant is located in the middle of an expansive botanic park.

It serves traditional cuisine as well as totally innovative dishes, offers different types of menus and also an extensive à la carte menu, with dishes prepared in accordance with the guests' requests.

Ametzagaña restaurant is surrounded by farmhouses and green fields, a place set amid rural nature and the beautiful city of San Sebastian. It offers the very best seasonal produce and an exclusive selection of dishes, perfect for the whole family to enjoy in quiet surroundings. Diners can avail of an extensive à la carte menu, special menus and a daily menu. They also have a playground, entertainment for the children and a large car park, which is free of charge.

georeferenciacion.gmAddress: Camino de Uba, 61, 20014 San Sebastián, España

datosGenerales.descripcion: Zirikada restaurant serves dishes which combine traditional Basque cuisine with innovative cooking. It offers a daily menu, special and weekend menus, taster menus, special menus for groups and à la carte dishes. In addition, there is a park situated beside the restaurant, which has swings for toddlers to play on.

Located in the centre of Irun, Gaztelumendi-Antxon restaurant was founded in 1970. Since then it has been offering diners extraordinary traditional Basque cuisine restaurant that has become a point of reference for thousands of visitors. The restaurant has a large dining room where they serve the daily menu, special menus, lunch and dinner a la carte and also cater for groups and companies.

Poli is a restaurant based on traditional Basque cuisine, located in a former farmhouse in the Andra Mari district of Morga. It offers set menus, special menus and à la carte. Its dishes include alubias con sacramentos (bean stew). Also worthy of special mention are the fresh fish, steak and homemade desserts.

The Oiharte cider house makes traditional-style cider, with its own home-grown apples.As well as the typical cider house menu, it offers group lunches and dinners (8 diners or more) with advanced reservation.Oiharte is also an agritourism establishment. Oiharte is one of the cider houses taking part in the "Cider Experiences!" initiative.

Palacio San Joseren restaurant sits in Las Arenas (Getxo). It caters for working lunches, coffee breaks, gala dinners and celebrations and also offers external catering. Prior reservations must be made. Natural light reaches all eight of its rooms. These rooms, indeed, have each been designed with a different décor. Guests will pass through an English-style garden at the entrance to the restaurant. Particularly delicious is the Cantabrian hake in a red shrimp sauce.

The chef Iker Markinez is responsible for the dishes served up in Kuko restaurant, located in the centre of Ormaiztegi, just 50 metres from the emblematic Zumalakarregi Museum. The cuisine is based on traditional dishes, which the chef imbues with his personal touch. Some of the tastiest dishes include the baked fish, the warm house salad, the prawn and vegetable puff pastry and the homemade desserts. Kuko constantly changes and revamps its menu, with a special focus on seasonal products.

Iriarte restaurant opened its doors in 1999, and boasts a modern dining area with a traditional touch. The chef Felix Belaunzaran serves up traditional cuisine as well as seasonal dishes, always using high quality products and prepared with painstaking attention to detail. The restaurant's specialty is the suckling pig. Guests can enjoy their meals at a spacious outside dining area, located in the town square.

Otzaurteko Benta, a family-run restaurant, is located in Zegama on the way up to the Aizkorri-Aratz Natural Park and is surrounded by nature. Dishes are based on traditional Basque cuisine and house specials include the beans, roast lamb and tripe as well as the chorizo and black pudding pintxos and homemade stock.

Bartzelona is a restaurant and rural house located in the Esnaola neighbourhood in Legorreta, and is surrounded by nature. During the week, at midday, it serves a daily menu. At night (this includes Saturday and Sunday nights), it serves mixed platters. From Friday to Sunday at midday it serves an à la carte menu. In addition, Bartzelona has three cider barrels from which guests can taste the cider, which is poured directly from the barrel into their glasses.

The dishes served at Mandio restaurant are based on traditional Basque cuisine and are prepared using fresh products from the area, such as Idiazabal cheese and Lumagorri free-range chickens. In addition to its meats and fishes, it stands out for its sweet home-made desserts and its pintxos. At weekends, starting from September, guests can enjoy the renowned Tolosa beans.

datosRestauracion.capacidad: 23 in the dining area and 30 in the summer outside dining area

datosGenerales.descripcion: Iturrigoxo restaurant is located in the Amasa square, in Villabona. It boasts a dining area with a simple, yet elegant décor, where we can indulge in both traditional and creative cuisine. The restaurant offers a daily menu as well as a seasonal menu and à la carte dishes. Some of its specialties include hake coated in baby squid in their own ink, roast lamb and roast suckling pig. In addition, the restaurant has a traditional bar, where we can enjoy pintxos and cazuelitas.

datosRestauracion.capacidad: Two dining areas for 30 and 45 guests

datosGenerales.descripcion: Oteñe is in a prime location, between the Txindoki and Aralar mountains. Here we can sample traditional Basque cuisine, and from the terrace, we¿ll enjoy a spectacular view of Mount Aralar. Their specialities are products native to the region as well as grilled chicken and lamb.

Karrika opened its doors in 1997, and covers an area of 420 square metres. The décor of its three dining areas will provide us with the sensation of being in a rural village street. Part of what they offer includes a daily menu, a special weekend menu, nibbles, fish, charcoal-grilled meats, alubiadas (haricot bean dishes) and made-to-order paellas (a minimum 4 day notice is required), roast lamb and home-made desserts.

Xerbera restaurant serves cuisine d¿auteur based on fresh, high-quality ingredients, which combine tradition with modern recipes. Some of its most distinguishable creations are the duck sirloin stuffed with fungi in a raspberry sauce, warm eel salad, vegetable tempura with a spicy sauce and homemade desserts. Extensive wine list.

Balintxarreketa restaurant opened its doors in 1999, and is surrounded by the beauty of nature. In its dining areas, which have been designed in a rustic style, we can enjoy dishes based on traditional cuisine, which are prepared and presented to the highest standards.

 

Some of its specialities are home-made foie gras with peach jelly and raisins, and lobster in a txakoli sauce.

The Arenalde Maitea restaurant is located in a traditional farmhouse. Its décor is rustic without losing its elegance.

Displayed throughout the restaurant is a wide collection of restored farm utensils and objects. It has three floors with a dining area on each floor. Its specialities are fish and grilled meats.

Kafe Antzokia in Bermeo serves lunches every day of the week. It fuses traditional and modern cuisine and serves daily, special and weekend menus. Some of its specialities are cod, fresh fish, and barbequed meats.

The Cannon Etxea restaurant is located in Sollube, and from there, you will be able to enjoy spectacular views of Bermeo and the Cantabrian Sea. It has a rustic and maritime décor, and among their specialities are fish, meats, shellfish bred on their own fish-farm, grilled dishes and octopus, among others.

datosContacto.direccion: Barrio Mañu. Alto de Sollube, s/n

datosGenerales.descripcion: This family-owned farmhouse, which has been completely refurbished, is located in a beautiful natural setting. Guests can indulge in traditional Basque cuisine with an avant-garde touch. The farmhouse opened its doors more than four decades ago. It boasts two dining areas, its own car park and a spacious garden. Arroka Berri specialises in grilled fish and shellfish as well as barbequed foods (during the hunting season). The wide-ranging menu is rounded off with an extensive selection of wines and cigars, as well as desserts which fuse traditional flavours with highly innovative ones.

The casino is one of the most distinguishable buildings in Bermeo. The restaurant is located on the third floor and from this vantage point we can enjoy spectacular views of the port. It serves a daily and a special menu, and caters for wedding receptions and other types of events. The house specialities are shellfish and fish.

Hilarion Restaurant in Arrasate/Mondragón boasts a simple yet elegant decor, where we can enjoy both the daily menu as well as à la carte dishes. The restaurant offers dishes based on traditional Basque cuisine but with a modern twist and house specials include fresh fish and warm salads.

Pablo Urzay is a cosy restaurant with two floors, located in Getxo, 200 metres from the Vizcaya Bridge. The restaurant offers traditional Basque cuisine, with a modern twist, and serves superb homemade confectionery. Additionally, diners will always enjoy the pleasure of being able to choose from new items on the menu.

The restaurant-brasserie Bengoetxe was renovated in 2006 and has been owned by the Gezuraga-Obieta family for more than 30 years. Its two dining areas have been designed in a rustic style, and here we can enjoy dishes based on traditional Basque cuisine with a modern touch. Some of its specialities are grilled fish and meat.

Basalbo Baserria is located in the rural area of Getxo and is a cosy, two-storey farmhouse, surrounded by vegetation. Chef Gaizka Escudero¿s specialties are the grilled fish and shellfish. As well as the à la carte menu, they offer a daily menu, as well as menus for baptisms, communions and weddings. They also have an open-air terrace.

Ardora is a restaurant located beside the beach in Hondarribia, with views of the Txingudi Bay and Larrun. It also boasts an area outside with tables and chairs and a large coffee house. It offers an extensive seasonal menu, specialising in fish and shellfish. In addition, Ardora has its own car park beside the restaurant.

Iturri, located in the heart of Azkoitia, is a restaurant which specialises in traditional Basque cuisine. Its dishes are prepared using seasonal products and are defined by their natural flavours. The restaurant is fully equipped to host all types of events, including family celebrations and business conferences.

Batzokia is part of the Batzokia S.L chain and is located in Beasain. It is currently run by Iñigo Sanchez and Itxaso Saratxaga. The restaurant preserves traditional Basque cuisine, and pays homage to the history of The Basque Country, allowing the guests to enjoy discovering the origins of this region. In addition, at the bar we will be greeted with a wide array of pintxos and wines.

We can dine on traditional Basque cuisine at the Patxine restaurant in Asteasu. They offer a daily menu, as well as a festive menu, a set menu and à la carte dishes. Some of the house specialties include the grilled steak, tripe or the homemade desserts, to name but a few, and there is also a wide variety of wine to choose from.

Oquendo restaurant is located in the centre of San Sebastian. The decor at the entrance and in the bar area adopts a movie theme, and the dining room features bohemian decor. Great care is taken in the restaurant when selecting the produce and ingredients used, and guests can dine on traditional Basque dishes with a modern twist as well as international dishes.

Located in the exclusive hotel of the same name, the Marqués de Riscal restaurant offers diners the opportunity to enjoy typical dishes from the region, always adding a touch of creativity and the avant-garde, prepared under the guidance of chef Francis Paniego.

It will come as no surprise that there is an extensive wine list, including wines from the Marqués de Riscal winery to complement the menu, and particular attention is paid to rotate the seasonal dishes. In addition to the menu, there are several tasting menus and Christmas menus to choose from.

Restaurant 1860 Tradición is located in the prestigious Hotel Marqués de Riscal.

The restaurant has access to the hotel's main terraces and offers traditional regional dishes made with fresh seasonal produce.

House specialities include the croquettes, chickpea stew with monkfish and clams, meatballs with pommes de terre á la Boulangère, vegetable stew or hake steaks in batter with red peppers, as well as offering an extensive wine list. Refined food and culinary delights are overseen by chef Francis Paniego.

galeria.titulo: Outside view of the Hotel Marqués de Riscal

datosGenerales.descripcion: Nerua adjoins the ArcelorMittal Gallery in the Guggenheim Bilbao, and the main entrance is located on the promenade facing the ria. Chef Josean Alija has developed a purist style combining aromas, textures and flavours as main components, while at the same time offering an avant-garde style. The main ingredient is vegetables, which feature in all dishes.

Txiki Polit is a restaurant located right in the very heart of Zarautz, and offers the finest quality and the very best service. The set meals and filled rolls are made using freshly baked bread. Guests also have the chance to enjoy themselves in the bar, which offers a wide variety of tapas and an extensive wine list.

The Asador Portu (typical restaurant-brasserie with traditional wood-fired ovens) is located in Aia, in the heart of the countryside, and is the perfect setting for celebrations of any kind. Outstanding house specialties include the grilled lamb, suckling kid goat, suckling pig and the finest quality fish. The restaurant features spacious facilities, including a dining room and an outdoor terrace.

This is a restaurant located in the Rioja Alavesa which serves traditional Basque cuisine.

 

All dishes are prepared with meticulous attention to detail, and one of its specialities that has to be highlighted is the scallop with mushrooms and prawns.

 

The restaurant sits in a traditional house, designed with stone and wood, which imbues it with a truly cosy atmosphere.

Artza restaurant and bar, located next to the harbour in Bermeo, is a family-run business. House specials include the small individual portions, octopus and pintxos, but we must also mention the house menus and special desserts. All the food served is completely home-cooked and cod features on the menu at the weekends.

The Lagunak brasserie is located in the centre of Zarautz and house specials include chargrilled meat and fish. The restaurant also offers seasonal dishes and homemade desserts. There is a playground right next door and in summer diners can enjoy a covered terrace.

This century-old, traditional restaurant still serves traditional Basque cuisine and has added striking garnishes and accompaniments to the dishes. Some of the dishes we can enjoy in the two cosy, bright dining rooms include the smoked salmon rolls with cream cheese, sirloin of beef with home-made whole grain mustard sauce or the two-chocolate tart with passion fruit syrup.

galeria.titulo: Dining room in Goiko Benta restaurant
Dining room in Goiko Benta restaurant

datosGenerales.descripcion: Santa Barbara Restaurant is the perfect venue for banquets, weddings, christenings and many different types of functions. It serves breakfast, lunches and dinners and two types of menus: daily menu and special menu. Menus can also be tailored to meet customers dining requirements.

Kirkilla restaurant serves menus of the day and taster menus. A peculiar characteristic of the restaurant is that the kitchen area is in full view of the guests, which endows it with a unique family atmosphere. The restaurant¿s speciality is its customer service; it ensures that an evening spent at this restaurant is an extremely pleasant experience.

Daily menus are offered Monday to Friday for €11.

In addition to the great variety of traditional dishes, they also offer macrobiotic, vegan and gluten-free dishes to help you take care of your health every day with their daily menu.

On weekends they offer special suggestions.

A restaurant located in the heart of Donostia's Old Town. As well as an assortment of pintxos, it offers an extensive à la carte menu based around meats, Iberian foods and fish, as well as a wide variety of Spanish and international wines. The restaurant boasts a dining area which is both comfortable and cosy. Speciality: Iberian hams, meats, seafood and an extensive wine menu. A wide variety of both hot and cold pintxos. Open every day. Kitchen stays open from 11am until 12pm.

La Huerta Vieja restaurant is located between vineyards and countryside, and there are large windows which enable diners to enjoy the view of the mountains. In addition, guests can choose to sit at the outdoor tables in the café area and can enjoy the spacious garden. The cuisine offered preserves traditional aspects of Basque-Rioja cuisine, while giving them a modern twist. Some of their specialities include roasted suckling lamb, charcoal-grilled baby lamb chops and stuffed turbot.

galeria.titulo: Dining room in La Huerta Vieja restaurant

datosGenerales.descripcion: The Kandela restaurant is located in the centre of Zarautz, a few metres from the beach, and boasts a comprehensive menu combining traditional Basque cuisine with pastas and salads. It is distinguishable by its impeccable décor, its cosy atmosphere and its range of desserts.

As well as offering a richly varied menu, Guardi restaurant in Idiazabal serves a daily menu (there are ten first courses and ten second courses from which to choose), mixed platters, sandwiches and portions. It boasts spacious outside dining areas and its décor is modern and minimalist.

galeria.titulo: The restaurant's exterior and dining area

datosGenerales.descripcion: This restaurant-country house is located on a natural setting. The restaurant serves up cuisine which fuses tradition with modern recipes. The menu features elaborately prepared starters, seasonal indigenous products, exquisite fish dishes and grilled meats.

Martín Cendoya restaurant serves cuisine based on seasonal products and on pairing dishes with Eguren Ugarte's finest wines. Its speciality is lamb cutlets grilled over vine shoots. Other dishes which merit a special mention are the Rioja-style cod, beef cheeks, and piquillo peppers stuffed with mushrooms. The restaurant also serves up modern dishes.

The Lazkao Etxe restaurant is located in the heart of the Aralar natural park, and the dining area has a rustic décor, made from stone and wood. Here you will have the chance to enjoy traditional Basque cuisine. The pigs¿ trotters stuffed with mushrooms are particularly delicious.

galeria.titulo: Dining room in Lazkao etxe restaurant

datosGenerales.descripcion: Txoko Mendibile opened its doors on 21st June 2013, working on the same principles as its sister establishment, 'Txoko Piperrak'. It adapts traditional restaurant cuisine to the values, sensations, moments and experiences of the Txokos, the famous Basque gastronomic societies. Like the Txokos themselves, they stick to quality produce and honest service, the basic pillars of these unique establishments. It is located in a modern glass building adjoining the country house of the same name, which dates back to the 17th century and is now the headquarters of the Bizkaiko Txakolina wine denomination). Highlights among its facilities include the Business Center, spacious terraces, private dining rooms a shop specialising in Txakoli from Bizkaia.
