The menu is based on fresh, local and seasonal produce, and special mention must be made of the cod in pil-pil sauce, small squids in their ink, chops and goxua dessert.

The casino is one of the most distinguishable buildings in Bermeo. The restaurant is located on the third floor and from this vantage point you can enjoy spectacular views of the port. It serves a daily menu and a special menu, and caters for wedding receptions and other types of events. The house specialities are seafood and fish.

datosRestauracion.capacidad: Two dining rooms for 150 and 80 people

datosGenerales.descripcion: Artomaña Txakolina is the main grape producer in the Arabako Txakolina-Txakoli de Álava designation of origin, and it produces its own txakoli using innovative methods. It is a project which has been run within the family for three generations and its txakoli is sold under the brand name Eukeni in homage to the work carried out by its precursor.

Located beside the Guggenheim Museum Bilbao, under the Isozaki Towers, Larruz Bilbao restaurant offers a creative Mediterranean à la carte menu, and its specialties are rice-based dishes and paellas. The restaurant also hosts expositions, lectures and conferences.

galeria.titulo: Dining room in Larruzz Bilbao restaurant

datosGenerales.descripcion:
In the Señorío de Astobiza vineyard, grapes are gathered manually in small boxes and the best bunches are then carefully selected.

The txakolis are made employing state-of-the-art manufacturing and production processes, and are sold under the brand names Señorío de Astobiza and Malkoa.

More than simply a restaurant, Tartufo is a multi-purpose room in which cultural events are held. It boasts an outside dining area, an interior lounge with live music and an inside dining area in which guests can choose from an à la carte menu, daily or special menus, and its sandwiches and portions.

Txakoli Simon restaurant, located in a beautiful natural setting, boasts two dining areas, a terrace, and an outside area with the capacity to hold up to 500 people, which makes it ideal for holding events of all types. Their specialties are barbecued chop with salad and oven-baked cod with onion confit. They serve portions, homemade desserts and special menus.

Beraia restaurant uses high quality ingredients such as seafood, fish and meat and have a wide variety of pintxos that are constantly updated.

Their specialities include millefeuilleof grilled mini seasonable vegetables with goose foiegras.

They offer an assortment of cheeses with designation of origin.
Algorri restaurant's speciality is traditional Basque cuisine dishes, always prepared using high-quality ingredients. In addition, it has a grillroom for meats and fish.

Located in centre of Vitoria, Dolomiti restaurant has two elegantly-decorated dining rooms. Traditional handmade pasta and pizza bases, they also offer all kinds of roasts (in a wood stove), grilled meats and hake from the Cantabrian sea.

Katxi restaurant has three air-conditioned dining areas, which are suitable for holding all types of celebrations. They offer an extensive à la carte menu, a wide variety of dishes outside of this menu and an extensive selection of desserts.

A spacious and bright state-of-the-art building houses the Amalurra restaurant, which also operates as a rural hotel.

As well as homemade cuisine, guests can enjoy vegetarian menus and typical Basque dishes. There are spacious gardens outside, which make the restaurant an ideal place to celebrate all types of events.

Mugarri restaurant is graced by an extensive portico-style porch. It boasts two dining areas with a simple yet elegant décor. Guests can enjoy the restaurant's specialty dishes, which include grilled shellfish and barbequed fish and meats.

Urki Txakolina has the latest and most advanced technologies, it is open to all who want to visit and try txakoli accompanied by typical Basque cuisine products.

 

It also has three spacious, elegant and cosy rooms with magnificent views over the vineyards.

The fifth floor of Bilbao's Campos Eliseos Theatre houses the 5ª Planta restaurant, which serves up creative cuisine, based on avant-garde and modern trends.

It serves organic and vegetarian menus, as well as celiac menus.

Some of its most delicious dishes include creamy rice with baby squid and mushrooms; clams stuffed with panko-coated spider crab; and cod (available in a pil-pil sauce, a la vizcaína, in a black sauce...).

datosContacto.direccion: Restaurante del Teatro Campos Elíseos. Bertendona 3 , 5º Planta

datosGenerales.descripcion: Hambroneta is a mobile "food truck" which makes its way to wherever the customer requests. Its three main products are the "bokapapa" roll, the "saladosa" salad and the "hambrocookies", which can be personalised based on customers' preferences.

datosContacto.direccion: Ramon De Kareaga 6, 1° 76 (San Miguel de Basauri)

datosGenerales.descripcion: The winery is made up of small-scale wine producers from the Txorierri and surrounding areas: Erakatxoko, Aitabitxi, Aurregoiti, Luisarre, Sasikoetxe, Etxeandia, Ayarza, Arkotxes and Atela. It has an area of 1,300 square metres, spread over two floors, and has the capacity to produce 300,000 litres. It is represented by the Bitxia brand and boasts six types of txakoli: white, selection, red, rosé, lees and barrel-fermented. In addition, they also produce coffee liqueur, herb liqueur, orujo (a type of pomace Brandy very popular in Northern Spain) and cream liqueur.

This small, family-run winery was founded in 1992, it has the modern resources and technology to produce txakoli wine. The guided tours explain the entire process, from receiving the grape to dispatching the bottled product. The tour ends with a txakoli. They also offer wine tasting courses.

Dena-Ona restaurant, located in the heart of the Bilbao neighbourhood of Deusto, opened its doors in 1963. It offers traditional Basque cooking, and two dining rooms: one for the menu and the other for private events, ideal for reunions with family, friends and colleagues. Also, the cafeteria serves main courses, menu of the day and pintxos. The star dishes include battered mussels (also known as ¿tigers¿), squid and stuffed hake.

Restaurant located in the emblematic Bilbao street, Licenciado Poza. The main specialities are seafood and fish (particularly sea bass and turbot). They offer a menu based on products of the sea, menu of the day, tasting menu - named "Berezi" ¿ for lovers of traditional cooking with innovative touches and the special menu ¿Lekeitio¿, consisting of dishes elaborated using products from our coast.

Hiruzta is something more than a txakoli cellar, is a family project internationally renowned, a crop, a dream from three wine enthusiasts: a father and his 3 children who have made their own Txakoli with restaurant in a wonderful environment such as Hondarribia.

The restaurant is surrounded by 27 vineyard acres and offers a special place to enjoy Basque traditional cuisine for gastronomy lovers, with grill and seasonal products as subject, and emphasizing txakoli produced with local grapes, HONDARRABI ZURI, an unmistakeable and bodied wine with higher bouquet.

This cellar has a sampling area where it´s possible to enjoy the wonderful view of the vineyard and Aiako harria Natural Park, apart from tasting delicious tapas/pintxos and plates.

Fine food is taken very seriously at Viura, an exquisite setting for intimate dinners as well as weddings and events. 

The restaurant offers à la carte tasting menus, based on the traditional cuisine of La Rioja and the Basque Country, interspersed with creative touches and made from fresh, natural ingredients. The wine lists are superb and have been created by a prestigious sommelier who is on hand to advise diners.

datosRestauracion.capacidad: 60 à la carte diners or 140 as a group

datosGenerales.descripcion: The Llamosas family have been running the Casa Garras restaurant for forty years. Guests can opt for classic dishes - such as grilled fish, lamb, T-bone steak and red beans with their "sacraments" (chorizo, black pudding, pork fat, pork belly/ribs) - or for more creative cuisine. Their dishes are prepared with seasonal products. They also offer homemade desserts, an extensive wine list - which features the main designations of origin - as well as dishes to share, pintxos (delicious Basque-style tapas) and sandwiches.

El Rincón de Luis Mari is a family-run bar and restaurant located in the centre of Vitoria-Gasteiz. It stands out for its extensive array of pintxos, served both hot and cold. Its Jabugo ham baguettes (known as ¿Serranitos¿) also deserve a special mention, as does the pintxo known as ¿Antxopi¿, which consists of piquillo peppers, anchovies in oil and a slice of bread. It also has a room with tables where platters are served.

The fabulous view to the Bay of Pasaia that this restaurant offers makes the tasting of delicious traditional Basque dishes even a greater experience. Moreover, Ziaboga organises workshops where the visitor will learn how to choose the best products of the market and how to cook them, having at the end the opportunity to taste what they have prepared.

La Brasserie Mari Galant is the restaurant at the famous Hotel de Londres y de Inglaterra. Diners can enjoy stunning vistas over San Sebastián's La Concha bay while savouring the brasserie specialities: seasonal vegetables, assorted meat dishes and grilled fish.

The Jardines de Uletai restaurant in the Jardines de Uleta Hotel specialises in traditional cuisine with a special focus on local products. Its grilled fish and meat are the star dishes on the menu.

 

The wine list includes over 120 references from different wine-growing regions of Spain as well as a wide range of international wines. The restaurant has two private rooms and boasts several prestigious culinary awards for its pintxos (local snacks). It offers a vegetarian menu as well as a range of gluten-free dishes.

Country manor on the outskirts of Atxondo situated in its own spacious gardens.

Today its stone walls, wood beams and open fireplace are the characteristic features of a restaurant which hosts weddings and numerous other events.

The menu, which is based on seasonal products, bears the hallmark creativity of chef Iñigo Fuertes Maguregui and his team.

This grill house, which 20 years ago was a traditional farmhouse of Lezo, is nestled in the foothills of Mount Jaizkibel, completely surrounded by lush nature. The guest to this restaurant will taste a wide variety of grilled fish and meats cooked in an idyllic environment.

This family-run restaurant opened in 1904 and serves traditional cuisine based on local products.

Situated deep in the countryside, it features a rustic dining room with stone walls, exposed wood beams and wood flooring, and two private rooms. The menu consists of typical Basque dishes made of fresh, seasonal ingredients.

The specialities are vegetable casserole, beans stewed in their “sacraments” (blood sausage, pork belly and chorizo), and grilled cod.
Family-run grill with magnificent views over the Getaria bay. Its specialities are the excellent fresh fish and seafood—including the exquisite grilled turbot—and the homemade desserts.

Botarri is located at the Sercotel Oria Hotel. The menu features a wide range of meat dishes, grilled fish, seafood and homemade desserts. 

Decorated in a rustic style, it boasts a dining room with kupelas (barrels) where txotx (the local cider) can be made all year round. 

Specialities: Shellfish farming and grill Seasonal beans and by order.

This restaurant located in the Historic Centre, in the heart of the most medieval Errenteria, cooks delicious Basque traditional dishes and homemade food. Its main specialities are grilled vegetables and meats, dishes which make all those guests who taste them either in the dining room or in the terrace go weak at the knees.

Enbata is a bar and restaurant in the La Marina neighbourhood. Its specialities are the local pintxos and casseroles that have put Hondarribia on the culinary map. In addition to a varied à la carte menu, it offers a fixed menu based on fresh seasonal products, so diners can choose a meal to suit their budget. There are two dining rooms.

Chef Iñigo Lavado opened his restaurant in 2005 and still runs it today. Located at the FICOBA trade fair ground, it is renowned for its avant-garde design and generous terrace overlooking the breathtaking scenery of the Aiako Harria nature park. In addition to the main dining room, there is also a private room and a separate area for after-dinner drinks. The signature notes are quality products and creativity.

Located in the hotel of the same name, on the edge of the Gorbeia nature park, La Casa del Patrón was renovated in 2009 and offers a modern setting. 

Diners can choose from a fixed menu, à la carte dishes and cazuelitas (local casseroles), but the house specialities are the elaborate pintxos concocted by award-winning chef Rubén González. 

The restaurant boasts a large conservatory with an open fire and is the perfect place to replenish your strength and savour one of the coffees lovingly prepared by Patxi González, the chef's brother and an award-winning barista.

Lola is a restaurant where traditional cuisine is given an innovative twist. Its dishes are original and daring, while the menu gives centre stage to seasonal produce. 

Its large, airy rooms make Lola the ideal place to celebrate weddings and events of all kinds. 

The restaurant also boasts a substantial wine list, with over 400 bottles to choose from.

Serantes III, located in the heart of Abandoibarra (in front of the Guggenheim Museum) is a seafood restaurant that combines modernity with a classic touch. Its main speciality is seafood, although diners can also enjoy Iberian charcuterie, pintxos (Basque tapas) and an extensive range of wines from a variety of PDO regions.

Chef Juan Mari D'Onofrio and his team are at the helm of Sugarri at the Hotel Río Bidasoa. The restaurant offers a fusion of traditional and creative cuisine, with dishes that are flavourful, fun and delicious.

Xarma Cook & Culture is famous for its fresh, dynamic, natural and seasonal cuisine. Its dishes have an innovative, avant-garde twist with an evident emphasis on the selection of ingredients and the presentation. In addition to a broad à la carte menu, there are also tasting and fixed menus.

Eneko, located on the site of the old Azurmendi, is where the renowned Eneko Atxa (holder of five Michelin stars) has created a unique space in which barriers are pulled down, diners interact with one another and the concept of haute cuisine takes on a casual yet dynamic form. Prêt à porter offers fun, healthy food, with a menu that changes daily.

datosContacto.direccion: Corredor del Txorierri salida nº 25 (Legina auzoa)

datosGenerales.descripcion: Restaurant located in the Dolarea Hotel in Beasain offering tradition-based signature cuisine.
Grill located in the Aztiria district in Gabiria offering traditional cuisine and characteristic grilled offerings.

Txakoli Amunategi belongs to the Bizkaiko Txakolina denomination of origin and is produced at the Amunategui family estate. There are various references dating the origins of Amunategui wine to the year 1812, and the winery is housed in a building dating from 1849, although it has recently been restored and completely modernised. Its current capacity is 27,500 litres, distributed in four 5,000-litre tanks and three 2,500-litre tanks.

The Elkano winery, which belongs to the Getariako Txakolina denomination of origin, still uses traditional, age-old methods to make txakoli but has incorporated new techniques.

 

Meticulous attention is paid to every single step of the process, from growing the grapes to packing the bottles in crates. The family started producing txakoli as early as 1830, and José Luis Zimmermann revived the tradition, in the 1980s.

The Hotel La Hospedería de los Parajes, has created two areas, two different restaurants connected by a shared concept: quality. Las Duelas Restaurant offers traditional cuisine while you are viewing a fifteenth century cellar below your feet. 

The Parajes Restaurant offers a more modern type of cuisine based on tradition. It is the ideal scenario where you may indulge you senses. Our long family tradition in catering is the basis of our surprising menus that combine modernity and tradition, that renew dishes with roots in this land and that are based on the exceptional quality of the products used. 

A place where perfectly marinated dishes can be explored accompanied by an extraordinary wine list.

Facing the gates in the walls of Laguardia / Biasteri and offering outstanding views of the vineyards, this restaurant is a large and pleasant establishment where one can enjoy cuisine based on local products but with a personal touch. 

This restaurant also offers a tasting menu and adapts its offer to specific requirements (diets for people suffering from celiac disease, diabetes, hypertension or those with allergies). 

The owners, Patxi and Alex, oversee a very pleasant establishment that offers high quality food.

In the centre of the medieval town of Laguardia / Biasteri can be found this appealing restaurant, which has a bar, two dining rooms and a separate kitchen. On the ground floor is a very well-cared for old wine cellar that has been fitted out to provide lunches and dinners to order. It offers a wide variety of special set menus. 

The elegant yet rustic decor makes the establishment a very cosy place in which to taste typical dishes from the region such as grilled lamb chops, peppers and Rioja-style potatoes. 

A Wi-fi service is available for its customers.

The Ángel Santamaria Restaurant is located inside the Pagos de Leza winery, where we make our best wines.

The restaurant has modern and pleasant facilities, with numerous works of art, where we offer Basque-Rioja cuisine that combines tradition and innovation, always based on local seasonal products and traditional recipes from Grandma Lucia. At our open grill, fired with the branches from our vineyards, we prepare grilled meat to provide our guests with the genuine flavours of the products of our land.

A comfortable and attractive establishment surrounded by vineyards, with superb views of the Cantabria Mountains, where you can enjoy good food and the best wines from our cellar.

You may get your strength back at this restaurant after a day of hiking or walking with the family by trying our traditional Basque and La Rioja cuisine. Our specialty, in addition to the well-known potatoes with chorizo in La Rioja style and our chops sarmiento style, are the beans, hake, steak, grilled black pudding ...
We have two dining rooms at the service of our customers: A typical large grill where you can watch while our grilled specialties are prepared in the sarmiento style. A renovated dining room with a modern touch.

Restaurant Petralanda is located in Labastida (Rioja Alavesa) and offers you a wide range of dishes by way of a fusion between traditional Basque and Riojan cuisine, accompanied by the finest wines from the Rioja Designation of Origin (D.O.). Its recently restored entrance arch leads the way to a place where you will enjoy the pleasure of eating alone, with your partner, hold an event or enjoy a group visit to Rioja Alavesa. Services: terrace, bar, air-conditioned room.

Located in the heart of Laguardia, Hostal-Restaurant Biazteri is one of the most traditional establishments in town. 

Enjoy our delicious traditional cuisine with menus and wine tasting sessions for both intimate and group meals in three different dining rooms: One is inspired by the typical style of Laguardia, with adze carved oak beams and decorated with wine motifs. Another features stone walls where farming tools, the tireless companions of the work of our ancestors, now hang on exhibition. Finally, there is the old wine cellar, which has been converted into a dining room beneath the town. 

Our ""underground cellar"" is ideal for intimate meals as well as for groups and parties.

This pleasant restaurant in the medieval town of Laguardia / Biasteri can be reached via three different streets: Calle Mayor, Calle Esquide and the Travesía de Santa Engracia. 

Inside the restaurant there are number of very warm, tastefully decorated rooms. 

Clients can enjoy a range of different traditional dishes, typical of the region, accompanied by any one of the many wines included in its wine list.
Restaurant located in the Ordizia football field offering Mediterranean-influenced cuisine.

Restaurant located in the Castillo de Olaberria Hotel next to the N1, offering classic cuisine with personal touches.

Dining room for 175 diners offering facilities for all types of celebrations.
Restaurant located on Mandubia Hill in Beasain offering traditional homestyle Basque cuisine. It specialises in hearty soups, meat, roast lamb and bean stews.
Restaurant located on Liernia Hill in Mutiloa offering traditional Basque cuisine with modern touches.
Restaurant located in the main square in Zegama offering traditional Basque cuisine.
Restaurant located in Lazkao offering traditional Basque cuisine with modern touches.
Restaurant located in the main square in Mutiloa offering young, innovative cuisine.
Restaurant located the Basque handball court in Zerain offering traditional Basque cuisine.
Restaurant located in the Salbatoreh Hotel Beasain offering traditional Basque cuisine.
Restaurant located in Idiazábal offering traditional Basque cuisine. One-plate meals, sandwiches, plates for sharing, pintxos (small plates), etc.
Restaurant located in the hotel Lazkao, in Lazkao, offering a traditional Basque cuisine with signature touches.One-plate meals, sandwiches, plates for sharing, etc.

The snack bar of Alabortza is located in a privileged environment next to the estuary of Pasaia. Therefore, it offers spectacular views to those guests who enjoy in the terrace of the snack bar a delicious grill, the speciality of the bar.
Specialities: Home cooking, high-quality local produce. Beans by order and in season.

In this restaurant located in the neighbourhood Altzibar in Oiartzun the guest can taste typical homemade food and traditional dishes of the Basque gastronomy.

It has a wide dinning room for 55 people.

This cider house of Oiartzun emanates the smell of tradition from all of its corners. The typical cider house menu which the restaurant offers can be accompanied by the delicious cider that is elaborated and kept in the restaurant itself.

Olaizola is a restaurant located in Ergoien, a neighbourhood of Oiartzun, at the foot of Aiako Harria and close to the Green Way which leads us to the mines of Arditurri. It offers homemade food in a natural environment.
Zuketz offers a wide variety of pintxos in one of the finest ambiences in Errenteria, as well as an elaborate à la carte menu in a modern, cosy setting.
Speciality: Free range chicken and roast lamb. Beans: seasonal and by order.
Restaurant located in the harbour in Getaria.
Grill - restaurant in Zumaia. Specialty: traditional cuisine and grill
Restaurant located in the center of Zarautz. Specially: traditional cuisine, homemade cuisine and tapas
Restaurant located in the beach of Orio. Specially : nouvelle cuisine and basque cuisine
Restaurant in Aia. Specially :traditional cuisine and grill
Restaurant located in the center of Getaria. Specially : traditional cuisine
Restaurant located in the center of Getaria. Specially : traditional cuisine and homemade cuisine
Far from the madding routes and agitation, you can enjoy the soothing calm of this restaurant..

datosGenerales.descripcion: Located in Lastur, (interesting S.XV grinders). It is appreciated by groups of friends for celebrations often completed with bullfighting in the ancient Lastur bullring. Specialty of "bull ratatouille", beans,

This family winery with a long winemaking tradition combines tradition and technology, using cutting-edge methods and new winemaking techniques while respecting the craft tradition. Its vineyards work with integrated production methods, respecting the environment, the vine and its surroundings.
Creative cookery using seasonal produce.
Homemade daily menu and ¿pintxo¿ (appetizers).

A typical Basque farmhouse surrounded by green spaces with a children’s play area and in a privileged setting sheltered by the mountains of the Sierra Selvada and close to the Maroño reservoir. 

It serves traditional cooking
The Hamalau restaurant combines the finest cuisine with around 300 different wines.

At Restaurante Harria you can try the renowned Basque traditional cuisine based on quality ingredients and meticulous presentation. It offers different set meals: daily, for work, celebrations, etc., as well as a range of cocktails, brunch, etc.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Located very close to the Plentzia bridge, this grill is specialized in grilled fish and seafood. The gastronomic offer on its menu focuses on inshore fish such as sea bream, turbot, monkfish, hake or grouper, among others.

 

It is located in an 18th century building and has a terrace with views of the estuary where you can taste all kinds of fresh grilled products such as portions, a steak or even a have a drink.

 

The coastal town of Plentzia is very welcoming. It is about 25 kilometers from Bilbao, in a beautiful bay that overlooks the sea and that it shares with Gorliz.
For three generations our family has offered the best of our local produce, prepared with care to keep all the flavour of our grandparents’ traditional recipes while adding original touches.

galeria.titulo: View of the Ibai Gane farmstead

datosGenerales.descripcion: An authentic Cider-Restaurant in Gipuzkoa, needless to move from Donostia. We offer the classic cider house menu and a wide range of dishes. Located just 3 minutes from the Kursaal building and the Zurriola beach. Cider and wine straight away from the bar

The Iñausti restaurant, located in the Zuatzu business park, is a good choice in Donostia - San Sebastián for daily set meals, working lunches and meals for groups. It has 2 large spaces used as dining rooms, one on the ground floor for 125 diners and another on the first floor for some 100 diners. These spaces can be subdivided to create more intimate settings or places for smaller celebrations, or used as a whole to create pleasant but more spacious settings for celebrations that require this. It also has a bar which is the place chosen every morning by hundreds of people who work and do business. It has a wide range of “pintxos” and sandwiches for anybody wishing to have a snack or take a packed lunch back to the office, carefully wrapped up and always prepared to their taste. Up to closing time it is the ideal place to arrange to meet or simply to take a break.

A new concept of cider-house. 3 floors and capacity for 470 pax. Private dining halls, tables in kupelas, stage and the most innovative decoration with excellent service. Tradition and modernism combined. Menu, cider menu, arranged menus, lunches and even
Committed to the classic, to the cookery we have always known.
Traditional homemade seasonal products: scrambled mushrooms, beans, meat and fish. Desserts: pears in wine, rice pudding, yogurt mousse, or chocolate, biscuits, ...Wine. "Txakoli". Cider.

For 50 years it has enjoyed a well-deserved culinary reputation based on its own dishes and on the produce of local farms. Dishes are prepared using fresh ingredients from the locality or from within a 20-kilometre radius.

In the unsurpassed setting of the new promenade by the beach at Bakio, it offers a unique experience in a cosy atmosphere beside the sea. Its specialities are stone-cooked meat and griddled local fish.
Those who decide to stop off at this restaurant will be able to enjoy delicious traditional stews cooked with the finest raw materials from the area and accompanied with a wide variety of wines.
In the games arcade of the casino your identity card o passport must always be shown. Traditional cuisine from an a la carte menu or set menu. Service available until midnight.
Traditional Basque cooking. The best Jabugo ham and pork loin.
Restaurant with daily menu, menu and set menu. Innovative cuisine and homemade.

You can enjoy the enviroment , while you are tasting your delightful varied menus.Traditional home made food, grilled and charcoal grilled at the moment. Wine cellar with a lot of Riojas excelent wines.

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Traditional Basque kitchen with modern touches. Salads, meats, fish, seafood and hunting. Organic garden products and meat from cattle family farmhouse. 

Fresh fish of the Cantabrian sea and homemade pastries, the secrets of quality.

Avant-garde and tradition. Cuisine where professional skill joins the finest of larders stocked with the tastiest meats, exquisite fish and perfect vegetables, to make every dish a delight to the palate.

The variety of our menu, the freshness of our cooking and our meticulous service are three things you can’t fail to notice when you come to try our Basque-Mediterranean cuisine with wonderful signature touches.

datosGenerales.descripcion: It offers grilled meat and fish, shellfish from the Cantabrian sea and sea bass in pepper. Certainly there is a wide choice of food for all tastes and, thanks to great experience, satisfaction is guaranteed.

datosGenerales.descripcion: The restaurant features tapas, dishes, set meals, weekend menus or special orders. Specialty of the house, beans, cod pilpil and all kinds of homemade meals on request.
Specialized on menus, menú a la carte and ribeye stone.
Petit Komite is an intimate, discreet and elegant restaurant.
Traditional carvery located in a "Historical Heritage" hamlet. Fish, meats, grilled, seafood and seasonal dishes.
Specialising in natural farmhouse food (eggs, chicken, rabbit and lamb) and garden produce. Set meals and à la carte.
Txakoli is a fruity young white wine with a moderate alcohol content (9.5º - 11.5º) and a characteristic slight acidity. It is a highly characteristic, distinctive wine.

Homemade cooking in an environment surrounded by fields and overlooking the coast. Specialities: Guisado de toro, the warm salad of shrimp and (greed) and apple pie. In the small square funny capeas are offered for group of friends

datosGenerales.descripcion: Exceptional views of the sea. Basque Gastronomy based on home beef meat and grilled fresh fish from the port of Mutriku and home lamb to "Burduntzi style." Daily menus, special menus and menu.

galeria.titulo: Detail of the San Juan dining room

datosGenerales.descripcion: Seasonal cuisine, quality products, creativity and innovation. Meat, fish, vegetables from his own garden, amazing desserts.
Specialising in traditional cooking with a twist taken from the recipes of modern cuisine.

With beautiful panoramic, near the Sanctuary of Arrate, this restaurant is linked to the sport of shooting and pigeon shooting. It welcomes championships and activities of these modalities. The restaurant offers traditional Basque cuisine.
A restaurant which serves oriental cuisine.
Restaurant located in Ordizia offering traditional Basque cuisine.

datosGenerales.descripcion: Restaurant located in the port of Getaria. Specially : char-grilled cuisine
Traditional cuisine specialising in paella, rice and lobster, cod, fresh fish etc. A popular maritime environment.
Txoko Sagarna is a small restaurant, a shop, a meeting place where you can taste typical Basque dishes made from local products. In addition, you can also buy products made in the same farmhouse.

A modern farmhouse-style building built in 1964, set among green hillsides on the Gamiz road.

It has a dining room, bar and terrace where you can enjoy tasty dishes in pleasant surroundings.

Txulu Jatetxea serves healthy dishes with a home-cooked flavour.
Rotisserie restaurant with 2 large dining rooms, 2 terraces and a play space for children. All this in a country setting with the sea just a few minutes away. It has its own car park for customers.
Mediterranean cuisine. Specialized in rice.

A family winery located in the parish of Bakio, in the former BASIGO neighbourhood, now known as Elexalde. Bakio is a traditional txakoli-making area, and ancient vineyards surround the town and our winery, a business which is part of the history of Bakio but today has adapted to keep up with the times in which we live. The winery makes 4 txakolis using only grapes from Bakio, keeping up the tradition of the three txakolis (white, red and ojo gallo) but at the same time innovating. One of the new creations by this winery is its new txakoli aged for 6 months, which we have christened Gaztelugatxe.
Restaurant located in the Zelaa Hotel in Zaldibia offering traditional Basque cuisine.

This restaurant located in Murgia, at the foot of the Gorbea Natural Park is an ideal place to eat or drink something after making a path through the park. 

It offers traditional basque cuisine and specializes in pintxos.
Close to the Buen Pastor Square, the young chef Iñigo Peña cooks the best seasonal produce on the market. Modern decor. Weekday and à la carte menus.

galeria.titulo: Dining room at the Narru Restaurant

datosGenerales.descripcion: Lunch meetings and banquets for conferences.
Guests are offered the chance to taste a wide variety of "pintxos", snacks, daily and special set meals, all accompanied by friendly service in a spacious, well fitted-out establishment.

datosContacto.direccion: Polígono Granada , 1 (entre Trápaga y Ortuella N-634)

datosGenerales.descripcion: Specializing in quality traditional Basque cuisine. We offer our clients different homemade dishes, with a special touch that makes our kitchen is different. We offer the choicest meats and fish in the area.

Manu Akasuso runs this project, preparing traditional Basque cuisine together with his team of chefs, in the Arbuio business park in the municipality of Alonsótegi, 5 minutes from Bilbao, in a natural setting.

Just 5 minutes’ walk from the beach in Gorliz is this restaurant where everything revolves around amama (grandmother) Bego’s cookery. This is food prepared in a 100% traditional style. The restaurant also has its own car park.

Located on the slopes of Mount Morkaiko. This sixteenth century farmhouse, tastefully remodelled, has 6 dining rooms for any celebration. Terrace, porch and bedouin tent space. Classic cuisine with touches of the author and international cuisine

datosContacto.direccion: Alto de San Miguel 44, Carr. Markina

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Located on the banks of Urrunaga-Legutio reservoir, is a restaurant specialized in traditional basque cuisine. 

Daily menu and à la carte. 

It is a good place for any kind of celebrations for its large garden and private parking.
A traditional Basque restaurant where the specialities of the house are hake, clams and suckling lamb. Its cuisine is primarily based on traditional produce like beans, vegetables and so on.

This restaurant located in Etxabarri-Ibiña, just 10 minutes from Vitoria-Gasteiz, specializes in traditional Basque cuisine. Its nice and familiar make anyone feel at home. 

Daily menu and a la carte.

galeria.titulo: View of the inside of the restaurant

datosGenerales.descripcion: Taberna in a very special location, on the harbour in Bakio. On our terrace with its sea views, you can try the finest local produce prepared in ways that bring out all its flavour.

item.value: This winery, located in the traditional Basque farmhouse of Eguzkitza in Fika, is over 100 years old. The txakoli it makes, with origins going back to the middle ages, is crisp, with a slight sparkle and mild acidity. The personality of this txakoli comes from two native grape varieties, Gondarribi Zuri and Hondarribi Beltza.

datosGenerales.descripcion: Modern decor with a traditional touch. You can try our special set meals, which are freshly made and change daily and feature numerous dishes to choose from. Sophisticated à la carte menu and an extensive wine list.

Arita Berri Restaurant, in Ereño (Bizkaia), built in 1986 on the structure of a 19th century farmhouse, has become one of the main points of reference in Biscay and the Basque Country. 

The culinary proposal of this establishment bets on first quality meat and fish, with a wide menu that combines traditional Basque cuisine with certain touches of modernity. 

Located in the heart of nature, the Arita Berri restaurant has its own wine cellar, where carefully selected wines rest, a large car park and a recreation area for children.

This former mill in Zamudio was renovated and converted into a cosy restaurant. In it you can enjoy typical Basque cuisine with a cutting-edge twist, prepared using all the experience of a fantastic team.

Café Irun is an establishment which combines both day and night-time pursuits. As well as a bar and restaurant, it has a discotheque and rooms for private functions. 

It occasionally offers themed events featuring a range of shows, as well as Café Theatre.

A cosy restaurant with a minimalist design, where David Rodriguez presents his signature cuisine, based on local produce and traditional cooking with an avant-garde twist. 

Serves set meals and à la carte.
The restaurant is inside the hotel. It serves daily set meals from Monday to Sunday, as well as special set meals for groups. It has spacious dining rooms in which to hold private functions.
Located in the neighbourhood of La Marina, this bar restaurant combines pintxos and traditional portions with fresh, seasonal cookery in its restaurant.
This bar restaurant in Irun serves an à la carte selection that combines traditional cooking with signature dishes. There are also combi dishes.

A restaurant specialising in grilled meat and fish. In a natural setting just a stone’s throw from the centre of Irun, the restaurant has a “Trinkete” where customers can enjoy watching or playing a game of this form of Basque “pelota”.

The Kanala Hotel Restaurant is in a modern Basque-style house in Itziar, very near Deba.

It has a spacious dining room with sea views. It specialises in charcoal-grilled meat and fish. It also has an extensive menu including shellfish, entrées and more. It serves a set meal of the day.

The Unzaga Plaza restaurant is in the hotel of the same name in the centre of Eibar. It has spacious premises suitable for holding events, with room for 190 diners. It offers à la carte food, a wide range of set meals and even a pintxo menu.

The restaurant is located in what used to be the stable in a country guest house, in Ziortza-Bolibar. With room for 110 diners, its speciality is local meat, grilled fish and home-made desserts. It has an extensive menu and serves different set meals, including a set meal of the day.

Kiloterdi Txokoa Ellauri started out in 2012, as an independent service associated with the Hotel Ellauri. The business also includes the country holiday accommodation taking up a whole house, Ellauri Baserria. In an outstanding natural setting, with the option of visiting the beautiful Gorbeia nature park. Preference is given to using the produce of the vegetable garden and livestock of Ellauri Baserria. Possibility of visiting the vegetable garden and vineyard to discover a traditional way of growing things. Ideal for business events, celebrations and weddings in combination with the services of the hotel and the country holiday accommodation. Excellent ratings by customers on social networks thanks to the friendly personal service and quality of the cooking, especially the kilo and a half T-bone steak, the fish and the fresh produce from the vegetable garden. The establishment adheres to the principles of 'Km0' and 'Slow Food'.

Environmental sustainability is a key feature of this restaurant; both its architecture and its way of working are designed with this in mind. 

From the choice of building materials, efficient use of natural light and selective heating and cooling to growing its own produce and preparing local ingredients in a natural way, as well as composting and reuse of waste, every aspect of the establishment’s work takes sustainability into account. Its daily set meal combines traditional cuisine with dynamic contemporary formats. 

It serves lunches every day of the week and dinners from Thursday to Saturday.

This is situated in the heart of the mediaeval quarter, next to the Casa del Cordón, one of the oldest, most historic buildings in town. Opened as an establishment specially devoted to the organic potatoes of Alava, it has developed into a place serving a wide variety of pintxos, set meals and portions, while remaining true to its vocation of home cooking made using quality, fresh produce. It prepares dinners by arrangement and an extensive menu of portions on Thursday, Friday and Saturday evenings, as well as a daily set meal on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. The dining room seats about 40 people.

Located right in the centre of Vitoria-Gasteiz, two minutes’ walk from the Plaza de la Virgen Blanca, PerretxiCo is divided into two areas: the “taberna”, with show cooking and a pintxo bar, and the dining room, where as well as set meals and an à la carte menu there is the option of sharing a selection of snacks in the evening.

The establishment backs up its food with other leisure options and is open all day, from breakfast time to evening drinks.

An establishment that sets out to be attractive from morning to night. It serves a range of full breakfasts, pintxos at midday and a wine list, infusions and drinks in the evening. 

The restaurant has an outside terrace where meals are served and organises events and exhibitions all year round.

One of the classic establishments in the city’s mediaeval quarter, opposite the eastern façade of the church of San Pedro Apóstol, its speciality is spoon food, though the menu also features snacks in the form of cazuelitas, pintxos and tapas.

An establishment specialising in pintxos, though it also serves dishes and set meals, the highlights of which are seasonal produce and rice. 

It is situated on one of the most central streets in the city but is a quiet restaurant - perfect for trying its specialities in a relaxing setting.

Founded around 1920 by Miguel Setién, this establishment is still run by the same family. It has a dining room with space for 90 people which is only open during the “txotx” season, which means from late January to early April. At this time of year it is traditional to drink cider served straight from the “kupela” or barrel in a popular gastronomic tradition that includes trying the traditional cider house menu: cod omelette, code with peppers and T-bone steak, followed by cheese, quince jelly and walnuts for dessert. The cider house currently produces 90,000 litres of natural cider. Bottles of cider can be purchased at the establishment all year round.

Perched on the side of the Leitzaran valley in the municipality of Andoain and just 15 kilometres from the beaches of San Sebastián, this establishment offers country holiday accommodation as well as a restaurant. The original part of the building is a fully restored farmhouse dating from the 18th century. As well as traditional cooking in a charming setting, the restaurant has a wine cellar dug out underground, guaranteeing ideal temperatures and humidity levels for keeping wine. The restaurant has room for 100 diners and offers the option of hosting business meetings, weddings, private meals and so on.

Astigarraga es is the cradle of traditionally-made Basque craft cider. This is why so many varieties of it are to be found on the wine lists of restaurants in the area. This is one such establishment, which pays special attention to the local cider. The restaurant specialises in traditional Basque cookery, made from fresh produce. It offers various set meals to suit the tastes of every diner.

Situated in the locality of Ereñozu, close to the Aiako Harria nature park, this is an establishment founded and run by the family that used to work the farm, which is thought to date back to the 17th century. Its speciality is traditional Basque cuisine, made from seasonal local produce. It also serves roasts cooked over charcoal. It has a car park outside, as well as a garden area. It serves dishes for coeliacs and people with any other kind of food intolerance.

Housed in the Marraka-Enea farmstead, just a few minutes from San Sebastián, this establishment specialises in grilled meat and fish, especially ribs. The menu features seasonal produce such as beans from Tolosa, salads with fresh garden produce and also game. Snacks, sandwiches and combi dishes are also served on the terrace. It has two dining rooms seating 65 and 150 diners, parking and a children’s play area.

This restaurant is part of the HK10 hotel. Its menu gives prominence to seasonal produce, prepared in the traditional way but with an innovative twist. Also on offer is a traditional cider house menu and a daily set meal. 

The establishment has room for 200 people and is available for holding weddings, functions and business events.

Abio Txakolina is a winery that forms part of the Bizkaiko Txakolina designation of origin and is located in the coastal municipality of Bakio, a place where the tradition of making txakoli is deeply rooted.

 

After three generations dedicated to preserving and improving the little secrets of making txakoli, the winery is now committed to innovation and development. It specialises in white, red and rosé txakoli.

This winery, located in Bakio, produces a limited amount of txakoli which is made and bottled on the estate. It is 100% made using the Hondarribi Zuri grape variety.

 

ADOS Txakoli is made using the Hondarribi Zuri grape variety only. This seaside txakoli with plenty of exposure to the sun is “straw yellow [in colour] with greenish tones, clear and bright”

Butroi Upategia is a winery in the Bizkaiko Txakolina denomination of origin, with vineyards in Gatika, Zamudio, Lezama and Larrabetzu.

 

Its txakoli is made using Hondarrabi Zuri, Petit Courbu and Mune Mahatsa grapes. Guided tours can be run by arrangement, with the content required by each client.

This family winery, steeped in winemaking tradition, stands on the western slopes of Zamudio, very close to the Zamudio technology park. It combines tradition and technology, with cutting-edge methods and new winemaking techniques, while respecting the craft tradition. Its vineyards use systems of integrated production that care for the environment, the vineyard and the surroundings.

A family winery that has been dedicated to the world of winemaking for five generations. It produces a wide range of wines, some of them unique like the white Tempranillo Blanco or the single-variety Maturana. It combines tradition and technology, using innovative methods.

Bodegas Lozano is a wine tourism project that includes a multi-purpose event venue, unique experiences like "pick, tread and enjoy", "create your own wine" and/or "a chef in the winery", restaurant, wine bar and lounge bar with terrace, express tastings, wine shop and a winery that visitors can tour inside and out to find out how its wines are made, with spectacular views of the mountains. 

 

It's a winery focused on family tourism. Its "Family Aroma Game" is an ideal option for all the family, a fun, educational activity that's perfect for all ages. Not only can you visit every corner of the winery including the experimental vineyard, the ageing hall and the historic cellar, but you can discover the secrets of making corks and play a game to guess or spot different aromas with all the family. This activity includes: 

 

  • Visit to the experimental vineyard 

  • Entrance to the exclusive young artists' area 

  • Visit to the cellar and ageing hall 

  • Grape juice tasting for children 

  • Tasting of 3 wines for adults 

  • Aperitif paired with the wine 

  • A welcome pack for the youngest visitors, with puzzles and a bottle to design and decorate. Label, cork and capsule... everything you need will be provided.

Housed in a renovated 16th-century farmstead.

Its specialities are baked hake and whole lamb cooked over embers. It has a family atmosphere and homemade food in a quiet country setting.

Set meal available by arrangement only.

Situated at the foot of Monte Erlo, on a low hill from which there is a view of Azkoitia. Concentrates on daily and weekend set meals. Cider house menu (with “txotx” cider from the cask all year round) and also combi dishes and special sandwiches.
Specialised in meat and fish cooked over embers. Also varied cider house menus. Three kupelas (casks), two of 4,000 litres each and one of 4,500 litres.

The José Mari Jatetxea restaurant is a family establishment popularly known as "El Gordo", located in Agurain / Salvatierra (Álava)

Specialises in roast dishes and fish, as well as seasonal dishes. Serves set meal of the day, tasting menu, à la carte menu and pintxos. Rabas (fried squid) and freshly-made sandwiches. Special prices for pilgrims on St. James’ Way.

datosRestauracion.capacidad: Two dining rooms for celebrations, one seating 10 and the other 150 people.

datosGenerales.descripcion: Set meal of the day from Monday to Friday and weekend menu. Take-away meals every day of the week. Also roast chicken, combi dishes and sandwiches. Organises gastronomic days in the hunting and mushroom seasons. Open - Monday to Friday: 7am - 11pm. - Saturday: 8am - 12pm. - Sunday: 8am - 5pm.
Specialists in home cooking, meat and fish dishes.

Presenting a free style of cooking, adapting Basque culinary culture and roots to an avant-garde context.

Traditional sauces and recipes are presented in an evolved form, adapted to fit into a tasty, healthy cuisine and an informal gastronomic experience. It serves a children’s menu, set meals for groups and dishes for vegetarians, allergy sufferers and coeliacs.

The terrace is situated in the Plaza del Museo.

Situated right in the centre of the city’s historic Ensanche district, on a pedestrianised street, it offers a wide variety of pintxos, in particular hot ones prepared to order. Its cooking is based on the traditional tastes of Basque gastronomy. It offers an à-la-carte menu featuring seasonal produce and also a daily set meal. It has a fully-equipped terrace.

With a cosmopolitan, urban atmosphere, it is housed in the Gran Hotel Domine Bilbao, just next to the Guggenheim Museum. The decor is influenced by the style of the Bauhaus school, with stainless steel furniture in strongly contrasting colours in a glassed-in space with a view of Frank Gehry’s building. The establishment specialises in fresh seasonal produce. It offers cafeteria service and a daily set meal.

The Azumendi oenogastronomic complex includes the Gorka Izagirre txakoli winery. The winery is equipped with the latest winemaking technology. Its wines come from its estate comprising over 40 hectares of vineyards, planted with the Hondarrabi Zuri and Hondarrabi Zerratia grape varieties, spread over 6 municipalities in the province of Bizkaia. The winery's goal is to revive and promote the native Hondarrabi Zuri and Hondarrabi Zerratia varieties. This is why it works exclusively with these grapes.

This restaurant is located at the foot of Monte Jata in Maruri-Jatabe, in a perfect setting for a family visit. Specialising in traditional food using local produce. A highlight of the menu is the fish, which comes straight from the harbour in Armintza. It has two indoor dining rooms that are perfect for celebrations of all kinds and a terrace with access to a playground for the smallest members of the family. It has plenty of parking space for its clients.

Specialising in fresh fish and shellfish from Bermeo, as well as griddled chops and traditional cookery. It has an à la carte menu and special set meals for groups, as well as pintxos and other dishes. The restaurant is close to San Juan de Gaztelugatxe, one of the must-see spots on the Basque coastline.

The restaurant is located in the Iriarte Jauregia Hotel, a meticulously-restored 17th-century palace. Run by chef Enrique Fleischmann, it offers signature cuisine with fresh, high-quality produce where taste plays an undisputed starring role. The menu changes to offer the best seasonal produce at every time of year. Tradition and innovation, character and creativity, form the foundation of this gastronomic restaurant. Weddings and major events are held both in its dining room, with room for 45 people, and in its beautiful garden.

ROUTE 33 Gourmet combines an arts venue with great food. It offers a fusion of quality fast food and traditional regional produce. As well as a bar laden with pintxos, it serves portions, combi dishes and special meals to order. Dishes prepared with the maximum of care, with an eye to combining the best raw materials. As well as the restaurant area it has a children's play park, a delicatessen produce area and a museum devoted to the history of bread, with ethnographic material. Route 33 Gourmet also have two more restaurants in Lasarte and Hondarribia.

Located next to Hondarribia beach, Ardora Restaurant specialises in traditional Basque cuisine based on typical products from the region. The maritime theme reflects the opportunity to try dishes from its extensive fish menu, although it also offers meat dishes and a variety of starters.

Located in a fine example of an urban building dating back to 1909, Casino de Irún offers, under its offices, a bar-restaurant service where you can enjoy the menu of the day, featuring dishes with a home-made touch. It also has a bar offering delicious pintxos (small snacks). The premises is spacious and its large windows overlook the Paseo Colón, the main street in Irún.

The gastro bar Obispo offers, in addition to a wide range of pintxos (small snacks), the interesting option of a pintxo-pote (a snack and a drink) from a menu which adapts and innovates typical dishes from the Basque cuisine. It is located next to Hotel Obispo, a palace from the 14th-15th century, located in the heart of the historic quarter of Hondarribia, within the city's walls and overlooking Txingudi bay.

Hermandad de Pescadores is a restaurant with a long tradition and one of the most famous in the Hondarribia area. It opened in 1947 in the building which used to house the old Fishermen's Guild. Famous for its range of fish dishes, it specialises in the typical cuisine of our land. One of its star dishes is hake, prepared in different ways, as well as its kokotxas (the flesh under a fish's jaw).

The speciality of this restaurant in Hondarribia is clearly the grill. Its head chef won the national grilling competition at San Sebastián Gastronomika 2015. It offers varied and creative cooking, with an individual or group menu. It also serves a typical cider house menu with Spanish omelette, meat and sidra al txotx (a Basque cider). There is also the opportunity to order its menu of the day, which is as carefully prepared as all of the above.

La Vinoteka restaurant, very close to the centre of Irun, stands out for the quality and variety of its wines. It offers an extensive à la carte menu, highlights of which include risotto and salads, as well as the chance to try the set meal of the day. It also boasts a bar with tasty pintxos and attractive “pintxo-pote” combinations of a pintxo and a drink.

Viñedos de Páganos is a modern winery located in Laguardia, the capital of the Rioja Alavesa region. Beside the winery is the vineyard of "El Puntido", which boasts an ideal climate and geology. Its soil, rich in minerals, give the wine an outstanding mineral personality.

 

Very nearby is the vineyard of “La Nieta”. With poorer soil and a completely different micro-climate, vines of moderate vigour grown in a natural way yield grapes of high quality.

 

Together they make two wine varieties: “El Puntido”, a powerful tempranillo which is also available as a Gran Reserva, and “La Nieta”, a crisper, pleasing wine.

Located in a central neighbourhood of Irun, El Ensanche offers a bar-restaurant service where you can enjoy a daily set meal in which home-made dishes play a starring role. It also has a bar serving tasty pintxos.

This restaurant in San Sebastián, located at the foot of El Ulía, is housed in a traditional farmstead with a rustic touch. Its menu is distinguished by being entirely home-made, featuring fresh garden produce and creative, innovative dishes. Of special note are its meat and fish dishes, its set meals and its oven-baked home-made bread.

Restaurante La Ola jatetxea Ereaga hondartzan dago, Getxon. Itsasoaren ondo-ondoan dago, ikuspegi ezin hobea du itsasora eta Portu Zaharraren alboan dago. 2012an berritu zen osorik, eta 2 solairu independente eta terraza handia ditu kanpoan, bezeroen sukaldaritza premiak, ospakizunak eta ekitaldiak asebetetzeko.

The Hotel restaurant Artaza has four separate lounges, a private dining room and a private terrace ideal for family celebrations and company meals. Its cuisine is based on the finest produce from its own vegetable garden and a selection of the best possible fish and seafood from our seas.

Restaurante Migaea opts for a new version of traditional flavours, working with traditional cuisine while prioritising quality produce and giving it a more contemporary personal touch. It has a spacious dining room and open-air terrace. Ideal for tailor-made family or company functions, or simply to try a few pintxos, for which it has won several awards.

Restaurant serving traditional cooking with a predominance of fish and seafood, nearly all caught wild and much of it grilled. Naturally, diners can opt for fried fish or a char-grilled T-bone or fillet steak with home-made chips. A wide and varied selection of still and sparkling wines and home-made desserts. Open-air terrace looking straight out over the boats in the harbour, ideal for sunny days.

In the Plaza del Puente Colgante de Bizkaia, beside the Bizkaia Bridge, SUKAM is in premises that are modern but also pleasant and cosy. The transporter bridge can be seen from some of its large windows. Inside, apart from an open kitchen that allows diners to see the work of the cooks, it features a small work of art in the form of a mural on one of the walls. It serves both traditional dishes such as cod or oxtail and more contemporary creations, more elaborate and in some cases with oriental influences, such as teriyaki ribs.

Home cooking in this pleasant little restaurant on two floors in Getxo. Ideal for going out to eat in a group, as it serves special set meals for groups, or simply to have a pintxo or some other snack. It features top-quality raw materials and friendly, attentive staff.

Restaurant open to the public, with a family atmosphere and traditional cooking. An ideal place for holding family functions, celebrations, company lunches or dinners and for trying the traditional cooking of Segura. It also has an outdoor terrace to soak up the local atmosphere while enjoying a drink in the open air.

Restaurante Fadura, named after the neighbourhood of Getxo where it is located, serves traditional food, but with special emphasis on the use of organic produce in its preparation. In addition to its set meal of the day, it also offers a vegetarian option. The restaurant is also a catering school offering courses both for adults for employment purposes and for younger audiences.

datosContacto.direccion: Avenida de los Chopos s/n, Getxo (Junto al polideportivo de Fadura)

datosGenerales.descripcion: Laguardia, capital of wine, invites you to immerse yourself in the place, savouring the secrets of its natural produce. While it is true that the wine of Rioja Alavesa is one of the seven wonders of the world, the food in the region is the eighth. And when you have the chance to combine these two pleasures, the experience is simply out of this world. And the Batzoki restaurant in Rioja Alavesa is one of those places where you can taste a fine wine accompanied by a delightful traditional cookery that reveals a determination to innovate but without losing the culinary essence of Álava. A large carved wood panel presides over the entrance, showing that you are entering a place where the traditional comes first. However, you will be surprised to find that while respecting the region's delicious customs, Batzoki stands out by giving a distinctive touch to its dishes. Fresh, high-quality ingredients prepared with loving care certainly play a leading role here. Many people agree that the pisto (a Mediterranean vegetable stew) is delightful, while others say the lamb chops are truly exquisite, and still others consider the dessert Goxua a fine example of the acclaimed Basque cuisine. Of course, nobody can agree on which is the restaurant's star dish as its menus are designed to cater for all palates. In short the Batzoki restaurant achieves something that few places can claim: to serve traditional dishes but with a subtly mischievous twist, a twist that does not harm the essence of the ingredients but brings it out.

Located at the foot of the southern end of the imposing Cantabria range, the small village of Samaniego is home to a winery whose essence lies primarily in the unique way it makes its wines: Remírez de Ganuza. Founded in 1989, the winery fits in with the traditional architecture of the heart of Samaniego. The water channel that runs through its large central patio feeds the different old houses clustered around it.

 

This represents the enormous vitality of this winery and its determination to carry on growing. It is just this kind of fusion that marks the character of the winery. The fact that it is relatively recent gives it a robust, lively attitude and above all a clear orientation towards innovation and evolution.

 

This is without setting aside the rich winemaking tradition that so characterises Samaniego.  Each of the big old houses contains part of the different winemaking processes that set Remírez de Ganuza apart from the rest. While right from the start it has used ground-breaking techniques like the sorting table, cold rooms and barrels, today it continues to embrace advances like the bag used to extract our Trasnocho, or the machine to wash grapes in their own must.

 

Cutting edge and innovation bottled in 7 wines: Trasnocho, Viña Coqueta, Fincas de Ganuza, Remírez de Ganuza Blanco, Erre Punto Tinto, M.Remírez de Ganuza and finally Remírez de Ganuza. Wines that distil the essence of the winery, as they are made using grapes from vines an average of 60 years old, with malolactic fermentation and ageing always taking place in new barrels.

 

In fact, the vineyards are another distinctive trait of the winery. 80 hectares of high-quality tempranillo, graciano, viura and malvasia vines, in the localities of Samaniego, Leza, Elciego, San Vicente de la Sonsierra, Laguardia and Ábalos. All of them are sheltered by the mountains and have the ideal habitat and microclimate for the wines they produce.

 

A combination that is both harmonious and robust, and comes out not only in the philosophy and essence of the winery, but also in the taste and aroma of its wines. Guided tours: Every day(monday to saturday) at 10.30am and 12.30am. Tours are by prior arrangement only. They can be booked on 945 60 90 22 or by email (visit form) visitas@remirezdeganuza.com

The Amaren winery is much more than just a high-quality wine. It is a veritable ode to hard work, tradition, care for the vineyards and working by hand at home, and all these things rest on one pillar: Ángeles, the mother of Juan Luis Cañas, founder of the modern winery. Hence the name: Amaren means “of the mother”. It is precisely hard work and love of the job of winemaking that characterises the process of making Amaren wines. The winery has 22 hectares of vines over 60 years old and 30 hectares aged between 30 and 60 years, spread over several plots, most of them less than a hectare and with vines of an average age reaching in some cases up to a hundred years. All of them contain the essence of the passing of time and the unstoppable course of nature. The qualities become properties that can be detected with all five senses. Unique, exclusive vineyards requiring painstaking care that rules out the use of aggressive substances on the crops and encourages organic methods. This way of doing things cares not only for the environment, but also for consumers' well-being, so fitting in with the warm, homely philosophy of the winery, and above all the maternal spirit that comes from the figure of Ángeles. But warmth is not incompatible with rigour, just as tradition can go hand in hand with innovation. Moreover, Amaren remains true to four singular features. It does not produce its wines every year, but only when their quality allows it; the grapes are harvested entirely manually and each plot is used for a different wine depending on its yield, the direction it faces, where it is, the soil and the age of the vines; also, the grapes are brought in in small plastic crates and upon arrival in the winery first the bunches and then the individual grapes are checked by hand, one by one. The winery also has modern winemaking systems, consisting of wooden vats and small stainless steel tanks, then ageing the wines in top-quality French and American oak barrels. Amaren's cutting-edge techniques are in perfect harmony with the hundred year-old beauty of its premises. The 16th-century rock-hewn cellar in which its wines are laid down is not just an underground marvel that simply has to be seen, but also shows that it is possible to create a wine by hand, keeping tradition alive but adding the latest features. The winery's five wines represent this harmony perfectly: Blanco Barrica, Crianza, Ángeles de Amaren, Reserva Tempranillo and Monovarietal Graciano. Amaren is a delicious homage to the woman from whom Juan Luis got his love of the countryside and its fruits; but above all, the winery is a declaration of intent. A winery that chooses to keep up the craft approach, the essential, respect for nature and above all quality rather than quantity. Types of visit Winemaker for a day: Glass in hand, the visitor will find out all about the winery, its philosophy and where its Special Wines are made, using specially-selected grapes from particular plots to make wines whose colour, aroma and taste reveal the soul of the winery. We then move from theory to practice, to try being a winemaker for a day and designing a unique wine, your own coupage. A tasting session provides the climax to the visit, though not without first experiencing the magical feeling of descending into a 16th-century cellar. Two options: - Option A: o Guided tour o Tasting of 4 wines during the tour o TAPA accompanied by Amaren Crianza o Free glass + glass holder - Option B: o Guided tour o Tasting of 4 wines during the tour o SELECTION OF TYPICAL LOCAL PRODUCE accompanied by Ángeles de Amaren o Free glass + glass holder Length of the visit: about 60 minutes Languages: Spanish / English. Important: Visits must be arranged in advance by calling 945 17 52 40 or sending an email to info@bodegasamaren.com Single-variety wines: This visit includes the same activities as the previous one, but also the chance to experience the magical sensation of tasting a single-variety old-vine Grenache from our Exclusive Collection. Price: Adults €25 / Children €4 (up to 10 years old free) Includes: Guided tour Tasting of 5 wines during the tour SELECTION OF TYPICAL LOCAL PRODUCE accompanied by Amaren Reserva 60 Free glass + glass holder Length of the visit: 75 minutes Languages: Spanish / English. Important: Visits must be arranged in advance by calling 945 17 52 40 or sending an email to info@bodegasamaren.com

There is nothing like remaining true to the tradition begun by the grandparents of the founders of El Mozo Wines decades ago, but adding a relaxed, crisp modern touch to its products. Ignoring the rules of the wine world, right from the start El Mozo Wines stands out for having a name that perfectly represents its philosophy.

 

A name that recalls the tradition begun by the grandparents of the winery's owners with the reference to “El Mozo”, but also reveals the youthful attitude of this generation by adding “Wines”. If the name of this family of wines is striking in itself, the names of the individual wines could even refer to a book title or a legend.

 

With memorable labels like Malaspiedras, Herrigoia, El Cosmonauta y El Viaje en el Tiempo and El Cosmonauta en el Barranco de Agua are bottles that express the meticulous care that goes into them. Born in 9 hectares of family vineyards on 18 small plots planted up to 70 years ago by the parents and grandparents of the current owners, El Mozo Wines is a highly distinctive MicroWine, where the quality of the product and care for nature come first. Thanks to a traditional, sustainable and organic wine-growing process, the natural properties of the grapes are kept practically intact.

 

This means its wines offer an epic sensory experience, where everybody can savour, smell and hold nature in its purest essence: its fruits and colours, born with the passing of time and bathed in the countless tones of the four intense seasons of the Álava region. Quite apart from its original labels and imaginative names, this small winery's products are imbued with a purity and passion that makes El Mozo Wines more than just a product, turning them into the materialisation of an immense love for wine and family.

 

Visits: Monday to Saturday 10.00am - 1.00pm & 5.00 - 7.00pm / Sundays 10.00am - 2.00pm

In the locality of Villabuena de Álava – Eskuernaga, a century-old family wine-growing tradition remains very much alive, encapsulated in the bottles that come out of the Marquesa–Valserrano winery. The different varieties of these wines come from hillside vineyards on the slopes of the Cantabrian range, infused with an ever-changing golden tone by the warm sun.

 

Their unalterable character as old vines with a low yield, together with the new family plantations, make Marquesa-Valserrano a wine that exudes history, quality and personality, but above all versatility. A versatility that allows it to adapt to changing times and new needs, to suit tastes of all kinds. To do this, the vineyards produce grapes of a range of varieties: tempranillo, mazuelo, grenache, graciano and viura. However, the essence of the wines does not come solely from the 75 hectares of family vineyards.

 

It is also what goes on inside the winery that sets the tone for its exclusive winemaking: in deep cellars enclosed by solid 200 year-old walls where the high-quality wine produced over a hundred years has been kept; in barrels from different countries, in which the wines age gradually to take on their characteristic vitality and elegance; and in bottle racks where the wines mature to reach a maturity that gives them a unique power and essence. A tour of the winery allows visitors to taste the passion for wine that imbues the fifth generation of the De Simón family, who have kept their winemaking tradition unchanged despite the adversities of the climate or changing markets. A clan that can only be compared to the diverse family of wines they produce harvest after harvest, and which taken together represent a veneration and respect for the land and its fruits.

 

Types of visit: THE ORIGINS OF VALSERRANO: A journey through the history of the winery, taking in our ancient "calados" or cellars. At the end of the tour, guided tasting of 2 wines. Length: about 30-40 min.

 

LA MARQUESA – VALSERRANO WINERY TOUR: A full tour of the winery, from its origins to the present day, discussing the different systems used to make and age its wines. At the end, guided tasting of 3 wines with a small snack. Length: about 60 min.

 

VALSERRANO PREMIUM TOUR AND TASTING: A tour beginning with the ancient "calados" or cellars and going on to visit the rest of the winery to discover its history and the modern processes used to make and age the wine. During the visit, glass in hand, you'll taste 3 wines being made and/or aged and at the end of the tour, 3 finished wines accompanied by a typical product of La Rioja. Length: about 120 min.

 

PREMIUM VINEYARD TOUR: We'll visit some of our most characteristic vineyards, explaining the growth cycle of the vines and the features of the estate. During your visit to the vineyard you'll taste 1 wine and finish off by visiting our ancient "calados" or cellars and trying 3 wines in our Wine Bar. Length: about 120 min. Days of tours: Monday to Friday, from May to October only. Groups of 2-4 people. - Languages: Spanish, English and French. - Days of tours: depending on availability, check times (Monday to Friday morning and afternoons, and Saturday mornings).

 

VALSERRANO WINEBAR: In the Winebar & Shop you can taste any of our wines by the glass, whether or not you go on any of the tours. You can also purchase any of our wines, as well as other products related to the wine world. Opening times are: Monday to Friday 9am - 2pm and 3 - 5pm; Friday and Saturday 10am - 1.30pm To find out more about visits, activities or tastings, please contact the winery: visitas@valserrano.com or +34 945 609 085.

Bodegas Mayor de Migueloa is a synonym of nobility and tradition. Hidden among the ancient, winding streets of Laguardia, to enter the old house that is home to both the restaurant and its winery and guesthouse is to travel into the past. Time seems to stop at Mayor de Migueloa, except for the house wine which, harvest after harvest, continues to capture the flavour of the passing of time, and of course for the food served in the restaurant which, as it is seasonal, gives off the smells of the earth and living nature of the Álava landscape.

 

Though the palace was restored in 1988 to convert it into a pioneer of Spanish wine tourism, the original building of 1619 still has its thick stone walls and ancient beams. Thus, the place represents the living history of wine, producing it in a place where it can not only be seen, smelt and tasted, but also touched and heard. Inside the palace you feel the cold, even though it is protected by the warmth of the stones, and feel the calm silence that comes from the thick walls of the cellars, combined with the sound of the people setting around the tables in the restaurant to share some unique moments.

 

It is precisely these feelings that show how Mayor de Migueloa preserves the original appearance of the place, combined with modern-day comfort that turns the palace into a cosy place. One of its greatest attractions, apart from the delicious food and the hospitality it offers, is the cellar dating from 1919, where the house wines are laid down.

 

The heart of the winery lies 10 metres down, making one feel small before the unceasing passing of the years, but you can also experience a sensation of peace and comfort, contrasting with the strong excitement and emotion that comes from penetrating to the core and essence of the winemaking tradition.

 

 

Visits: Winery tour with tasting of the house wines and a tapa. This lasts about 45 min. Times: Saturdays and Sundays 11.00am and 12.00am / Other times on request. Price: €5 per person

 

Tasting courses: If you'd like to discover the world of Rioja wine, we recommend this activity, in which you'll discover the secrets of wine... Prices and times: by arrangement

The Errota Berri restaurant will make you feel right at home. Situated in the Basque Coast Geopark, 900 metres from the Sakoneta beach, an area listed as a protected biotope for its high environmental, biological and marine value, the restaurant is housed in a traditional farmhouse, the ideal place to spend a pleasant day with either your partner or your family. Traditional food that not only respects its raw materials - our excellent produce - but also brings out the best in them to leave a lasting impression on your palate.

The Hondar restaurant, right in the heart of Hondarribia, a stone's throw from the harbour, is a great option for taking a break while visiting this magical seaside town. The attraction of the place lies in its varied menu: whether you want to take your time over a full meal or just relax with a snack, Hondar offers plenty to choose from. Highlights among its specialities include fish and meat dishes such as T-bone, entrecote and tenderloin steaks, anglerfish, code, hake and more. Food that is traditional but practical, suitable for any occasion.

At the Arteaga restaurant you'll have the chance to try traditional Basque cookery in all its glory. In a restored farmhouse surrounded by green hills, Arteaga offers fresh, seasonal produce served in a way that preserves its excellent quality. From roast sea bass or cod to cutlets or oxtail, the restaurant serves good, honest food, washed down with a wide range of the finest wines from its cellar. In addition, to make your visit as complete as possible, Arteaga has six rooms where guests can enjoy the experience with all five senses.

Finding quality at the right price is possible. The Hotel K10 doesn't just offer comfortable, modern rooms at competitive prices, but also has a restaurant that meets guests' every need with a wide choice of food and dishes. In summer the place even organises events like concerts on the restaurant terrace, which also serves grilled meat. A restaurant that, like the hotel, offers its clients a service that's practical but good: from vast buffets with fresh fruit juice, fruit or bacon and eggs to sandwiches and hamburgers or even full grilled meals.

A traditional cider house and grill restaurant ideal for dinners for large groups, for an evening out with your partner and even to celebrate a wedding. Oianume Jatetxea, located in Urnieta, is big enough to have dining rooms of different types, and serves dishes that are both traditional and painstakingly prepared. Neck of hake, barbel in green sauce, artichokes with liver pâté, beans or cutlets are just some of the plates to be tried here. Food that can also be washed down with cider fresh from the barrel. A suitable place for any occasion, with rooms, parking and play facilities for the smallest members of the party.

The Mendiola restaurant will surprise you. Located in Ermua, this establishment serves traditional Basque dishes, but with a special modern twist. Quality ingredients treated with loving care and dedication to create dishes that are both attractive and modern. Mendiola also offers set meals to meet the preferences and needs of all diners: its special weekend menus are a sure-fire success. Some of its star dishes include fish soup, hake in green sauce, cod in pil-pil (oil, chilli and garlic) sauce or hake filled with spider crab. Clients who are not so hungry won't be able to resist the temptation to try the pintxos prepared for the traditional “pintxopote” Thursdays, where delicious food is combined with a drink.

A restaurant designed to suit all tastes. Sagarra describes itself as a gastro-pub. Its extensive, carefully-designed menu makes this the ideal place for both meals and snacks, while its modern, minimalist style equipped with the best possible sound system make Sagarra the perfect place to go in the evening. Two atmospheres co-existing peacefully in a single place, making the most of the establishment. A fusion of experiences that also makes itself felt in the food served at Sagarra.
