A single menu ranges from crispy prawns in kimchi sauce to horse cheeks in Pedro Ximénez wine; and snacks in the gastro-bar include red tuna tataki and Polish beef rib. Sagarra offers the chance to combine these dishes with a wide variety of drinks, a highlight of which is the excellent selection of gins.

Enjoying a high-quality meal while you take in unsurpassed views of the Basque countryside is a possibility at this restaurant housed in the historic Zumeltzegi tower. 

 

The recently-restored building, situated in Oñati, offers traditional cookery, available in a wide variety of menus to suit all tastes.

 

An ideal place to try typical local produce, many of it prepared right here in the tower. Both fish and meat dishes are worth tasting while you take in the beauty of the valley around Oñati.

 

For a complete experience, Torre Zumeltzegi also has 12 rooms.

Uxarte will make you feel right at home. Set among mountains, the restaurant offers accommodation as well as traditional dishes made with produce that often comes from the restaurant's own garden. Highlights among them include peas and baby broad beans sautéed with ham and egg at low temperature, tomato with tuna belly, mixed vegetable stew and more. Fresh, seasonal produce makes it possible to tailor the menu to the client or adapt it for diabetes, coeliacs or allergy sufferers.

The ideal place for big occasions with family and friends. Open only during the “Txotx” season, the Goikoetxea cider house has room for 120 people and a menu that goes perfectly with the star of the establishment, "sagardo" or Basque cider. The food is therefore simple and traditional, while being of high quality. The menu includes dishes like Spanish omelette, cod and ribs. Food that is a perfect match with the cider that comes from the 10 stainless steel vats in the restaurant.

Restaurant on the Zelai spa-hotel complex, by the spectacular Itzurun beach. An unbeatable view of the sea and the rocky coast (Flysch) can be enjoyed from the dining room. Fixed price lunch menu, gastro menu, children’s menu and a la carte. Specialty: salad featuring little gem lettuce, anchovies and tuna, creamy rice with wild mushrooms and foie, grilled line-caught squid , black monkfish on the grill with hot-roasted potatoes, roasted suckling lamb with hot-roasted potatoes.

On Zumaia’s campsite, Orrua offers a traditional cuisine in premises seating over 200 people, equipped with a terrace, chill-out area, swings, giant screen… Speciality: Scrambled eggs with wild mushrooms and foie, Peppers stuffed with cod or meat, stir fried, vegetables, variety of salads, fresh fish on the grill. Lunch menú, a la carte.

Bar-restaurant next to ‘la Antigua’, known as the ‘cathedral among hermitages’. It offers laidback cuisine with a large variety of pintxos, salads, open-toasted sandwiches, cold sandwiches, burgers, dishes… Speciality: Tagliatelli, wild mushroom and langoustine warm salad Suckling calf rib with potatoes, braised beef cheeks in sauce with potatoes and wild mushrooms, roast pork knuckle with potatoes, torrija (French toast).

After his enormous success in Ordizia, Juan Martínez de Rituerto has embarked on a new adventure at the head of Aldasoro Berri in Lazkao.

A restaurant that serves traditional dishes at the same exquisite level as those in Ordizia, but with more space for diners to enjoy their meals in greater comfort.

Highlights among the dishes include: pig's trotters filled with mushroom and liver pâté, Iberian pork slice with red fruits and mushrooms, veal cheeks in chasseur sauce, octopus with paprika and olive oil, Iberian pig's ear in garlic sauce and homemade cheesecake, as well as a wide variety of pintxos for those who want to sample the restaurant's creations in small amounts.

The Restaurante Artzegi offers dishes that are traditional but unique of their kind, made from fresh, local, seasonal produce.

Home cooking always comes first at this establishment, which has been described as a "culinary paradise".

From the bread to the desserts, naturally including the dishes that make up a variety of set meals, including: courgette leaves filled with meat from Zigoitia and idiazábal cheese sauce, chilled watermelon soup, griddled prawns, lamb roasted in a wood-burning oven, white tuna in piperade sauce, duck confit with apple compôte and caramelised port, and countless unique but homemade, traditional dishes.

Matías Gorrotxategi's ribs are a veritable institution. The grilled meat and fish that characterise its renowned cook are certainly the star dishes of this restaurant, located in the Hotel Castillo. The menu ranges from acorn-fed Iberian cured ham or beef, peppers filled with Goierri black pudding with Lodosa sauce or grilled anglerfish, to oxtail stew and grilled beef ribs. All the dishes are made from fresh, local produce to give visitors an authentic taste of the area. The restaurant also offers the solid Menú Matías set meal and mid-week meals to suit occasions of all kinds.

At Errekatxo you can enjoy quality home cooking in an ideal setting to have a good time with friends or family. 


Highlights among the dishes that make up the set meal for groups include beans with accompaniment, tuna belly salad, veal cheeks, roast black pudding with ratatouille, scrambled egg with spinach and prawns or octopus with cream of potato. 


All followed by unique homemade desserts.

The Gailurretan restaurant not only offers traditionally-made dishes, but also uses high-quality ingredients from small producers who work with the vicissitudes of the fields, the sea and the seasons. Some of the ingredients come from its own vegetable patch and orchard, and even from its herb garden. Touches and twists that make the cuisine at Gailurretan authentic. The rabbit in walnut sauce or fig ice cream are among the most exceptional dishes offered by this restaurant. It also serves special meals for groups or companies by arrangement, highlights among which include its Encartaciones "railway stew", shellfish paella and meat mixed grills. And it caters for events, serving its traditional cooking in small quantities with cocktails and canapés.

Manu Hernández, also in charge of Labekoa in Ezkio, runs this lovely restaurant in Itsaso that does not have a permanent menu so it can be creative with its menus and counter-top pintxos. Speciality: Small peas with “21st century” ham, venison steak on the grill with smoky sauce and suspended, cauliflower, “Itsasoko Argia” pintxo, physical states of the same crème caramel… Fixed price lunch menú, weekend menú, tasting menú.

Native of Zumarraga, Iosu Landa, trained in emblematic restaurants such as El Bully or Túbal, has been running this restaurant since 2010 in the beautiful countryside just 2 minutes by car from the Igartubeiti homestead.

Speciality: crystal peppers with tuna belly and egg, artichokes with clams and ham, fresh fish of the day, sirloin steak on the grill with foie, beef steak.

Fixed price lunch menú, a la carte.

The Gloria's location beside Zierbena harbour makes its star dishes no surprise: fish and seafood. The restaurant serves top-quality ingredients in dishes like barbecued octopus, clams à la marinière, grilled sea bream or barbecued anglerfish.

 

Lovingly-prepared dishes that respect the quality of their ingredients, for visitors to try while enjoying views of the harbour.

 

Without a doubt, the ideal way to discover the sea with all five senses.

The Hotel Nagusi, located in the town of Murgia in Álava province, is home to a restaurant whose motto is “A la brasa”, meaning barbecue. This means that lovers of barbecued dishes of all kinds can try a wide variety of creations here.

The establishment serves meals both for guests staying at the hotel and for visitors who come simply to eat there. These include dishes like smoked salmon salad with tomato jam, partridge salad, barbecued churrasco, grilled veal entrecôte, tuna tataki with orange oil and veal ribs.

These can all be washed down with choices from the establishment's extensive wine list.

La Cuchara de Doña Lola is in a charming farmhouse in an unparalleled green setting. A place to make diners feel at home. The restaurant, which also has rooms where guests can stay, offers cooking that is varied but above all traditionally made. This ranges from fish soup to chicken and chips or hamburgers, always adapting to meet the requirements of its varied clientele. Moreover, the back garden is a wonderful place to enjoy the fresh air with the smallest members of the family.

In a charming place with unsurpassed views of Algorta (Getxo), the Restaurante Satistegi offers a cuisine based on the freshest local, seasonal produce, but with a contemporary, personal touch added by the restaurant's chef Iñaki Ramos Añibarro. While fish from the Bay of Biscay is its great speciality, high-quality meat occupies an important place on the menu; proof of this the T-bone steak. Produce from both land and sea are put together to serve food ranging from squid in its ink or cod confited with black garlic and a pil-pil sauce to Iberian Jabugo pork shoulder with teriyaki or roast shoulder of suckling lamb. Without a doubt, the finest ingredients put together in a surprisingly delicious way.

In Zalla, set amid the landscapes of Enkarterri, the Restaurante Txakolinera Aretxaga will make you feel right at home. This charming, cosy farmhouse is surrounded by its own vineyards, which stand out for the Txakoli they produce, and of course its organic vegetable garden. Local pioneers in planting red fruits, the garden grows natural produce including raspberries, redcurrants and blackberries to accompany dishes with fresh fruit or to go into homemade jams. The garden porch also offers outstanding views that make the food taste even better.

Restaurant located in a charming family hotel with great historical-artistic interest. Its cuisine is traditional with slight modern touches and meticulous attention to detail. Speciality: cod, scallops and spider crab salad, breaded yolks in wild mushroom sauce, sea bream, burduntzi-style lamb - Fried milk with custard and rice pudding. Fixed price lunch menú, a la carte, weekend menú.

Jai-Alai is a restaurant on the outskirts of Azpeitia with several dining rooms, from small private spaces hidden away in the garden to large areas for weddings and celebrations. Speciality: warm seafood salad, squid in its ink, jai Alai Cod, wild boar in sauce, homemade desserts. Fixed price lunch menu, a la carte, weekend menú, cider Menu.

It is located in 15 minutes from Vitoria, in the Landa reservoir, in a beautiful place adapted for swimming and leisure. This restaurant-roaster specializes in grilled and wood-burning roasts. It has a gourmet shop and a large terrace.

The Larrabea café-restaurant is in a setting that is both different and pleasant: a golf course. This gives it a lively, sporty, friendly family atmosphere. This is why its extensive menu is perfectly suited to the practical requirements of its clients, and of course highly versatile. Family celebrations can be followed by company events at Larrabea, together with its wide range of pintxos and combi dishes, made using traditional Basque ingredients from local producers.

In an unsurpassable setting, this hotel in the locality of Argómaniz, in Álava province, in an elegant renaissance palace, houses the Restaurante Aletegi, to add the perfect touch of flavour to the splendid experience offered by the hotel and its surroundings. In a style that is at once aristocratic and traditional, this restaurant, headed by Chef Iñaki Sardina with service by Maitre Daniel García, serves dishes that are a paean to the cuisine and typical produce of Álava. All the ingredients are fresh and seasonal, giving a taste of every time of year. Highlights of the menu include a mushroom pie with sauce, Club Ranero cod, bull tail au gratin with Idiazabal cheese and potato purée, or the delicious dessert known as Goxua. All this washed down with excellent Rioja Alavesa wines marked by their intense colour, floral aromas and fruity flavours, to make sure diners enjoy the authentic taste of the region with all five senses.

The magical reservoir of Ullibarri-Ganboa serves as the backdrop for this grill restaurant, which boasts marvellous views in both summer and winter. In this restaurant, visitors can try both portions and pintxos, some of them the winners of several prizes; however, Erpidea also serves a wide range of meals to suit all pockets, made up of high-quality dishes made from seasonal produce. They include the cod salad with tomato cassé and vegetable vinaigrette, Iberian pork cheeks, barbecued Biscay hake, clams au gratin, duck magret and scrambled egg with mushrooms, among a host of other exquisite dishes.

Since its origins in the 50s in Ondarroa, Sutargi Jatetxea has always been connected with seafaring in the area, and today this link has only become stronger. With versatile premises in which clients can enjoy everything from a relaxed meal to an extensive array of pintxos in a lively, fun atmosphere, Sutargi is a restaurant that serves fresh, high-quality local produce. On the menu diners will find acorn-fed Iberian cured ham, fish soup and small squids with onion as entrées, while for the main course they can choose between conserves from Ondarroa, fresh fish and seafood and even the finest meat or some excellent egg-based dishes. And special mention must be made of the restaurant's Ondarroa-style hake, which has been chosen as the best dish in Basque cuisine by the Basque programme “Tu plato favorito” ("Your Favourite Dish"). The ideal place to savour the best produce from both sea and land.

Situated in what has been called the Switzerland of Álava, the locality of Aramaio is home to the Unzueta cider house.

An ideal place to enjoy not just the stunning Alavés valley, but also to try the dishes and produce typical of the area. In a spacious but cosy setting characterised by a faithful devotion to what is traditional, Unzueta offers its lovingly-prepared speciality, grilled fish and meat. Without a doubt, everything you need to enjoy the flavour of the valley.

This restaurant, part of the Zuia Golf Club, offers all you need to enjoy the sweeping surroundings. Whether you're here to play golf or simply to enjoy the place, the cafeteria-restaurant serves dishes and meals to suit all tastes. Among them diners can find everything from home-cooked fried dishes to selections of Iberian meats, cream of fish soup or cheek

Restaurant built in a homestead dating from 1761, right in the heart of the Urdaibai Nature reserve, just a few metres from the Santimamiñe Caves and the Oma forest.

It has a car park, children’s play park and garden .

Speciality: special house salad, char-grilled fresh fish, char-grilled meat, special Lezika hake, homemade desserts. Fixed price lunch menu, a la carte, weekend menu, children’s menu.

Welcoming and cosy, with attention to every detail. This is the Restaurante Gamón14 in Errenteria, an establishment run in perfect harmony by the trio of Igor Pazos, Josean Aguirre and Arkaitz Etxarte to create a place to enjoy unique, high-quality dishes in the dining room or delicious snacks, pintxos and sandwiches in the bar. Gamón14 offers a traditional menu with avant-garde and signature twists. A modernity that also pervades the restaurant's decor, with a distinctive but cosy Nordic style combined with avant-garde artistic touches and packed with humour, good taste and above all loving care. Not forgetting the practicality required in such a versatile, varied place. The house specialities include small squids in their ink, a selection of croquettes, rabbit confited with allioli garlic and oil dressing, egg cooked at low temperature with dates and spicy chistorra sausage, oxtail, anchovies and hake in green sauce. An ideal place at any time.

Restaurante Ontziola, just a stone's throw from the harbour in Pasaia, pays homage to the town's fishing tradition and local cookery. But without forgetting today's requirements to suit clients of all ages. To do this, its kitchen produces a variety of dishes including entrées and snacks ranging from nachos to chorizo in cider or mushrooms, warm and cold salads, different creations on toast including the tempting combination of nuts, goat cheese and honey; and main courses ranging from baked gilthead bream to veal ribs or marinated chicken wings.

But Ontziola also offers combi dishes, baguettes, hamburgers, sandwiches, set meals and desserts, proving yet again that it can adapt to meet the needs of all its clients.

Perched atop a hill, offering unparalleled views of the Oarsoaldea, Errentería, Lezo and Oiartzun areas, as well as the unique Pasaia bay and of course the imposing mountain of Jaizkibel, stands Carmen Jatetxea. A restaurant that pays homage to the most authentic local traditions and flavours, using seasonal local produce. All this kept up to date with a modern approach that draws on its roots without sacrificing the latest culinary techniques. But the fact that chef Kike Lacarra offers unique, high-quality cuisine does not mean that Carmen is only for the few; the restaurant also serves affordable set meals to suit all pockets. These include a Daily Set Meal for 13 euros and a Special Weekend Set Meal for 24.50 euros. On the other hand, the Weekend Set Meal for 21.20 euros features a wide choice of dishes, including Navarre-style haricot beans, cod salad with black olive tapenade, marinated bonito with caramelised onion and chilled gazpacho soup or griddled lamb chops, among others. Mention must also be made of the special seasonal, tasting and celebration meals. All of them washed down with the finest wines and finished off with the most traditional desserts.

The aim of Patxiku-Enea is to give you an experience you'll never forget; and the fact is, the restaurant has everything it needs to do just this. Housed in an old farmstead with 200 years of history behind it at the foot of the mountain of Jaizkibel and surrounded by the characteristic deep green landscape of the Basque Country, this grill restaurant is a magical setting and a place that is as welcoming as it is comfortable and attractive. Naturally, all this is rounded off with a menu in which high-quality local produce plays a starring role, treated with loving care and respect to prepare dishes with a pure, unforgettable flavour. On the menu clients can find tasty entrées like grilled octopus and seafood soup. But without a doubt, the limelight belongs to Patxiku-Enea's fish and meat dishes. These include grilled dishes such as sea bream, Ondarroa anglerfish, sole, hake, neck of hake, wild turbot, Patxikuena rib (winner of the 5th national grilling competition) and shoulder of suckling lamb. In short, some unique dishes.

Housed in the elegant Hotel URH Palacio de Oriol, one would expect nothing less of the Restaurante El Palacio. This elegant, refined establishment invites clients to savour its meticulously-prepared menu. Based on traditional Basque cookery, but adding modern, avant-garde twists while respecting the roots of native cuisine, in particular by using fresh, high-quality produce. The restaurant's menu ranges from terrine de foie with sweet preserves and toast, fried and scrambled egg with Gernika peppers or vegetable mixed grill with a creamy Romesco nut sauce; as well as tuna tataki with onion in different textures or Bilbao-style baked sea bream in its juices; to a tile of oxtail, red wine sauce and purple potato cream sauce or entrecôte steak with Gernika peppers and pepper sauce. High-quality dishes as varied as they are unique, whose flavour is brought out by the attractive surroundings and the décor of the restaurant, which combines the classic with the avant-garde.

The Hotel Restaurante Altube is the ideal place to relax after a long journey. Situated beside a motorway, near the village of Altube, this restaurant, in a hotel, serves practical food to meet clients' needs: whether tourists passing through, guests staying the night at the hotel or local residents. This means that diners will find a wide range of dishes to choose from. Moreover, it is all served in a spacious, modern dining room that is both cosy and pleasant.

datosContacto.direccion: Autopista AP-68 Km 36, área de servicio Altube

datosGenerales.descripcion: The Restaurante Maisu has a long history in the seafaring locality of Santurtzi, and its owners are well aware that the client comes first. This means that diners can be sure that the service will be faultless, as will the food they are served. A cuisine that pays tribute to tradition and local, seasonal, fresh produce. The restaurant's specialities therefore include rabas (squid strips), a must on Sundays, and roast lamb. However, despite being a classic, traditional establishment, Maisu has been able to adapt to modern times and its clients' needs by offering a range of options for different occasions. The restaurant is without a doubt the ideal place for everything from romantic dinners to family occasions and celebrations with friends.

Located in Errenteria, Xera Gastroteka is more than just a restaurant or a bar. Xera represents the cult of fine food and drink in all its forms, which is why it has created an establishment with different facets: a restaurant, a bar, a lounge and a wine bar. All in a pleasant, modern setting, designed in an industrial style to express the avant-garde concept that lies behind Xera, but far from being cold, it underlines the warmth and care the staff of the establishment put into their work. With such an innovative concept, what it serves can aspire to no less. First of all, the pintxos are unique: fried scallops on truffled cream, saffron and lemon grass, mini wagyu burger with port wine, potato cream, red onion and French lettuce or fried cuttlefish strips with a black olive ali-oli dressing are just some of the tempting delicacies on offer. Moreover, on the menu clients can find dishes like leaf salad with tempura, fish soup, pork tenderloin with black pepper or duck and pear lasagne with meat juices. All washed down with the most special wines and beers from every corner of the world. And clients can enjoy the experience of discovering all the secrets of the kitchen, which is open for all to see. A versatile place that pays homage to gastronomy and provides a perfect place for all food lovers to enjoy.

Located in spacious premises in the fishing harbour of Santurtzi, the Hogar del Pescador restaurant naturally serves a wide variety of fresh, locally-caught fish. However, its menu does not stop there, offering bonito belly, scorpion fish pudding, tenderloin carpaccio, beef rib or veal escalope, among other things. Nevertheless, its range of seafood is worth a special mention. Clients can try grilled sea bream, sea bass, turbot, hake tail, anglerfish, octopus or cod. This variety is also complemented by seasonal fish including sardines, bonito steak, bonito flank and Mandanga anchovies. An idea restaurant to enjoy with all the family or with friends, to savour the authentic taste of the sea.

Diners can choose their fish and seafood from the display at the entrance, paying by weight for it to be cooked on the show grill. Specialty: prawns on the grill, breaded langoustine tails, soupy lobster rice, sea bream on the grill, Galician char-grilled beef steak

Amelia by Paulo Airaudo Restaurant is located at the heart of the Romantic area of the city, next to the La Concha Promenade.

The two-floor premises, which used to be an old copper shop, has a modern, minimalist style and seats 28 diners.

Argentinian chef Paulo Airaudo is responsible for creating the ‘tasting menus’, combining different flavours and textures to create unique dishes. Following its own philosophy, the restaurant works with small-scale producers who share the same values, sell their produce at traditional markets and provide top-quality, fresh ingredients.

In the same vein, the sommelier focuses on offering wines from different parts of the world which are produced using organic or biodynamic processes.

Félix Manso, better known as “el Druida”, for his great love of magic in the kitchen delights us in the restaurant that bears his name with dishes that have influences from the five continents. 

The autor of this cuisine, after several years in different kitchens, has decided to define a menu full of flavours and surprises rooted in the land, tradition and culture of the Basque Country in restaurant Félix Manso Ibarla, in Irún. 

It has a tasting menu that varies daily to surprise its customers for the price of €55/person which includes 6 dishes for dinners to enjoy first persona ll the surprises that Felix Manso hides in his kitchen. 

The aesthetics and innovation in its dishes make this place unique and worth enjoying at any time.

The Komentu Maitea Restaurant is located in the former 18th century convent of Santa Isabel, which has been restored and converted into a hotel. 

It has rooms to enjoy different atmospheres where gastronomy and relaxation can be combined: dining rooms, lounges, living rooms, library, Aula Magna… It is ideal for the celebration of all kinds of events due to its size, service and quality. 

It offers varied menus made with the best raw materials where any choice will always be the right one.

La Fábrica de Juan Restaurant is located on La Arena Beach, in Zierbena, where it offers quality cuisine all year round. 

It has an extensive menu and a wine cellar capable of satisfying the most exquisite palates. We can also enjoy in the area of one of the most outstanding itineraries of surf spots of the Cantabrian coast.

The Pallottienea Restaurant is part of the Casa Pallotti Spa where, in addition to the relaxing and enjoying the Molinar Thermal Baths, you can enjoy traditional homemade food. 

The restaurant offers a menu of the day from Monday to Friday and even on weekends at competitive prices. In addition, with previous reservation offers menu of Alubiada, Txuleta and tasting of Karrantza Sheep.

Route 33 in Alegia has a cafeteria open from 5am to 12pm, with an uninterrupted kitchen. 

The establishment has a bakery, managed by Ogi Berri, where you can buy various artisan breads made in a Wood-fire oven and a delicatessen shop with the best liqueurs, wines, sausages, preserves… managed by Lukas Gourmet. 

In addition, on the upper floor you can enjoy the ethnographic museum that shows the history of the Basques in their relationship with bread and cereals, from prehistory to the 21st century, making the experience of visiting Route 33 Gourmet special.

Sansonategi Restaurant is specializes in the organization of events, weddings and business lunches thanks to its spacious dining room and terrace. It is one of the recommended locations on the most popular wedding guide portal among couples, bodas.net, and having the certification of both 2017 and 2018. 

In the restaurant you will be able to taste a traditional cuisine elaborated with first quality products, offering weekend menus.

A good place to have a coffee or celebrate a great meal (family, business, Friends…). Suharri has quality cuisine at an affordable price, along with attention that makes you feel at home. 

In addition, there are daily, weekend and special menus and, of course, a wide variety of menus.

Right in the heart of Santurtzi is Toki, comidas & copas, where you can enjoy both a relaxed family experience and a celebration thanks to its spacious dining room with capacity for 52 people. 

The customers will enjoy a good experience, adapted to their needs and tastes. 

The establishment has arranged menus, weekend menus and a menu made with top quality products.

Topa Sukaldería mixes the best of Basque and Latin American gastronomy, where Andoni Aduriz from Mugaritz makes all lovers of this fusión enjoy themselves at affordable prices. 

The place, set with a colorful mural by Judas Arrieta at its entrance, makes you escape from everything, just by setting foot in Topa Sukaldería. 

It has an extensive and surprising menu that answers the following questions: What would a Basque immigrant cook in Latin American?, How would he make his new home’s recipes his own?

Tripontzi Restaurant, located in the center of Hernani, with well-prepared traditional cuisine and good service, has a daily menu, special and tasting. Its presentation of a variety of pintxos makes it a place to repeat. 

It has capacity for 40 people where you can hold your events and meetings.

A city cider house in San Sebastian, where you can enjoy a spectacular quality traditional Donostia cuisine with steak and grilled fish, in addition, it has both daily and special menus. 

Txinparta Restaurant, located in Igara Neighbourhood, also offers its customers different areas in which to enjoy a pleasant experience in this urban cider house, large terrace, bar, dining room.

In the heart of the old part of Donostia is located Xibaris Restaurant, where you can enjoy a varied quality menu, with affordable prices. 

All their dishes are presented with great care, working the image they Project of their cuisine, essential for Xibaris both in dishes served at the table and in the decoration of the place. 

To choose Xibaris Restaurant is to choose quality, confort and good service.

Located in the municipality of Orexa in Gipuzkoa, we find this restaurant in a place that will impress you and where you can enjoy and taste the typical products of the area. 

 “Orexako Ostatua” is hidden between mountains and in a rural setting, with excellent service and attention. It offers a menu with a well presented portions and mixed dishes. An exquisite menu with products from the same area to taste.

Altzoko Ostatua is located in the small municipality of Altzo in the region of Tolosaldea in Gipuzkoa. 

 

A restaurant with a varied and quality menu where you can celebrate events such as baptisms, communions… Its homemade cuisine and local products offers menus for all tastes. Don’t miss their cheeses, sausages and potato omelettes.

Alkizako Herri Ostatus, is directed by Kepa Miranda, a hotelier wiith great culinary experience. The restaurant is born from the illusion and desire to work. 

El Ostatua de Alkiza offers quality in its creative, modern and imaginative cuisine. An extensive menu of the day and weekend menu with seasonal food in its cozy dining room. Portions, mixed dishes, pintxos and the famous bean with blood sausage and cabbage are not to be missed.

La Fonda is a family restaurant, with character and essence, located in the old town of Mundaka, on the coast of Bizkaia. 

It offers native and quality products, fish of the season and products from the orchard. 

Customer’s comfort is assured with the attentive service.

Madaixagane jatetxea is located in a rural setting in Busturia, a coastal municipality of Bizkaia, in the heart of the Urdaibai Biosphere Reserve, just in the first floor of Ekoetxea (Euskadi Biodiversity Centre). 

With Chef Lander Onaindia’s help, their proposal is based on the local seasonal product prepared with care; they are specialists in menus, especially those of the day, although they also offer special menus for groups or personalized, without forgetting the snacks that can be enjoyed on the terrace.

This Tavern of Zumárraga, is a Project of two hoteliers who have known how to adapt the offer of the establishment to the demand of a varied and plural clientele. 

From personalised menus for your events, to combined dishes, daily menu, sandwiches, hamburgers or salads, all made with fresh products, to which you must add an attractive pintxos counter. 

In his list of winners we find the prizes for the best pintxo of the town in 2015 and 2016.

This restaurant with wide spaces and different atmospheres, located in the centre of Legazpia, has a complete menu of combined dishes, rations and menus made with fresh products. There is also a takeaway service. 

The dining rooms are integrated into the bar and a light and sound “pager” will alert you when the food is already.

The restaurant located in the Hotel Bahia de Plentzia, located in an idyllic enclave next to the estuary of Plentzia, is surrounded by nature and beach and is an ideal place to enjoy its good gastronomy. 

The cuisine of the Bahía restaurant is a tribute to the flavors of the best products of the orchard, with a respectful and healthy preparation. 

In addition to the menu of the Bahia restaurant and the special weekend menu, you can enjoy a special personalized menu.

Astei Jatetxea Restaurant is surrounded by mountains and in the middle of nature, between Urdaibai and the Urkiola Natural Park. It is an ideal environment for any type of celebration, baptisms, communions, weddings, business meals…

It offers a gastronomic proposal with local products very careful and current, has a varied menu in which you can find everything from combined dishes to special menus, also noteworthy are its roasts in a wood-fired oven.

In the Old Part of Donosti we find Beharri Cider-House, an ideal place to stop and enjoy a delicious snack with quality pintxos and portions; in addition to the cider house menu, has an excellent grill, highlighting its premium txuletón.

You can accompany your menus with the traditional txotx.

Kattalin Asador has one of the most charming dinning rooms in Goierri where you can enjoy exquisite dishes of traditional Basque cuisine. 

To emphasize its specialty in roasts, grill and oven. In addition, there are large parking areas in the vicinity.

In Asteasu you will find Sarasola Sagardotegia, with a large restaurant and dining room with a capacity for up to 150 people, which offers traditional Basque cuisine. 

In the Txotx season, they prepare a typical cider house menu with cod omelette, fried cod or in sauce, steak, cheese, quince jelly and walnuts.

Since 1963, this family grill house has earned a well-deserved reputation in Orio as one of the reference points for grilling in Gipuzkoa. 

Its specialty is the seasonal fish, highlighting the sea bream and without forgetting the txuleton, all accompanied by quality homemade food. 

Its located in the centre of Orio, and with its terrace close to the grill maintains the traditional atmosphere.

In the town of Orio is Bodegón Joxe Mari, a traditional family restaurant since 1957, which offers high quality home cooking, where the grill is the absolute protagonist. Its star dishes are sea bream and txuleta.

 

In Bodegón Joxe Mari you will taste the classic recipes of a kitchen with a long trajectory behind it, being its specialty the grill.

Santa Barbara Aterpetxea is a tourist lodging with restaurant that takes up a completely renewed building next to Santa Bárbara Chapel in Urretxu.

The restaurant offers daily and weekends menu, and concerted ones for groups as well as special menus for people staying in the lodging.

Because of its location it turns out to be an alternative to keep in mind as starting or coming back point from mountain trips.

Urban Sondika Hotel, located a little further than 6 kilometres from Bilbao, has a restaurant where both guests in the hotel and those who aren´t might taste delicious Biscay gastronomy dishes.

It has a lounge bar too, redecorated with comfortable sofas which invite us to enjoy the best moment eating some pintxos or just a cup of coffee.

This family cellar is part of txakoli enthusiasts who took and active role alongside other people in the 90´s recovering native vine varieties which had disappeared from the area at the end of the 19th century due to different reasons.

Arzabro Txakolina is a marked craft character cellar. It has 3 vineyards that adds up to 14 field acres from which 80% is Hondarrabi Zuri variety and Izpiriotta Txipia (Petit Manseng) the rest.

Vineyards are located in Délika, next to the amazing Nrevión waterfall, and they are part of the Arabako Txakolina Designation of Origin.

Working their lands, they get 3 different txakolis: Ametza, Luzia de Ripa and Harria.

Asador Landa in Mendaro is a restaurant run by the brothers Juan Mari and Asier Landa, who have turned the old family inn into a cult destination for lovers of food based on produce including seafood, mushrooms and game.

 

And while the grill is at the heart of Asador Landa, the dessert is the cherry on the cake. Their home-made ice creams and desserts use ingredients like chocolate, which is traditional in this small locality in Gipuzkoa province since a family of French origin opened the Mendaro – Saint Gerons chocolate factory.

The Bost restaurant is a personal project created by the brothers Jon and Xabier Santxotena, based on their family tradition and their experience in different restaurants.

It is a place that invites you to bring your family to enjoy meat and fish dishes, but also "caseros", soups and strews like chickpeas with lobster.

The Bost offers a range of gastronomic experiences, with its "Bosteko" bowls to share between five people and snacks for more informal eating, as well as meals in a more intimate setting.  For this it has two spaces, The big Bost with room for large groups, and Txoko Bost, where cosiness rules and details are more important.

Ola Martín Berasategui is the creation of the chef from Lasarte in Bilbao.

 

Located right in Bilbao's old town, the restaurant in the Tayko Bilbao hotel is a place to enjoy “cocina con garrote” (very loosely, "cooking with flair"), as Martín Berasategui describes his food based on its ingredients: “The market decides and suggests to me a shopping basket with which to play.”

galeria.titulo: Dining room at the Ola Martín Berasategui Restaurant

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Gastrotoki La Baskula is in Bakio, just a few yards from the beach that is one of the big attractions of this seaside town.

 

La Baskula is a place that merges Basque and Catalan cooking in a menu based on seasonal produce, and naturally with a distinct flavour of the sea.

In the heart of Bilbao, a stone's throw from the Guggenheim museum, the Porrue restaurant stands out for its select ingredients. Vegetables from its own plot, local fish and meat and other "kilometre zero" produce.

 

Fusion cuisine combining seasonal Basque gastronomy with creativity and original ideas.

Traditional seasonal Basque food based on excellent ingredients.

 

Highlights among its specialities include hake cooked in different ways, beef rib and tomato salad.

A short distance from Zurriola beach in Galerna, here you can find seasonal dishes made from local produce. The restaurant works with small producers of vegetables, fresh meat and fish straight from the market.

 

Its wine list features naturally-made wines from small wineries.

Here in the heart of the Montaña Alavesa a new gastronomic concept awaits you.

 

Local, native cuisine offering a range of different options: 'pikoteo' snacks, portions, set meal, à la carte and gastronomic menu.

Atabaka Jatetxea is part of the sanctuary church of  Nuestra Señora de Oro, high up in the Zuia valley, 3.5 kilometres from Murgia.

 

Atabaka Jatetxea offers a varied, select menu which changes with the seasons.

datosContacto.direccion: Santuario de Nuestra Señora de Oro

datosGenerales.descripcion:
After heading the kitchen at the renowned Via Veneto in Barcelona, chef Sergio Humada returns to the Basque Country with a highly personal project: Casa Humada.

 

Housed in a villa on the outskirts of Lasarte-Oria, Casa Humada is not one restaurant but two.

 

On the one hand there is Txitxardin, which takes its name from the restaurant that used to occupy the building and which Humada describes clearly with the words "grill and tradition". The second project, named Shuma, is a space open to the most creative, avant-garde gastronomy.

The Mirador de Ulía restaurant is in a wonderful spot.  

 

With San Sebastián at his feet, Rubén Trincado captivates with his innovative, uninhibited cuisine, a cuisine with Basque roots that broadens its horizons with surprising twists to charm and delight diners.

Aitor Rauleaga set up his establishment opposite Trueba, and now shows off his skill in approaching a repertoire that combines flavour and memory in a restaurant bearing his name.  

Located in the Abando neighbourhood, right in the hotel of the same name.   

The "spoon dishes" (soups and stews) are always a good choice in an attractive dining room where traditional, elegantly classic, locally-rooted cookery using seasonal produce plays the starring role.

Young Julen Baz has burst onto the scene as a chef at the head of 'Garena', a personal project that brings together Basque culture and gastronomy.  

 

The ingredients, ways and stories of country life over five centuries form the pillars of a distinctive, contemporary discourse that pays homage to its ancestors.  

 

Surrounded by 11 hectares of vineyards (it makes its own txakoli) and set in the Arratia valley, it sets out to cook up new traditions.

Roberto Ruiz took over the gastronomic side of the 'Hika' txakoli winery after 25 years at 'El Frontón de Tolosa', where he became famous for his skill in cooking the tenderest, most delicious kidney beans, together with their "sacraments" of braised meat.  

 

Enjoy it all in a dining room surrounded by seven hectares of vineyards.

In this beautiful winery designed for enjoyment, the second generation of the Katxiña family, born restaurateurs, make Txakoli Katxiña white wine.

 

An authentic Basque txakoli, crisp and pleasant, the ideal accompaniment for food from the Basque coast.

 

A txakoli to appeal to the international palate: in 2021 it has won two international Gold medals, Mundus Vini and Gilbert Gallard.

Javier San Pedro Ortega is a ground-breaking winery with a youthful team that seeks to surprise and to stand out from classic Rioja wine.

 

After three years adding a personal touch to the wines of the family winery, a project was born featuring three very different ranges of wines: Cueva de Lobos, in an aromatic, modern style; the Viuda Negra range, which sets out to revive old vineyards in the area to get the highest quality out of every plot, and Anahí, a medium sweet wine created and made in homage to their mother.

 

The winery and its wine bar - with one of the finest views in the area - represent this spirit and, as well as the chance to try and buy their products, offers a tour experience created to discover their history while tasting a wide variety of wines.

Bodega Katxiña is just 10 minutes from San Sebastián, in the fishing village of Orio.

 

A welcoming garden set among green hills and vineyards, ideal for an aperitif. Fresh produce from Cantabria goes perfectly with Txakoli Katxiña white wine from the establishment's own winery.

 

Grilled meat and fish are at the core of this restaurant, and together with its authentic desserts make up some of the finest food on the Basque coast. Repsol Sol prizes and the best luxury grill restaurant in the world 2018.

Restaurante Boga Donibane est un restaurant spécialisé dans toute sorte de fruits de mer à Pasajes ou Pasaia Donibane (Guipúzcoa). Il est niché dans un petit paradis gastronomique qui rend hommage aux produits de la mer, poissons et fruits de mer dans leurs différentes variétés. 

 

Toutes sont servies dans des proportions copieuses et préparées à la plancha sur des barbecues dignes de satisfaire les palais les plus exigeants.

Kea Basque Fine Food is located in the centre of Vitoria-Gasteiz, next to the Teatro Principal and very close to Florida Park.

 

Renowned for the quality of its products, its good execution and its service, this urban restaurant offers traditional Basque dishes with a modern twist.

Located in the town of Tolosa, the Ama restaurant started out as a bar serving pintxos made with local products.

Today, Javi Rivero and Gorka Rico still have the same philosophy, as one of their objectives is to use the environment as a showcase: local farmers, fishermen and livestock breeders are their suppliers.

It has 5 tables and offers a tasting menu that changes according to seasonal produce.

La Despensa de Etxanobe is the most classic restaurant of chefs Fernando Canales and Mikel Población.

 

Located in the centre of Bilbao, prioritising flavour, but without neglecting presentation. Its dishes reflect traditional Basque gastronomy in an elegant and sophisticated way.

 

In an intimate setting and accompanied by modern music, they also have a large wine cellar.
Opened in 1962, and not only offering a history of local gastronomy, but located in a building that is two centuries old and with a cave.

datosContacto.direccion: Calle de Mateo Benigno de Moraza, 9

datosGenerales.descripcion:
Very close to the town of Elciego, the winery is built in a functional building where the winemaking, bottling, wine rack and barrel room are located. It is a small winery with an exclusive production process.

 

All their wine comes from grapes grown on their own estate. They grow three grape varieties: Tempranillo, Garnacha and Graciano.

 

They offer tastings and guided tours.

The Bideona winery is located in Rioja Alavesa, in the municipality of Villabuena de Álava. With more than 300 vineyard plots, they make their own wines that reflect their origins in the historic vineyards of Rioja Alavesa.

 

At Bideona they work to contribute to the economic and environmental sustainability of the area.The winery has its own shop, Wine Bar and wine tasting.

 

Bideona is part of the Rioja Alavesa Wine Route.

Bergarako Batzokia Jatetxea is a traditional Basque restaurant based on fresh, seasonal products.

It offers grilled meats and desserts made entirely in the restaurant.

They also prepare vegan and allergen-friendly dishes. It includes a takeaway service.

In summer there is a terrace.
